 For more information, please call Bob Wallace at 02 9091 8212. Balance Recruitment is committed to equal opportunity employment.  We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of the community to apply for this role.

title: Retail Data Analyst
description:
Pacific Magazines is transforming from a magazines company to a content powerhouse. We have gone from publishing in months with print to publishing in moments across social, digital, apps and events.
We are currently looking for a Retail Data Analyst to join the team. Based in Eveleigh and reporting to the Head of Circulation, you will understand the business’ strategic direction to shape decisions and generate innovative ideas. This role
          would suit a recent graduate or someone looking to start their career in this field. 
As Retail Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:

Data analysis and reporting
Allocation strategy and reviewing allocation efficiencies
Project/ad-hoc analysis support
Forecasting and budget planning
Administrative reporting duties.
Delivering a high level of efficiency and accuracy whilst juggling multiple tasks.
Assisting with the administration on the Pacific Magazines' Newsagent loyalty program website
Analysing promotional effectiveness

To be successful in this role, you will have: 

Strong and creative analytical skills
High level of written and oral communication
Advanced Excel skills
Microsoft Office Suite proficiency is essential
Experience with Microstrategy Business Intelligence Software would be viewed favourably.
Website administration would be viewed favourably.
Tertiary qualifications in Business or related degree or nearing completion of studies desirable.

If you're ready for the opportunity to work in a fun, fast, creative environment in one of the country's most progressive organisations, with the scope to take your career to the next level and beyond, please apply now via the link below:
http://sevenwestmedia.com.au/careers
At Pacific Magazines our mantra is 'we build the brands people love' and we pride ourselves on being Australia's most innovative publisher across mass women's, men's, lifestyle and youth titles, and associated products in the print and digital
          spaces.
Pacific Magazines is part of the Seven West Media Group, a market-leading Australian multi-platform media business active in broadcast television, magazine publishing, content generation and e-commerce and a dominant force in all the categories
          in which we operate. Be part of our journey.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Join a team that is redesigning banking in order to power our clients to live their best life. To continue our growth, we’re inviting innovative people with a passion for developing commercially focused analytical solutions to join our team.
If you are someone keen to join the analytics community and help us to create, maintain and drive a world-class analytical capability which helps to support our Risk Management function within the Macquarie Group then we would love to hear from
          you.
In this role you can lead, develop and deliver analytics assets end to end, which includes stakeholder management, project management, hands-on work, managing and supervision of other team members and developing / upskilling team members as appropriate.
Analytics assets will vary from interactive dashboards, scorecards, segmentation to deep learning data science models. You can work with relevant teams to automate or industrialise where appropriate.
You’ll bring with you, a prior education in Statistics, Engineering, Maths, Computer Science, Finance, Marketing, Economics or another relevant quantitative discipline and ideally have experience working in an analytics capability.
You will need to be business focused and enjoy building rapport with a wide range of stakeholders from across the organisation. The role will give you the opportunity to work and learn from an established team where you will work collaboratively
          to find solutions and provide optimal results for the business. As such, you will need to be able to communicate these to the business in both a technical and non-technical way.
The role will give you the opportunity to show your experience in using several data analysis tools such as SQL/Hive, Alteryx; scripting languages such as SQL, R, S-Plus, VBA, SAS, Python and experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau,
          Power BI and so on. 
You will also bring prior experience in big data infrastructures and technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark and can help structure data to support analytics as well creating business transformation layers are important.
If this sounds like you then please apply via the link below.
Risk Management Group is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Credit, Prudential, Capital and Markets, Market Risk, Operational Risk,
          Compliance, Quantitative Applications and Internal Audit.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common
          is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
My client is a leading organisation in the public sector, who are based in the heart of the Sydney CBD. They are currently looking for an experienced Data Quality Analyst for an initial 2 month contract offering an immediate start. 
The Role
The primary focus of this role will be to remediate issues with the organisation's data quality. This will involve identifying root causes of data quality issues, suggesting enhancements to business systems and documenting consistent data quality
          standards for the organisation. Skills and Experience

Experience with manipulating data within Microsoft CRM databases
Previously establishment data quality standards
Proven and demonstrated experience with SQL Server; Microsift CRM Databases; and Relational databases

If you wish to apply for this position, please do not hesitate; submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button.
For further information please contact Dylan Sheoshker at Clicks IT Recruitment on 02 9200 4425, quoting DS61799.

title: Principal Analyst/Data Sceintist
description:
Our client, a large QLD Government organisation, is currently sourcing a Principal Analyst/Data Scientist who will be required to work closely with a small team to set up the Data Sharing and Analytics function for Queensland Government. The position
          will be responsible for providing a high level of data analysis, sharing and analytics services to both the team and the broader Queensland Government.  This Data Sharing and Analytics Office will focus on building capability in internal
          to government information sharing, data science and data analytics.  As a Principal Analyst you will: 

Contribute to the development and implementation of government wide analysis, data sharing and analytics.
Devise new and innovative state-wide products to improve organisational and operational performance, develop strategy and plans and drive operational activity and policy setting.
Lead the development and implementation of government wide analysis and analytics.
Perform expert analysis and data sharing activities across government departments and with partner agencies using advanced analytics modelling, analysis techniques, tools and standards.
Write comprehensive and professional analytical reports for a range of audiences and design and deliver innovative analytics and data sharing presentations
Work with government and external stakeholders and partners to define their analytical requirements. Provide support to government departments in the development and delivery of their analytics and data sharing products.

Your capabilities 

Be highly experienced in using a range of data/intelligence/information analysis and visualisation software i.e. Qlik tableau, GIS, spot fire, excel, access and others.
Able to identify patents and trends in large/big data sets. Make predictions, make recommendations, analyse statistical information and qualitative information to solve problems and make recommendation
Data mining skills - to analyse and profile multiple big data sets from within and outside of government
Write accurate analytical reports based on data/intelligence/information analysis giving key findings, inferences, predictions and recommendations
Evidence skills and experience in producing a range of complex analytical products to create innovative solutions and meet changing needs.
Demonstrate experience in developing new analytical products and methodology, using new and unique data sets.
Demonstrate experience in using a range of data sharing and analytics software to improve business performance and organisational outcomes.
Provide experience of providing advice in relation to data, analytics and analysis
Show highly advanced written and verbal communication skills to be able to produce a range of types of complex reports to a varied audience, adapting style to suit needs.

Must have 

Experience building Machine learning models
Experience in Goverment Regulatory compliance,

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below quoting Ref No. 4A/22153. Alternatively please contact Tim Smith for further details on 07 32588453 or email Timothy.smith@hudson.com

title: Payroll Data Analyst
description:
The Opportunity
The Payroll Data Analyst role will be responsible for the administration, setup and reporting of payroll systems.  Your new role will see you working closely with the Remuneration and Benefits Manager and payroll team to ensure accuracy and
          full system testing for both the payroll and time and attendance solutions.
The Company
We are a proudly South Australian family business, operating for over 30 years. Our story began in 1984, when Fred (Fathi) Shahin saw a local Woodville Park service station for sale with an adjoining home and immediately bought it.  Each
          of Fred Shahin’s sons subsequently joined the business and to this day, the same family-based, ethical and sustainable values remain a hallmark of Peregrine and underpin every decision.
Peregrine Corporation is now the largest private company in South Australia with over 3500 employees and it continues to grow. Our excellence in retail operations is recognised at an international level, with high profile Company brands including
          On The Run convenience stores and Smokemart & GiftBox outlets.
For more information about Peregrine please visit our website www.peregrine.com.au
Key responsibilities include:

Review current time and attendance system settings and advise accordingly
Assistance with the maintenance of the time and attendance and payroll system
Analysis of results to deliver findings on configuration issues and potential training gaps
Participate in cross training of all team members in system, Awards and critical tasks
Coordinate required reporting between IT, Payroll, Finance and HR to ensure timely and accurate flow of information

The successful candidate will possess:

Tertiary qualification in related field or significant payroll experience
The ability to interpret and explain numerous Awards and Agreements
Working knowledge of current payroll legislation
Experience in systems testing and data analysis
Excellent communication skills and the desire to create and drive a continuous improvement culture

What’s in it for you?
Working at our Norwood based head office, you will have the opportunity to join a fast paced, growth focused organisation and take the important next step in your career.  This is your opportunity to join a large SA based organisation with
          a National footprint, you will be offered real career growth and a challenging, rewarding environment.
If you believe you fit this role please submit your CV and Cover Letter by clicking the 'apply now' button below.
Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Customer Data Analyst
description:
This organisation has a reputation for doing great work, they are known for growing people's careers by adding tremendous amounts of value to their skillset and experience. 
We are looking for professionals who have a fascination with large scale customer data, someone who has the brain to be creative and not only gain CX insight but assist the company on its growth trajectory. 
Responsibilities:

Obtain a deep understanding of customer behavior through data exploration and make recommendations on optimizing conversion funnel and user retention

Research, propose and build customer segmentation models

Perform deep-dives to analyze problems, identify opportunities and suggest experiments based on findings
Own reporting processes for marketing business partners
Own data accuracy and integrity

Preferred Qualifications:

2+ years of relevant experience in marketing analytics
Bachelors in Business, Statistics, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline

Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Salesforce.


The job perks here are endless here, the management team is empathic and compassionate, the technology roadmap is stacked and you'll be required to work hard for all the great things listed, although work from home is encouraged, as is a
          healthy work-life balance.
E. jason@blackroc.co

title: Data Analyst - APS4
description:

        and reporting processes across the National Complaints Resolution and Review Branch. This will ensure compliance with key performance indicators and other performance measures.Responsibilities include:

Assisting with potential process improvements and analysing key data associated with process improvements
Qualifications:

Previous experience with SAS will be highly regarded

title: Data Analyst/Data Modeller
description:

        and implementation of dataflows and data automation processes to support development of a single source of truth datawarehouse.o   This includes the building, updating and amending of tables, views and datamarts, taking into
        account both back-end organisation and front-end accessibility for end users (technical and non-technical).·        Automation and scheduling of data management and data quality processes, ensuring appropriate
        data dictionaries and documentation to transition to other staff members into business as usual. This includes development of data standards, procedures and definitions.·        Change management and
        impact assessment of data quality and provision from upstream systems changes and other projects initiated from within the team.o   Actively identify and implement improvements to the sourcing and accuracy of data.o   Identify
        sourcing and integration new potential external data sources.·        Delivery of business analytics, business intelligence and ad-hoc analysis as required.·        Dependent
        on the candidate's capabilities, potential involvement in data analytical modelling, data visualisation and complex data product provision projects.Key Criteria:·        Degree qualified in a computing or quantitative discipline.·        Business analysis, facilitation and sound project management skills. ·        Applied programing skills in SQL and SAS, including the automation of data management and data quality processes.·        Experience of working in an organisation with a mature data management and reporting environment and processes, allowing insight into what works and doesn't work. ·        Experience of working in an organisation with data and analytics teams split into structured with     functional responsibilities. ·        Exposure to R, AWS, Oracle and Tableau will be looked favorably upon.If you would be interested in this role please submit your cover letter & CV in Word format only        by clicking the "APPLY NOW" button below or anna.au@talentinternational.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
Assist in the storage, preparation and maintenance of data sets.
Produce timely analysis and visualisation support for the Financial Markets Group.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with undergraduate qualifications in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science or other similar field to join the Data Analysis Team within our Financial Markets Group.  
Financial Markets Group is responsible for implementing the Reserve Bank’s operations in domestic and foreign exchange markets, monitoring developments in financial markets and coordinating the Reserve Bank’s relationships with international institutions.
This role is suitable for those with experience in data collection and management, programming and business intelligence tools, working with databases, an understanding of data science and an interest in streamlining and automating processes.
In this role you will:

Provide timely data and visualisation support, with respect to preparing and storing data and transforming/manipulating to prepare graphs.
Assist in the analysis, design and develop solutions for automation and/or streamlining of core business process.
Transform data using analytical tools and coding such as Excel, R, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to the Group's data assets.
Work with business stakeholders to identify core requirements and identify areas of risk to business continuity.
Participate in related projects for data collections, reporting and system enhancements including, but not limited to, requirements gathering, data mapping and testing. 

The successful applicant will:

Have a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science (or working towards)
Be comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics software
Be familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R and SQL
Have critical thinking and problem solving skills, and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally both in writing and orally with a detail oriented focus.
 The ability to collaborate effectively within a team who can work independently and well with others.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a  difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.
 
 
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

$138,000 plus super
Geelong Location
Manufacturing
Data Dashboard

          to the business.

You will partner with key business leaders and technology stakeholders.  The main focus will be to deliver dashboards for one of the key strategic initiatives in the turnaround. You will work across multiple streams of work within human
              resources and cost centres.  Establishing a new Operating Model & ways of working, redefine key Master Data Elements & Business Rules, implementing new Integrated Business Planning tools and Optimising Inventory and labour costs.
Under direction of senior management, you will:


Lead the definition, building and implementation of key business dashboards


Work closely with the Group IT stakeholders to source data from multiple sources


Conduct any required data analysis to validate data accuracy & processing required


Model data as required for use in defined dashboards/reports


Build, test & implement required dashboards & reports within agreed timeframes

To be successful in this role we are looking for candidates who can demonstrate the following:


Previous experience managing large volumes of data, cross functionally


Strong modelling & presentation skills using Tableau


Previous experience using Big Data tools, SQL & Google Cloud Platform


An understanding of the project management life cycle, showing initiative, flexibility and innovative thinking


Please call Lorraine Tribe on 0418361121 for more information or send a CV by hitting the apply now button below

description:
Verse Group is working with a digital solution team based in Perth with a long history of supporting clients with their SaaS offering. They are looking for a passionate BI Developer and Data Analyst to join their dynamic team on a contract basis

 Proactively monitoring incoming data and picking up on errors swiftly and accurately Share knowledge with other members of the team and ensure data is being inputted correctly Troubleshoot and resolve any issues or errors with the collection

title: Data Analyst
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people
          in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking a Data Analyst to augment our Transportation client’s project delivering real time data to C-Level executives. Joining us on an initial 3-month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be building and implementing statistical models as well as using predictive modelling to increase end user satisfaction.            
This will include:

Build / Construct statistical models / databases
Use data modelling practices to analyse your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes;
Collect, analyse and establish trending patterns for train performance data
Analyse performance success of initiatives, identify key learnings and assess impact of changes on performance, reliability and customer experience
Regularly report to the Executive on network performance demonstrating a clear understanding for performance while identifying opportunities for improvement through the use of Microsoft Power BI or other analysis platform

 
To successfully deliver this project you will have experience with: 

5+ years’ experience in a data quality focused role 
Extremely meticulous in approach to work 
Outstanding attention to detail 
Experienced in query optimisation and performance tuning for OLTP and Date Warehouse 
Knowledge of Data Architecture (conceptual, logical, physical, transactional, dimensional, and Star/Snowflake modeling) 
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential 
Ability to write technical documentation materials 
Experience in banking or financial services preferred 
Working Python knowledge is a plus

 This is a consultative role, so clear communication skills as well as previous consulting skills will be highly regarded.      We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want
          team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading
          technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration fees, and have access to discounted training
          and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity
          in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any
          arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381947.

title: Data Analyst
description:
US based financial organisation needs talented data analyst to work on a large Data Transformation initiative. Will work with a variety of technologies including: Microsoft SQL (Scripting), .Net (Windows Services, Web Services), SOAP
        UI, Oracle, and Linux Scripting.  Job Description:

Providing the daily operations support for the company's processing applications systems.
Accessing Production data on a daily basis to extract information or support business units.
Participate in project related tasks defined within the approved project plans: User Acceptance Testing (test plans/strategy), Joint Testing, Implementation and Live Verification.
 Requirements: 

Strong MS SQL and Oracle
Excellent Communication skills
Strong Data Analytics
C# and .Net knowledge a plus 
 For more information, please call Bob Wallace at 02 9091 8212. Balance Recruitment is committed to equal opportunity employment.  We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of the community to apply for this role.

title: Retail Data Analyst
description:
Pacific Magazines is transforming from a magazines company to a content powerhouse. We have gone from publishing in months with print to publishing in moments across social, digital, apps and events.
We are currently looking for a Retail Data Analyst to join the team. Based in Eveleigh and reporting to the Head of Circulation, you will understand the business’ strategic direction to shape decisions and generate innovative ideas. This role
          would suit a recent graduate or someone looking to start their career in this field. 
As Retail Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:

Data analysis and reporting
Allocation strategy and reviewing allocation efficiencies
Project/ad-hoc analysis support
Forecasting and budget planning
Administrative reporting duties.
Delivering a high level of efficiency and accuracy whilst juggling multiple tasks.
Assisting with the administration on the Pacific Magazines' Newsagent loyalty program website
Analysing promotional effectiveness

To be successful in this role, you will have: 

Strong and creative analytical skills
High level of written and oral communication
Advanced Excel skills
Microsoft Office Suite proficiency is essential
Experience with Microstrategy Business Intelligence Software would be viewed favourably.
Website administration would be viewed favourably.
Tertiary qualifications in Business or related degree or nearing completion of studies desirable.

If you're ready for the opportunity to work in a fun, fast, creative environment in one of the country's most progressive organisations, with the scope to take your career to the next level and beyond, please apply now via the link below:
http://sevenwestmedia.com.au/careers
At Pacific Magazines our mantra is 'we build the brands people love' and we pride ourselves on being Australia's most innovative publisher across mass women's, men's, lifestyle and youth titles, and associated products in the print and digital
          spaces.
Pacific Magazines is part of the Seven West Media Group, a market-leading Australian multi-platform media business active in broadcast television, magazine publishing, content generation and e-commerce and a dominant force in all the categories
          in which we operate. Be part of our journey.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Join a team that is redesigning banking in order to power our clients to live their best life. To continue our growth, we’re inviting innovative people with a passion for developing commercially focused analytical solutions to join our team.
If you are someone keen to join the analytics community and help us to create, maintain and drive a world-class analytical capability which helps to support our Risk Management function within the Macquarie Group then we would love to hear from
          you.
In this role you can lead, develop and deliver analytics assets end to end, which includes stakeholder management, project management, hands-on work, managing and supervision of other team members and developing / upskilling team members as appropriate.
Analytics assets will vary from interactive dashboards, scorecards, segmentation to deep learning data science models. You can work with relevant teams to automate or industrialise where appropriate.
You’ll bring with you, a prior education in Statistics, Engineering, Maths, Computer Science, Finance, Marketing, Economics or another relevant quantitative discipline and ideally have experience working in an analytics capability.
You will need to be business focused and enjoy building rapport with a wide range of stakeholders from across the organisation. The role will give you the opportunity to work and learn from an established team where you will work collaboratively
          to find solutions and provide optimal results for the business. As such, you will need to be able to communicate these to the business in both a technical and non-technical way.
The role will give you the opportunity to show your experience in using several data analysis tools such as SQL/Hive, Alteryx; scripting languages such as SQL, R, S-Plus, VBA, SAS, Python and experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau,
          Power BI and so on. 
You will also bring prior experience in big data infrastructures and technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark and can help structure data to support analytics as well creating business transformation layers are important.
If this sounds like you then please apply via the link below.
Risk Management Group is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Credit, Prudential, Capital and Markets, Market Risk, Operational Risk,
          Compliance, Quantitative Applications and Internal Audit.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common
          is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
My client is a leading organisation in the public sector, who are based in the heart of the Sydney CBD. They are currently looking for an experienced Data Quality Analyst for an initial 2 month contract offering an immediate start. 
The Role
The primary focus of this role will be to remediate issues with the organisation's data quality. This will involve identifying root causes of data quality issues, suggesting enhancements to business systems and documenting consistent data quality
          standards for the organisation. Skills and Experience

Experience with manipulating data within Microsoft CRM databases
Previously establishment data quality standards
Proven and demonstrated experience with SQL Server; Microsift CRM Databases; and Relational databases

If you wish to apply for this position, please do not hesitate; submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button.
For further information please contact Dylan Sheoshker at Clicks IT Recruitment on 02 9200 4425, quoting DS61799.

title: Principal Analyst/Data Sceintist
description:
Our client, a large QLD Government organisation, is currently sourcing a Principal Analyst/Data Scientist who will be required to work closely with a small team to set up the Data Sharing and Analytics function for Queensland Government. The position
          will be responsible for providing a high level of data analysis, sharing and analytics services to both the team and the broader Queensland Government.  This Data Sharing and Analytics Office will focus on building capability in internal
          to government information sharing, data science and data analytics.  As a Principal Analyst you will: 

Contribute to the development and implementation of government wide analysis, data sharing and analytics.
Devise new and innovative state-wide products to improve organisational and operational performance, develop strategy and plans and drive operational activity and policy setting.
Lead the development and implementation of government wide analysis and analytics.
Perform expert analysis and data sharing activities across government departments and with partner agencies using advanced analytics modelling, analysis techniques, tools and standards.
Write comprehensive and professional analytical reports for a range of audiences and design and deliver innovative analytics and data sharing presentations
Work with government and external stakeholders and partners to define their analytical requirements. Provide support to government departments in the development and delivery of their analytics and data sharing products.

Your capabilities 

Be highly experienced in using a range of data/intelligence/information analysis and visualisation software i.e. Qlik tableau, GIS, spot fire, excel, access and others.
Able to identify patents and trends in large/big data sets. Make predictions, make recommendations, analyse statistical information and qualitative information to solve problems and make recommendation
Data mining skills - to analyse and profile multiple big data sets from within and outside of government
Write accurate analytical reports based on data/intelligence/information analysis giving key findings, inferences, predictions and recommendations
Evidence skills and experience in producing a range of complex analytical products to create innovative solutions and meet changing needs.
Demonstrate experience in developing new analytical products and methodology, using new and unique data sets.
Demonstrate experience in using a range of data sharing and analytics software to improve business performance and organisational outcomes.
Provide experience of providing advice in relation to data, analytics and analysis
Show highly advanced written and verbal communication skills to be able to produce a range of types of complex reports to a varied audience, adapting style to suit needs.

Must have 

Experience building Machine learning models
Experience in Goverment Regulatory compliance,

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below quoting Ref No. 4A/22153. Alternatively please contact Tim Smith for further details on 07 32588453 or email Timothy.smith@hudson.com

title: Payroll Data Analyst
description:
The Opportunity
The Payroll Data Analyst role will be responsible for the administration, setup and reporting of payroll systems.  Your new role will see you working closely with the Remuneration and Benefits Manager and payroll team to ensure accuracy and
          full system testing for both the payroll and time and attendance solutions.
The Company
We are a proudly South Australian family business, operating for over 30 years. Our story began in 1984, when Fred (Fathi) Shahin saw a local Woodville Park service station for sale with an adjoining home and immediately bought it.  Each
          of Fred Shahin’s sons subsequently joined the business and to this day, the same family-based, ethical and sustainable values remain a hallmark of Peregrine and underpin every decision.
Peregrine Corporation is now the largest private company in South Australia with over 3500 employees and it continues to grow. Our excellence in retail operations is recognised at an international level, with high profile Company brands including
          On The Run convenience stores and Smokemart & GiftBox outlets.
For more information about Peregrine please visit our website www.peregrine.com.au
Key responsibilities include:

Review current time and attendance system settings and advise accordingly
Assistance with the maintenance of the time and attendance and payroll system
Analysis of results to deliver findings on configuration issues and potential training gaps
Participate in cross training of all team members in system, Awards and critical tasks
Coordinate required reporting between IT, Payroll, Finance and HR to ensure timely and accurate flow of information

The successful candidate will possess:

Tertiary qualification in related field or significant payroll experience
The ability to interpret and explain numerous Awards and Agreements
Working knowledge of current payroll legislation
Experience in systems testing and data analysis
Excellent communication skills and the desire to create and drive a continuous improvement culture

What’s in it for you?
Working at our Norwood based head office, you will have the opportunity to join a fast paced, growth focused organisation and take the important next step in your career.  This is your opportunity to join a large SA based organisation with
          a National footprint, you will be offered real career growth and a challenging, rewarding environment.
If you believe you fit this role please submit your CV and Cover Letter by clicking the 'apply now' button below.
Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

title: Customer Data Analyst
description:
This organisation has a reputation for doing great work, they are known for growing people's careers by adding tremendous amounts of value to their skillset and experience. 
We are looking for professionals who have a fascination with large scale customer data, someone who has the brain to be creative and not only gain CX insight but assist the company on its growth trajectory. 
Responsibilities:

Drive marketing data analysis and reporting projects covering user acquisition, CRM engagement marketing, ground marketing and PR.
Obtain a deep understanding of customer behavior through data exploration and make recommendations on optimizing conversion funnel and user retention
Research, propose and build user acquisition channel attribution models to enable more accurate measurement of channel impact
Research, propose and build customer segmentation models
Build and customer lifetime value prediction models
Perform deep-dives to analyze problems, identify opportunities and suggest experiments based on findings
Own reporting processes for marketing business partners
Own data accuracy and integrity

Preferred Qualifications:

2+ years of relevant experience in marketing analytics
Bachelors in Business, Statistics, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline
Experience with statistical analysis and experiment design

Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Salesforce.


The job perks here are endless here, the management team is empathic and compassionate, the technology roadmap is stacked and you'll be required to work hard for all the great things listed, although work from home is encouraged, as is a
          healthy work-life balance.
E. jason@blackroc.co
L. https://au.linkedin.com/in/jasonwroulston

title: Data Analyst - APS4
description:
Our client, a major Geelong based federal employer, is seeking a Data Analyst to assist with customer resolutions. In this role you will  will provide support to help develop and maintain performance monitoring
        and reporting processes across the National Complaints Resolution and Review Branch. This will ensure compliance with key performance indicators and other performance measures.Responsibilities include:

Developing and implementing data collection systems and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and data quality
High level data analytics and reporting which will include interpreting data, analysing the results and using basic statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases and datasets on staff performance
Coordinate and drive all site reporting requirements
Coordinate and drive internal quality assurance processes including sample audit programs and reports on service delivery quality trend analysis, communities of practice and outcomes analysis
Assisting with potential process improvements and analysing key data associated with process improvements
Qualifications:

High level data analytics and reporting capabilities.
Interpreting data and analysing results using basic statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports


Previous experience with SAS will be highly regarded
Police checks will be required for all successful candidates and dependent on the role the appropriate working with children and/or vulnerable people checks may need to be undertaken. Please note: The
        client has requested that all candidates must have Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency.

title: Data Analyst/Data Modeller
description:
Data Analyst/Data ModellerCBD12 Months Contract Talent International is working in partnership with a large government organisation to assist in sourcing a 'Data Analyst'.Key Responsibilities:·        Design
        and implementation of dataflows and data automation processes to support development of a single source of truth datawarehouse.o   This includes the building, updating and amending of tables, views and datamarts, taking into
        account both back-end organisation and front-end accessibility for end users (technical and non-technical).·        Automation and scheduling of data management and data quality processes, ensuring appropriate
        data dictionaries and documentation to transition to other staff members into business as usual. This includes development of data standards, procedures and definitions.·        Change management and
        impact assessment of data quality and provision from upstream systems changes and other projects initiated from within the team.o   Actively identify and implement improvements to the sourcing and accuracy of data.o   Identify
        sourcing and integration new potential external data sources.·        Delivery of business analytics, business intelligence and ad-hoc analysis as required.·        Dependent
        on the candidate's capabilities, potential involvement in data analytical modelling, data visualisation and complex data product provision projects.Key Criteria:·        Degree qualified in a computing or quantitative discipline.·        Business analysis, facilitation and sound project management skills. ·        Applied programing skills in SQL and SAS, including the automation of data management and data quality processes.·        Experience of working in an organisation with a mature data management and reporting environment and processes, allowing insight into what works and doesn't work. ·        Experience of working in an organisation with data and analytics teams split into structured with     functional responsibilities. ·        Exposure to R, AWS, Oracle and Tableau will be looked favorably upon.If you would be interested in this role please submit your cover letter & CV in Word format only        by clicking the "APPLY NOW" button below or anna.au@talentinternational.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
Assist in the storage, preparation and maintenance of data sets.
Produce timely analysis and visualisation support for the Financial Markets Group.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with undergraduate qualifications in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science or other similar field to join the Data Analysis Team within our Financial Markets Group.  
Financial Markets Group is responsible for implementing the Reserve Bank’s operations in domestic and foreign exchange markets, monitoring developments in financial markets and coordinating the Reserve Bank’s relationships with international institutions.
This role is suitable for those with experience in data collection and management, programming and business intelligence tools, working with databases, an understanding of data science and an interest in streamlining and automating processes.
In this role you will:

Provide timely data and visualisation support, with respect to preparing and storing data and transforming/manipulating to prepare graphs.
Assist in the analysis, design and develop solutions for automation and/or streamlining of core business process.
Transform data using analytical tools and coding such as Excel, R, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to the Group's data assets.
Work with business stakeholders to identify core requirements and identify areas of risk to business continuity.
Participate in related projects for data collections, reporting and system enhancements including, but not limited to, requirements gathering, data mapping and testing. 

The successful applicant will:

Have a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science (or working towards)
Be comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics software
Be familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R and SQL
Have critical thinking and problem solving skills, and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally both in writing and orally with a detail oriented focus.
 The ability to collaborate effectively within a team who can work independently and well with others.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a  difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.
 
 
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Data Analyst-Capital Market
description:
ABOUT US
We are focused on offering IT consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions and services. We have a team of consultants who are experts in Banking and Financial Services, Health and Insurance, Automotive, Defense, Aerospace and Security, Energy,
          Semiconductors, Retail and Consumer Sector who help our clients remain up to date to changing technologies in their domain and remain ahead of competition, grow quickly and become more profitable.
Our operation is spread across United States, United Kingdom and Asia Pacific markets enabling clients to get access to expert local talent for their technological solutions and bringing cost advantages on hiring local talent and building a diversified
          talent pool.
 We are a trusted partner to several Multinational Companies globally for managing their end-to-end Product Life Cycle and enhancing business processes.
ABOUT OUR CLIENT
Our client is one of the leading Information, Communications and Technology (ICT) Company providing world-class business consulting, information technology and communication services and has development and delivery centre’s across the globe serving
          several Fortune 500 companies.
Our client is a provider of financial technology products, legacy modernization services and consulting for core banking, corporate banking, wealth & asset management and insurance.
 
Data Analyst-Capital Market 
Work Location: Sydney
Duration:  12 months with possible extensions
Experience Level: 5+ Years of Experience.
Job Requirements:

Front Office (with any trade data error related queries).
Middle Office (Data setup and reload errors).
Performance Reporting (Missing or incorrect data feeds)

 
Key skills:

Capital Market Domain expertise.
Strong communication skills.
Strong data analytical skills

 
Interested candidates please share your resume to Ashwin- anzteam@innovat.com.au

title: Data Analyst - Geelong
description:
$138,000 plus super
Geelong Location
Manufacturing
Data Dashboard
 6 months Contract

Our client is a high profile manufacturing organisation located in Geelong
Growth within their business has created the need for a  for a Data Analyst to join them in a challenging project for approximately 6 months 
Responsibilities are varied and include labour cost reporting, data dashboard analysis, and quantitative surveys.
Its an exciting role encouraging your passion for innovative analysis, and driving strategy.
This role will work closely with Human Resources and Business Improvement and Management teams responsible for development of strategy within the organisation, where you can demonstrate company effectiveness and provide actionable intelligence
          to the business. 
Key Responsibilities:


This role exists to drive delivery of end to end business reporting, dashboard building and analytics  and is ideally suited to a  business analyst with experience in data visualisation
You will partner with key business leaders and technology stakeholders.  The main focus will be to deliver dashboards for one of the key strategic initiatives in the turnaround. You will work across multiple streams of work within human
              resources and cost centres.  Establishing a new Operating Model & ways of working, redefine key Master Data Elements & Business Rules, implementing new Integrated Business Planning tools and Optimising Inventory and labour costs.
Under direction of senior management, you will:


Lead the definition, building and implementation of key business dashboards


Work closely with the Group IT stakeholders to source data from multiple sources


Conduct any required data analysis to validate data accuracy & processing required


Model data as required for use in defined dashboards/reports


Build, test & implement required dashboards & reports within agreed timeframes


Role Requirements:


To be successful in this role we are looking for candidates who can demonstrate the following:


Previous experience managing large volumes of data, cross functionally


Strong modelling & presentation skills using Tableau


Previous experience using Big Data tools, SQL & Google Cloud Platform


An understanding of the project management life cycle, showing initiative, flexibility and innovative thinking


Please call Lorraine Tribe on 0418361121 for more information or send a CV by hitting the apply now button below

title: Contract :: Junior / Mid Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau) :: Sydney :: Market Rates
description:
Contract Junior / Mid SQL Data Analyst :: Sydney :: Initial 2 months but extensions likely.  Leading niche marketing analytics consultancy is looking to hire a Junior / Mid-Level SQL Data Analyst for an initial 2-month contract
        that is likely to be extended by another 4 months. This opportunity would suit candidates with 1-5 years commercial experience who are immediately available to start project work in the Sydney CBD region. Working both internally and on client
        site all candidates must be confident communicators and being able to work confidently alongside more senior stakeholders. Candidates on working holiday VISA’s accepted The main roles and responsibilities for this contract Junior / Mid-Level SQL Data Analyst position are highlighted below 

Working with an end client gather data using SQL from Marketing Campaign Lists and run reports
Greenfield Tableau Dashboard development. Currently all reporting is undertaken via Excel. The project is transfer the visualisation into clear, presentable Tableau Dashboards.
 The main skills and experience needed for this opportunity is highlighted below 

At least 1 year’s commercial experience with SQL and Tableau in a commercial environment
MS SQL experience
Tableau dashboard development experience
MS Excel
Experience within a marketing / media background will be highly advantageous but not essential
Experience with Power-BI Is a highly advantageous and would allow the successful candidate to work on another simultaneous project
 Please send your resume in the first instance

title: Data Analyst - NSW Government
description:
Our client is looking to appoint a Data Analyst with experience in data migration modelling and a minimum of 3-5 years experience with data in licencing and registration system data models/You will support the business by working on the
          development and implementation of licensing and registration systems and the migration of existing systems to new systems.  Key Skills

Data modelling
Minimum 3-5 years experience with data in licencing and registration system data models
Data cleansing and/or enrichment
Data mapping
Experience with payment data models and/or system (not essential)
Understanding of Siebel databases 
Database set up and installation 
Mapping and loading of extracts into database (if required) 
Writing SQL queries to retrieve, join and construct data 
Providing data analysis and recommendations 
User acceptance testing 
 For more information please Apply Now or contact Danielle on 8296 9826 or danielle@ashdownpeople.com.au

title: Data Analyst
description:
Verse Group is working with a digital solution team based in Perth with a long history of supporting clients with their SaaS offering. They are looking for a passionate BI Developer and Data Analyst to join their dynamic team on a contract basis
          of 3 -6 months upgrading their BI platforms to Power BI.   Responsibilities: Streamlining and maintaining data collection procedures and implementing tools to improve the efficacy of collecting and connecting
          data.   Combining a variety of different data sources into reports and data sets to support accurate and timely decision making.   Developing SQL/PowerBI reporting tools and dashboards to:
          
Monitor and analyse sales;
Prepare forecasts and inventories;
Manage production and supply chain details;
Monitor customer digital journey;
Various other ad hoc reporting.
 Proactively monitoring incoming data and picking up on errors swiftly and accurately Share knowledge with other members of the team and ensure data is being inputted correctly Troubleshoot and resolve any issues or errors with the collection
          or processing of data   Skills & Experience: The successful candidate should:
          
Be highly organized, analytical, and pay attention to detail.
Display a high degree of autonomy, and the ability to formulate, propose and implement long-term solutions.
A high degree of competency in DAX, PowerBI, SQL and ability to pick up new technologies as needed.
In-depth knowledge of and experience with data warehouse principles.
Have outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Display interest, energy and flexibility to work in the fast-paced environment of a growing business and wear multiple hats.

title: Data Analyst - Data Modeller
description:
My client is a well known NSW Gov't agency, and they are seeking someone special to not only analyse, but to find and fix issues within their data.
They have data quality issues.
So, can you identify data quality problems
Can you provide solutions and enhancements to rectify the quality issues
Can you provide supportable documentation and provide long term solutions to maintain the desired high standards
Can you establish data quality standards
Do you have extensive data quality analytics experience in a large complex corporate IT environment
Do you understand Government processes and procedures
If so, I'd really like to hear from you ASAP as applications for this opportunity close Monday 11th at 3pm
 
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Please apply with a Word copy of your CV.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Canberra location
Total Remuneration package $138,276 - $163,138
3 years Maximum-Term, Full-time
Open to Permanent Residents and Australian Citizens

About Us
Icon Water is responsible for owning and operating Canberra’s network of water and wastewater infrastructure and assets including dams, reservoirs, water and sewerage treatment plants, water and sewerage pumping stations to ensure the delivery
          of safe drinking water and reliable sewerage services. Icon Water has been part of the Canberra community for 100 years.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer which values diversity and inclusion. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with disabilities, people from culturally diverse backgrounds and
          all ages. We also have a strong focus on gender balance within the organisation and encourage women to apply.
The Opportunity
Our Digital Technology team is looking for an experienced Data Engineer to design, implement and manage databases, data models and datasets within the organisation.
A day in the life:

Establishing and maintaining dataset repository across the organisation
Development of code for data extraction, transformation and processing
Creating dashboards, visualisations and reports in Python and AWS.

We'll need you to have:

Degree in Computer Science
Good knowledge of SQL language and Python
Demonstrable experience in data modelling, data extraction, data mapping and data processing
Demonstrated experience in effectively using various databases, both SQL and NoSQL
Solid AWS experience with AWS certification being desirable.

About the team
We are a collaborative team that enjoys bringing out the best in each other. We are open to new ideas and not afraid to try out new approaches and technology. We are open to working flexibly with you, so talk to us and ask how this role can be
          made flexible for you.
About you

You are collaborative: you build and champion positive relationships and enjoy providing support to our business
You are respectful, value diversity and respect the time of others
You are open to learning new things and trying out different approaches.

About our application process
Please apply through our Recruitment portal by submitting a resume and a cover letter clearly outlining the key skills, knowledge and experience you can bring to the role.
If you wish to learn more about the role, please connect with Ali Salehi, Enterprise Architect on 0421 600 333.
Applications will close on 31 March 2019.
Thinking about moving to Canberra?
Canberra is the capital of the ACT. It has a population of 400,000 and is a modern city with a cosmopolitan feel. It offers all the city services and lifestyle amenities of a world-class capital, as well as being settled beside the alpine mountains
          and southeast coast which makes it an exceptional location for adventure.
Canberra boasts a great food and wine culture and is very family-friendly with progressive education, health care, clean environment, and is home to some of Australia’s best roads and bike paths. It’s a safe, relaxed place to live.

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
Junior Data Engineer  We have a great opportunity for an engineer who is passionate about Software Engineering and Technology. This career opportunity is multi-faceted, working with some great clients in areas including; data
          transformation, specialized data tools, ETL and data migration  We are also looking for someone who can show true value through ideas, intuition, hard work and determination!    This is an ideal opportunity to kick-start
          your career joining a successful boutique professional services company in Sydney CBD. This opportunity will not only give you a solid basis to build upon your existing software engineering knowledge and skills working in a fast-paced and innovative
          Professional Services Team, but the chance to work with a range of IT organisations in various industry sectors. We take pride in developing your career and also invest heavily in our technical competencies with recent focus on data transformations
          and migration, cloud solutions and the development of automated bespoke solutions. You will receive ongoing training with the latest and greatest technologies.    Mandatory Skills    

Good communicator and willing to go above & beyond for clients
Strong PHP and/or Python scripting skills for ETL skills transformation
Understanding various file formats such as; CSV, XML, JSON or YAML
Strong SQL skills along with general database knowledge
Experience working with source control tooling. i.e. SVN, GIT etc
Ability to demonstrate prior projects delivered and provide achievements
Rest API development experience/understanding
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Exciting opportunity to drive innovation and collaboration across our business
Impact the way our gas assets are managed and optimised
Deliver best of breed data and analytical capabilities
Permanent, Brisbane
Application close date: 24th March 2019

 Origin - Australia's Leading Integrated Energy Company  An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day,
          keeping them going and growing.  Origin offers exciting and rewarding career opportunities - from project management and leadership, to technical and engineering. Working for Origin can take you all over Australia - in the field, as
          well as in the office - or around the world. With global energy demand growing, Origin is looking for new ways to meet that need and create tomorrow’s energy solutions. It’s an exciting time to be a part of Origin.
The Role  Origin is passionate about using Digital technologies to make good energy. Our Integrated Gas business has an exciting Digital program that is leveraging leading edge AI, IOT and cloud technologies to make a
          big difference. This is a great opportunity to join the IG Digital team based in Brisbane.  The role of Senior Data Engineer is responsible for delivering new products, capabilities, and practices using cloud data and advanced analytics
          services. Working in an agile team as a key developer, you will be involved in the end-to-end implementation of quality, scalable, and highly supportable solutions. You know what ‘great’ looks like and you are focused on delivering value for
          your stakeholders.  Working closely with leadership teams, data scientists and software engineers this is a great opportunity to impact the way our gas assets are managed and optimised. As part of the Digital Team, you will:

Participate in all aspects of the data solution delivery life cycle including analysis, estimation, design, development, testing, production deployment, and support. Build self-monitoring, robust, scalable interfaces and data pipelines
Develop standardised practices for delivering new products and capabilities using cloud data technologies, including data acquisition, transformation, and analysis
Ensure data practices integrate into overall data architectures and data management principles (e.g. data governance, data security, metadata, data quality). Create highly reusable code modules and packages that can be leveraged across the
              data pipeline
Contribute to our data dictionary for published data sources
Create and manage data sources and integrate with diverse APIs. Build efficient storage for structured and unstructured data. Develop and tune processes to ensure optimal performance and reliability whilst maintaining data integrity

          The suitable candidate will collaborate with others to create solutions that meet business and end user needs, bring and a commercial lens and customer focus to deliver value for end users and passion, motivation and a drive to achieve excellence.


 Is This You?

Tertiary qualifications in Information Management, Computer Science, or a related discipline
Extensive experience working in data analytics roles
Understanding of agile principles and practices
A proven track record of architecting, designing and implementing data pipelines and related operations, with a strong background designing and building distributed cloud-based data-driven applications
Development experience in languages such as Java, Scala and Python
Proficient in designing efficient and robust ETL workflows
Strong understanding of AWS Kenisis, Apache Spark and ML technologies.
SQL and/or NoSQL database experience (MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB)
Strong understanding of distributed systems concepts (CAP, Fallacies of Distributed Computing, etc)
Strong CS fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis
Strong understanding of event sourcing / CQRS / Microservice patterns
Containerisation and serverless infrastructures (Docker, Lambda, ECS, Kubernetes, DC/OS)
Strong belief in (TDD) unit testing, performance, load, or end-to-end integration tests
Strong understanding of SOLID object-oriented design patterns
Experience using CI/CD tools and platforms (Terraform, Codeship, CloudFormation, Fabric)
Extensive experience in troubleshooting and solving complex technical problems on large datasets


We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. 
 If dynamic and challenging career opportunities and workplace flexibility are important to you, go with the employer that thinks differently.  For more information contact: Iain Pratt on (03) 8665 7325  Requisition ID: 71194

title: AWS Big Data Engineer
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to
          lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with
          talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking an AWS Big Data Engineer to augment our Transportation client’s
          project delivering a fully automated AWS based data lake. Joining us on an initial 3 month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be an important piece of the team designing, consulting and implementing AWS Big
          Data Services.    This will include:

Provide high level technical subject matter expertise in the deployment of large scale data solutions, both on premise and cloud-based 
Create detailed target state architecture and blueprints for modern data technologies and cloud data services
Provide technical leadership and consulting for this large project
Build, test, and deploy solutions via AWS cloud data services

 We are looking for someone with:

Requirements of the Senior AWS Big Data Engineer:

AWS/Hadoop certifications preferred
3-4 years of experience applying ETL data warehousing best practices
At least 3 years of hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing in an AWS environment
1-2 years of experience building and executing large scale enterprise data solutions, data lakes, and applications with at least one AWS data and analytics services and third parties

EC2, EMR, S3, Kinesis, Dynamo DB, RedShift,  RDS, Lambda, Glue, Spark, Snowflake etc.
3rd party KMS, HSM with AWS data services for building secure data solutions
Hadoop stack (HDFS, PIG, Hive, Spark, Ambari, SQOOP, Map reduce, Tez, Ranger etc..)
Experience in Data Lake management tools Like Podium Data, Diyotta, Informatica BDE etc. is a plus

1-2 years of hands-on experience analyzing and re-architecting and moving on-premise data lake to data platforms on AWS cloud using AWS/third parties 
1-2 years of experience designing and building production data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a hybrid big data architecture using Java, Python, C++, etc.
1-2 years of experience architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on AWS cloud 
Exposure to Logi, SAS, Tableau, R, or equivalent dashboard reporting tool a plus
Motivated self-starter with the ability to complete tasks under minimal supervision/assistance 


 We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment
          to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration
          fees, and have access to discounted training and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381948.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
About the Team
Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very
          good reason - our exceptional people.
About the role
The Big Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Your responsibilities include:

Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into AWS based data lake platform
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Build DevOps pipeline
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

About you
You will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture
          is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Essential skills and experience

Strong experience on Big data / Hadoop Technology stack in Hadoop, Hive, Scala, MongoDB, HBase, Cassandra, Python
3+ Years experience with Big data stream processing frameworks such as Kafka Streaming, KSQL, Spark streaming, Storm, Flume etc.
Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages J2EE, Scala or Python
4+ Years Experience with the following technologies: Java, Spring Framework, JMS, REST APIs, Kafka, Spring Boot, NoSQL, AWS.
Experience building JAVA RESTful API's.
Familiarity with modern design patterns/microservices.
Strong proficiency with DBMS (Oracle/MS SQL).
Experience working with AWS services such as SNS, SQS, API Gateway, Lambda, S3.
Create/configure jobs for Control M or similar enterprise scheduling tools.
Some experience with ETL tools such as Informatica/Talend advantageous.

What we can offer you?
Capgemini is a world leader in technology enabled change. We can offer our consultants;

Formal training with industry recognized certifications
The ability to interact with peers in a sharing and inclusive community
Exciting and challenging projects
A well-structured and tailored career framework
A culture of collaboration and recognition
Excellent remuneration

About Capgemini
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log ontowww.capgemini.com.au

title: AWS Big Data Engineer
description:

          lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with
          talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking an AWS Big Data Engineer to augment our Transportation client’s
          project delivering a fully automated AWS based data lake. Joining us on an initial 3 month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be an important piece of the team designing, consulting and implementing AWS Big
          Data Services.    This will include:

Provide high level technical subject matter expertise in the deployment of large scale data solutions, both on premise and cloud-based 
Create detailed target state architecture and blueprints for modern data technologies and cloud data services
Provide technical leadership and consulting for this large project
Build, test, and deploy solutions via AWS cloud data services

 We are looking for someone with:

Requirements of the Senior AWS Big Data Engineer:

AWS/Hadoop certifications preferred
3-4 years of experience applying ETL data warehousing best practices
At least 3 years of hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing in an AWS environment
1-2 years of experience building and executing large scale enterprise data solutions, data lakes, and applications with at least one AWS data and analytics services and third parties

EC2, EMR, S3, Kinesis, Dynamo DB, RedShift,  RDS, Lambda, Glue, Spark, Snowflake etc.

1-2 years of experience architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on AWS cloud 
Exposure to Logi, SAS, Tableau, R, or equivalent dashboard reporting tool a plus
Motivated self-starter with the ability to complete tasks under minimal supervision/assistance 


 We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment

          fees, and have access to discounted training and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data.
