title: Big Data Engineer
description:
About the Team
Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very
          good reason - our exceptional people.
About the role
The Big Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Your responsibilities include:

Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into AWS based data lake platform
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Build DevOps pipeline
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

About you
You will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture
          is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Essential skills and experience

Strong experience on Big data / Hadoop Technology stack in Hadoop, Hive, Scala, MongoDB, HBase, Cassandra, Python
3+ Years experience with Big data stream processing frameworks such as Kafka Streaming, KSQL, Spark streaming, Storm, Flume etc.
Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages J2EE, Scala or Python
4+ Years Experience with the following technologies: Java, Spring Framework, JMS, REST APIs, Kafka, Spring Boot, NoSQL, AWS.
Experience building JAVA RESTful API's.
Familiarity with modern design patterns/microservices.
Strong proficiency with DBMS (Oracle/MS SQL).
Experience working with AWS services such as SNS, SQS, API Gateway, Lambda, S3.
Create/configure jobs for Control M or similar enterprise scheduling tools.
Some experience with ETL tools such as Informatica/Talend advantageous.

What we can offer you?
Capgemini is a world leader in technology enabled change. We can offer our consultants;

Formal training with industry recognized certifications
The ability to interact with peers in a sharing and inclusive community
Exciting and challenging projects
A well-structured and tailored career framework
A culture of collaboration and recognition
Excellent remuneration

About Capgemini
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.

Writing SQL query to get data from database, prior experience of reporting and analytical services MS SSRS and SSAS, MS SSIS, and analysis tools such as R Studio.

This role can add to an established Data Architects portfolio whilst working beside a high performing team with close synergy. This role is a significant, high-profile transformation project in a cutting-edge environment. Contact cmorris@charterhouse.com.au

title: Senior Enterprise Data Architect
description:

As an Enterprise Data Architect you will be responsible for establishing data governance, data classification and data security. Ideally coming from a Consultancy background having exposure to different industries and stakeholders. This is an

title: Lead Big Data Architect
description:
About our team:
 Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner
          with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people!
 About our role:
 You will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, build, optimise, and maintain conceptual and logical database models as well as optimise the data flow and collection for cross functional teams.

You will design and implement big data platform on AWS cloud to support variety of use cases including data science, machine learning, BI and reporting
You will define strategy and architecture to migrate data from legacy systems to new big data solutions, data pipelines for data collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
You will assess and propose the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Big data ETL, Database Replication, Application Integration, SQL and NoSQL technologies.
You will provide technical leadership to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent and resolve technical issues.
You will work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
You will define security and backup procedures

Most importantly about you:

You will have demonstrable experience of working on Big Data Technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, HBase, Avro/Parquet, Sqoop.
You have extensive experience supporting large production Hadoop platforms.
You are experienced in SQL-based, NoSQL-based and MPP datastores.
You are able to architect and design both streaming and batch use cases in a big data platform.
You are an expert in in building Big Data/Data Lake solutions using AWS services - S3, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, Athena, Redshift, AWS CLI etc.
You develop a vision for information delivery and management and driving execution of the roadmap, including enterprise data architecture, big data, analytics and data management.
You can mentor and support other team members to achieve team outcomes and facilitate a motivated and hard-working environment.
You are great at building relationships with internal and/or external clients.
You have previously written and produced technical documentation and knowledgebase articles.
You think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
You have demonstrable experience designing highly available, highly scalable production systems.
You are familiar with the Elastic stack, including Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana beneficial.
You are familiar with ETL tools such as Informatica (PowerCenter, BDM) or Talend.
If you have knowledge in Architecture frameworks like TOGAF this will be highly regarded

What we're offering:  
 Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary
          continuance insurance, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.
 Capgemini:
 Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 200,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform
          in order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
 Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the World, our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
 If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log onto www.capgemini.com.au
 Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

title: Data Architect | TSPV Clearance | Greenfield Project
description:
The Data Architect / Modeller is responsible for investigating, analysing and documenting the data volumes, flows, storage, and integration requirements for the capability

Must hold an active or inactive TSPV clearance
12 Contract on plus 12 month extensions
SFIA Lvl 5
Flexible working arrangements available

Skills and Knowledge

Demonstrated knowledge and experience in data analytics and modelling.

Major Responsibilities

Investigate and analyse data volumes, flows, and storage requirements for the project.
Develop data models and structures for integration with existing capabilities, and set the standard for integration of future capabilities.
Contribute to the validation and verification of requirements, with particular reference to data volumes, flows, storage and integration.
Contribute to the production of project Gate 1 documentation and artefacts, including (but not limited to) the Operational Concept Documentation, System Engineering Management Plan, and Functional and Performance Specification.
Ensure all work meets agreed timeframes, quality standards and quality control measures.
Contribute to identifying project level risks and issues. Escalate risks and issues, and seek advice from the project’s team leadership.
Work cohesively and flexibly with the project team, and manage the expectations of stakeholders

Kinexus are the No. 1 defence recognised supplier with a specialisation in the recruitment of mid to senior level professionals who hold Defence or Federal government clearances across the spectrum of technology platforms. Kinexus are recognised
            as a top 15 Defence SME in Australia and support various major defence projects
 
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below and attach your resume as a word document. Alternatively, please contact Ross Webb on 02 9492 7530 quoting the Job Title for this position. Visit www.kinexus.com.au to view more jobs.

title: Data Architect
description:
The role This State Government entity has recently embarked on a new strategy strategic transformation and modernisation of its systems, processes and technologies. With the program in its infancy they are looking for a
        Data Architect to deliver successful proof of concepts followed by implementations to modernise their data, metadata and underlying tools and technologies.You will be responsible for
        
Lead strategic technology transformation initiatives 
Collaborate with business SMEs to establish and build data stewardship relationships
Improve data conversion, data massaging, data preparation, data abstraction and data analytics tools and systems
Ensure data accuracy, availability, reliability, integrity, control, accessibility and predictability across distributed data sets spanning multiple environments
Formulate a roadmap to pilot and rollout software solutions to derive valuable business insights out of data extracted from heterogeneous sources
Oversee the introduction of new solutions for Data sharing, retention, encryption, consumption, storage, archival and purging with a view to ensure adherence to security protocols and data veracity guidelines
You will have

Min 3 - 5 years of experience driving implementation of MDM initiatives
Min 8 years of experience in Data Architecture
Significant experience in identifying and implementing contemporary and emerging data management, integration, hosting, data science, data analytics and data visualisation related software/middleware technologies/concepts including Big Data,
            Business Intelligence and Data Lakes/Data Warehouse
Significant experience across large enterprises in driving large-scale Master Data Management, Data Science, Data visualisation and Data Analytics technology initiatives aligned with business capabilities.
What's in it for you:

Be part of a major transformation program
CBD Location
Make your mark within Victorian public sector
3 year contract role
Please apply today to secure an interview or call Rebecca Vaksman on 9236 7736.

title: Data Architect - EXCLUSIVE
description:
Our Federal Government client requires an experienced Data Architect to join their team on a large program of work. This client offers great culture and an innovative working environment in return.To be successful in securing this opportunity,
        you will have:

5+ years proven work experience as a Data Architect or similar role.
In-depth understanding of data classification and storage principles including SQL and non-SQL environments.

Strong understanding of Data Governance including Data Classification, Data Quality, Data Lineage, Data Protection/Privacy/Security.

description:

          projects.
 
The role:
You will be a senior member of a large analytics & big data project team. Your job include end-to-end solution design of data architecture and interface solutions between production applications and on-premise EDW and AWS data lake. You can

description:

Although you will be the data expert from a technical perspective, it is essential you have the credibility and capability to work directly with business users to understand (and solve) their data problems.
 
The primary objective of the Enterprise Architect role is to strengthen the impact of business information that will need to be available and shared consistently across the business.
 
Skill set / Experience needed -
 

Proven expertise working in complex environments as a Solution Architect and/or Enterprise Architect
Experience working directly with the business and offering strategic guidance
Solid background working with data and Information Management
Experience with data governance
Experience with information and data modelling
Working with structured and unstructured data

Maximizing the value derived from data and analytics

Development of roadmaps

An in-depth experience of designing and implementing information solutions
Business capability modelling
Familiar with data warehouse design
Experienced with distributed management and analytics in cloud and hybrid environments
Experienced working within Agile delivery environments
Excellent communication and presentation skills

This is a fantastic opportunity to make a real difference across an entire company!
 
Apply Today

title: Technical Solution Architect - Data-Driven Solutions
description:
This is an opportunity to join an organisation which is expanding rapidly and enjoying great success and an enviable reputation. This role has come about due to growth and increasing demand from a diverse customer base.
The Technical Solution Architect takes responsibility for the architecture and design of technology components that form the desired solutions. These solutions typically involve a combination of data engineering, analytics, automated decisioning,
          integration and digital channel technology components. You will have the responsibility from solution conception through to successful implementation. You will be comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders from both Business and Technology,
          guiding junior consultants on engagements, scoping and pricing an engagement, designing a practical team structure and structuring and writing a deliverable.
You will work proactively to:

Coherently communicate the business value of the company's capabilities.
Deliver new and complex solutions to clients in response to varying business requirements or desired business outcomes
Understand and interpret business objectives and requirements to design and develop the architecture and component designs and perform software vendor assessments.
Define technology roadmaps for proposed solutions and align these with the client’s operating constraints and prioritized objectives.
Make sound design decisions to deliver functional and non-functional solutions around performance, availability, scalability, security and integrity.
Develop level of effort estimates and resource skill requirements for solution development, testing and deployment.
Lead technical solution delivery to ensure that the development, testing and deployment align with architectural intent.
Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise on leading vendors in areas of data engineering, analytics, data storage, integration, operational decisioning and process automation.
Lead and manage a co-sourced team of specialists.

You bring to the role

A solid understanding of digital technologies and analytics, automation, information management and business process based solutions.
Clear evidence of the ability to architecturally design and deliver ‘leading edge’ data-driven solutions to significant business problems is essential.
Demonstrated knowledge of analytical concepts, including complex data structures, data-warehouse / mart design approaches, information architecture and data mining.
Demonstrated experience in designing and delivering solutions containing elements of real-time architectures and decisioning, business process design and orchestration and business rules engines.
Possess high levels of IT technical expertise, combined with significant business depth and vision to enable effective production of well-targeted technical solutions.
Demonstrated experience with operationalising analytics design, business rules engines and, real time architectures and decisioning is required.
Demonstrated experience in delivering working systems that are maintainable and extensible.
Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following areas: analytical models, data mining and complex queries, predictive analytics, mathematical models, optimisation techniques, statistical analysis, customer analytics, real-time decisioning,
            event based communications and marketing and business optimisation.
Experience with a range of vendors and tools, namely: IBM Campaign and Interact, Adobe Campaign and Experience Manager, Teradata, Oracle Exadata, Hadoop, IBM InfoSphere Information Server, Revolution R, SAS, Mulesoft, AngularJS, IBM ODM
A disciplined approach to problem solving and an ability to critically assess a range of information to differentiate true business needs as opposed to user requests.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience explaining complex technical concepts to business focussed senior stakeholders.
Proven ability to develop and manage enduring client relationships, engendering a sense of trust and respect.
Present in a professional manner and have a positive personal presence with a high degree of personal awareness and desire to be a part of a high performing team.

To find out more or to have a confidential discussion please call John O'Connor on 03 8330 5017 or apply below
IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.
http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

title: Data Governance /Architect
description:
This role is within the Big Data Hub team. This is a new team that is currently being built. It is also a very greenfield project.
The hiring manager is looking for a Data Architect who is very strong in the Data Governance side but will also need experience on at least 2 fully productionised systems.
 
Our major Financial services client is going from strength to strength and as a result of exciting new projects needs what I am calling a Data Governance Guru/Architect.
In short the role requires you to step in and be the primary contact for leading the data design and implementation of Data Hub Analytics environment and maintaining the data and analytics environment deliverables.
This is a Permanent position based in the heart of the Sydney CBD.
As you would expect in such a role you will interact with a mix of internal/external customers and gain exposure to a wide variety of business functions.
In this role you will be able to enhance your skills in BI, Data and Analytics through leading tools on the market by working on a Greenfields project where you can use the experience you gained prior to make this one even better!
To be successful in securing the role if it delivers what you seek we expect your CV should clearly indicate the below or close to it.
 

Solid experience in leading data governance forums, supporting data owners and stewards on operational areas and experience in implementing one or more data governance & data management tools
Strong experience in data warehouse and data hub with hands-on experience in Modelling and design guidelines.
At least 1 end to end Data Governance implementation experience designing and implementing data governance framework that includes organisation, process and tools
Experience in Data Hub models including hub and spoke data vault modelling
At least 2 Big Data project design and implementation involving considerable data size, coupled with many years of experience in design and development using various database technologies with recent experience in the data design
            role
Strong Data analysis and data management experience.
Extensive experience in documenting information catalogue that includes data definitions, data models, business glossary and metadata
Extensive experience in defining information architecture

 
You will be the SME for this area! Any experience in following activities is highly desirable but it wont be a deal breaker for you getting the role!

Translate Business strategic priorities into Data strategy and data requirements, Design Data roadmap aligning to current and future business requirement
Design Data solution specification, Design Data Models and contribute to Enterprise information architecture
Create BRD, FRD and Source To Target (STT) mapping documents based on the data model
Design Data Management solution and monitor implementation
Design development standards and audit technical implementation
Guide development team with Technical designs and inputs
Provide inputs to test strategy and UAT

So if you are skilled Data Governance Guru seeking a permanent role where you can make a huge impact and work with passionate and positive people then we look forward to your application today
 Please call Rebecca on 02 9249 8041.Please be aware I work flexibly but will get back in contact with you. So feel free to apply for the role with your resume and any questions there as well.
Experis ANZ is parent to a portfolio of brands; Greythorn, Safesearch, Marks Sattin, GT-X and Global Attract. These brands make up our core specialisations for Technology & Digital, Accounting & Finance,
          Engineering and Workplace Health, Safety and Environment. When you apply for this opportunity you will be directed to the parent website www.experis.com.au to lodge your application. Experis is part of the ManpowerGroup,
          a global leader in offering end to end workforce solutions.  If you're curious and willing to have a conversation about this role, please pick up the phone and speak with our recruitment specialist below. Even if this doesn't sound like
          the right role for you, we encourage you to join our talent community so your skill set can be the first considered when another opportunity arises. Click register on our website www.experis.com.au.

title: Data Architect
description:
On the lookout for a Data Architect who will conduct a detailed analysis of the information management requirements across all systems, platforms and applications. The ideal incumbent will be instrumental in translating business needs into data
          architecture and implementation and will be comfortable operating in an agile environment. Initial 6 month contract, position based in Macquarie Park

•             Min 5 years’ experience in design and implementation of IT software, business applications and their requirements, cloud technologies, and infrastructure solutions. Stakeholder
          management skills with a proven ability to establish strong working relationships.
•             Design data migration strategy and delivery solution
•             Ability to convey the meaning and value of analytics to business stakeholders without technical backgrounds.
•             Established a data quality management process  which included quality assessment, monitoring, assigning defects to data stewards and production promotion for data fixes
•             Undertake data analysis to diagnose data problems
•             Demonstrable experience in data integration, enterprise messaging, third party integration, API integration and web services standards.
•             Demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise solutions incorporating API integration within a IaaS, PaaS and SaaS environment.
•             Experience working as part of a team with exposure to Software Development Life Cycles, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
 

•             Computer Science degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
•             A detailed understanding of software systems design and technical
•             concepts.
•             Enterprise applications design experience using frameworks such as
•             TOGAF, AWS, Dell Boomi, etc.
•             Accredited as a Certified Process Design Engineer (CPDE).
•             Knowledge of standard IP networking technologies, switching, routing,
•             firewalls, load balancing, DNS, DHCP, etc.
•             Knowledge of storage and volume management solutions.
•             Broad exposure to Open Source tools to include automation, security,
•             networking and database
•             Knowledge of monitoring and log analytics
•             Test automation and Continuous Integration & Deployment (CI-CD)

title: Data & Analytics Principal Solutions Architect
description:
My client an leading Australian consultancy who operate nationally are looking for a Principal Data and Analytics Architect to join their business in Melbourne 
Day-to-day You WillKey Role Responsibilities: 

Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
Analyze current business practice, processes, and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Develop overall solution plans and strategic vision for data and analytics solutions, providing a comprehensive roadmap for clients’ needs.
Provide high-level architectural expertise to sales, project and other analytics teams.
Perform key management and thought leadership role in the areas of advanced data techniques, including data modeling, data access, data integration, data visualization, text mining, data discovery, statistical methods, database design and
                implementation.
Define and achieve a strategic roadmap for the enterprise; including data modeling, implementation and data management for our enterprise data warehouse and advanced data analytics systems.
Identify risks, assumptions, and develop estimates end-to-end based on Solution Plans.
Build relationships with Solution Architects and collaborate on promoting solution architectural best practices across the company.
Provide solution oversight to delivery architects and teams 
QualificationsKey Role Skill & Capability Requirements: 

Proven client experience selecting architecture that services clients’ needs with the balance of costs, capability, and risk to meet clients’ business objectives.
Demonstrated experience of turning business use case and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Strong understanding of the value proposition(s) associated with AI, Data, PaaS (Azure PaaS is a plus!), and DevOps.
Experience constructing program journeys.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Experience successfully solutioning digital analytics programs and system integration projects across multiple work streams and geographically dispersed teams.
People management responsibilities both directly and indirectly with globally dispersed teams.
Passion for AI.
Ability to establish relationships with peers virtually.
Able to explain complex analytical methodologies and concepts in non-technical language.
Experience design and solutioning Modern Data Platforms and solutions incorporating AI and Advanced Analytics.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Experience partnering on analytics-related sales pursuits.
Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes.
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
Knowledge of DevOps processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
Experience of leading greater than 3Mn Aus$ deal solutions 
Preferred CertificationsMCSA,MCSEPreferred Education BackgroundYou likely possess a Bachelor’s and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics,
            or Mathematics. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.Preferred Years Of Work ExperienceYou likely have about 8-10+ years of applied experience solutioning programs and system
            integration projects that include Modern Data Platform and Advanced Analytics, preferably in a business consulting (technology focus) environment or a combination of experience and relevant education.Preferred Years Of Management Experience5-
            8 years - good to haveScope Of WorkNature of Work: Directs collective work efforts to accomplish strategic goals for given portfolio of projects, programs, and/or clients.Scope of Work: Translates high-level
            strategy into more localized strategy and operational objectives.Complexity: Highly complex problems, often requiring analysis of near-intangible factors, creative solutioning and significant networking to succeed.Discretion:
            Authority to establish standards and shift the overall direction of projects and programs in response to the functional strategy.Organizational Impact: Work efforts are typically strategic in nature, and may have a lasting, long-term
            impact on Avanade and/or client operations and strategic direction. If client-facing, the focus would be on driving client-relationship and sales outcomes.Supervision Received: Operates with extreme latitude in determining focus and
            approach to work objectives.Supervision Provided: Mentors and manages work efforts of more junior colleagues and team members as required by various workstreams; may formally supervise work of project teams. If managing team(s) of
            more junior employees full-time, then refer to the People & Business Leadership leveling criteria. Often serves as Career Advisor.Knowledge Applied: Applies expert knowledge of a learned occupation/discipline and demonstrable,
            broad knowledge of business operations and organizational strategy.Accountabilities & Metrics

Chargeability target
Sales target
Revenue target
Personal goals 

If you do not have full working rights in Australia please do not apply for this role.

 

 
Please apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only suitable candidates matching client criteria will be contacted.

title: Data Governance /Architect
description:
This role is within the Big Data Hub team. This is a new team that is currently being built. It is also a very greenfield project.
The hiring manager is looking for a Data Architect who is very strong in the Data Governance side but will also need experience on at least 2 fully productionised systems.
 
Our major Financial services client is going from strength to strength and as a result of exciting new projects needs what I am calling a Data Governance Guru/Architect.
In short the role requires you to step in and be the primary contact for leading the data design and implementation of Data Hub Analytics environment and maintaining the data and analytics environment deliverables.
This is a Permanent position based in the heart of the Sydney CBD.
As you would expect in such a role you will interact with a mix of internal/external customers and gain exposure to a wide variety of business functions.
In this role you will be able to enhance your skills in BI, Data and Analytics through leading tools on the market by working on a Greenfields project where you can use the experience you gained prior to make this one even better!
To be successful in securing the role if it delivers what you seek we expect your CV should clearly indicate the below or close to it.
 

Solid experience in leading data governance forums, supporting data owners and stewards on operational areas and experience in implementing one or more data governance & data management tools
Strong experience in data warehouse and data hub with hands-on experience in Modelling and design guidelines.
At least 1 end to end Data Governance implementation experience designing and implementing data governance framework that includes organisation, process and tools
Experience in Data Hub models including hub and spoke data vault modelling
At least 2 Big Data project design and implementation involving considerable data size, coupled with many years of experience in design and development using various database technologies with recent experience in the data design
            role
Strong Data analysis and data management experience.
Extensive experience in documenting information catalogue that includes data definitions, data models, business glossary and metadata
Extensive experience in defining information architecture

 
You will be the SME for this area! Any experience in following activities is highly desirable but it wont be a deal breaker for you getting the role!

Translate Business strategic priorities into Data strategy and data requirements, Design Data roadmap aligning to current and future business requirement
Design Data solution specification, Design Data Models and contribute to Enterprise information architecture
Create BRD, FRD and Source To Target (STT) mapping documents based on the data model
Design Data Management solution and monitor implementation
Design development standards and audit technical implementation
Guide development team with Technical designs and inputs
Provide inputs to test strategy and UAT

So if you are skilled Data Governance Guru seeking a permanent role where you can make a huge impact and work with passionate and positive people then we look forward to your application today
 Please call Rebecca on 02 9249 8041.Please be aware I work flexibly but will get back in contact with you. So feel free to apply for the role with your resume and any questions there as well.
Experis ANZ is parent to a portfolio of brands; Greythorn, Safesearch, Marks Sattin, GT-X and Global Attract. These brands make up our core specialisations for Technology & Digital, Accounting & Finance,
          Engineering and Workplace Health, Safety and Environment. When you apply for this opportunity you will be directed to the parent website www.experis.com.au to lodge your application. Experis is part of the ManpowerGroup,
          a global leader in offering end to end workforce solutions.  If you're curious and willing to have a conversation about this role, please pick up the phone and speak with our recruitment specialist below. Even if this doesn't sound like
          the right role for you, we encourage you to join our talent community so your skill set can be the first considered when another opportunity arises. Click register on our website www.experis.com.au. 
Rebecca WardTechnology & DigitalResource Recruitment AssociateLet's Connecthttps://www.linkedin.com/in/rebecca-ward-0b41b6120/+61 2 9249 8041

title: Data Architect | CBD Based | Transformation
description:
Data ArchitectOur client is seeking a Data Architect to contribute to a world-first, world-class solution built on the ServiceNow platform. The position is situated in the heart of the CBD at competitive rates. The role facilitates the
          unique luxury of direct access and regular support from company executives. Furthermore, this role has the capacity to transform into a long-term opportunity as it is initially a 12month contract inclusive of a possible extension.Our
          client boasts a growing ServiceNow product team that create user centric mobile, tablet and desktop solutions. If you are submersed in data and are good at it you could be the right individual for there company which upholds itself on their
          values: collaboration, integrity trust, achievement and excellence.  Our client is seeking an experienced, self-driven and outcomes focused data architect who is competent in understanding data modelling concepts and designing data
          for reuse and extensible data models. The successful individual must have a good understanding of various data interchange standards and data life cycle. Also, understanding the ACLs for granting rights and access in the context of ServiceNow

Technical inputs into Tenders

Patterns and Practices, MVP, MVC, Development Methodologies
Experience in fine-tuning database performance under different load conditions, and optimising data access and queries to help deliver a great user experience.
Ability to interpret UX/UI diagrams and mock-ups into logical data flows, schemas to ensure high performance, efficient and scalable applications
Writing SQL query to get data from database, prior experience of reporting and analytical services MS SSRS and SSAS, MS SSIS, and analysis tools such as R Studio.

This role can add to an established Data Architects portfolio whilst working beside a high performing team with close synergy. This role is a significant, high-profile transformation project in a cutting-edge environment. Contact cmorris@charterhouse.com.au
          with any queries or to apply.

description:

title: Lead Big Data Architect
description:
About our team:
 Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner
          with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people!
 About our role:
 You will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, build, optimise, and maintain conceptual and logical database models as well as optimise the data flow and collection for cross functional teams.

You will design and implement big data platform on AWS cloud to support variety of use cases including data science, machine learning, BI and reporting
You will define strategy and architecture to migrate data from legacy systems to new big data solutions, data pipelines for data collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
You will assess and propose the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Big data ETL, Database Replication, Application Integration, SQL and NoSQL technologies.
You will provide technical leadership to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent and resolve technical issues.
You will work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
You will define security and backup procedures

Most importantly about you:

You will have demonstrable experience of working on Big Data Technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, HBase, Avro/Parquet, Sqoop.
You have extensive experience supporting large production Hadoop platforms.
You are experienced in SQL-based, NoSQL-based and MPP datastores.
You are able to architect and design both streaming and batch use cases in a big data platform.
You are an expert in in building Big Data/Data Lake solutions using AWS services - S3, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, Athena, Redshift, AWS CLI etc.
You develop a vision for information delivery and management and driving execution of the roadmap, including enterprise data architecture, big data, analytics and data management.
You can mentor and support other team members to achieve team outcomes and facilitate a motivated and hard-working environment.
You are great at building relationships with internal and/or external clients.
You have previously written and produced technical documentation and knowledgebase articles.
You think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
You have demonstrable experience designing highly available, highly scalable production systems.
You are familiar with the Elastic stack, including Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana beneficial.
You are familiar with ETL tools such as Informatica (PowerCenter, BDM) or Talend.
If you have knowledge in Architecture frameworks like TOGAF this will be highly regarded

What we're offering:  
 Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary
          continuance insurance, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.
 Capgemini:
 Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 200,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform
          in order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
 Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the World, our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
 If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log onto www.capgemini.com.au
 Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

title: Data Architect | TSPV Clearance | Greenfield Project
description:
The Data Architect / Modeller is responsible for investigating, analysing and documenting the data volumes, flows, storage, and integration requirements for the capability

Must hold an active or inactive TSPV clearance
12 Contract on plus 12 month extensions
SFIA Lvl 5
Flexible working arrangements available

Skills and Knowledge

Demonstrated knowledge and experience in data analytics and modelling.

Major Responsibilities

Investigate and analyse data volumes, flows, and storage requirements for the project.
Develop data models and structures for integration with existing capabilities, and set the standard for integration of future capabilities.
Contribute to the validation and verification of requirements, with particular reference to data volumes, flows, storage and integration.
Contribute to the production of project Gate 1 documentation and artefacts, including (but not limited to) the Operational Concept Documentation, System Engineering Management Plan, and Functional and Performance Specification.
Ensure all work meets agreed timeframes, quality standards and quality control measures.
Contribute to identifying project level risks and issues. Escalate risks and issues, and seek advice from the project’s team leadership.
Work cohesively and flexibly with the project team, and manage the expectations of stakeholders

Kinexus are the No. 1 defence recognised supplier with a specialisation in the recruitment of mid to senior level professionals who hold Defence or Federal government clearances across the spectrum of technology platforms. Kinexus are recognised
            as a top 15 Defence SME in Australia and support various major defence projects
 
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below and attach your resume as a word document. Alternatively, please contact Ross Webb on 02 9492 7530 quoting the Job Title for this position. Visit www.kinexus.com.au to view more jobs.

title: Data Architect
description:
The role This State Government entity has recently embarked on a new strategy strategic transformation and modernisation of its systems, processes and technologies. With the program in its infancy they are looking for a
        Data Architect to deliver successful proof of concepts followed by implementations to modernise their data, metadata and underlying tools and technologies.You will be responsible for
        
Lead strategic technology transformation initiatives 
Collaborate with business SMEs to establish and build data stewardship relationships
Improve data conversion, data massaging, data preparation, data abstraction and data analytics tools and systems
Ensure data accuracy, availability, reliability, integrity, control, accessibility and predictability across distributed data sets spanning multiple environments
Formulate a roadmap to pilot and rollout software solutions to derive valuable business insights out of data extracted from heterogeneous sources
Oversee the introduction of new solutions for Data sharing, retention, encryption, consumption, storage, archival and purging with a view to ensure adherence to security protocols and data veracity guidelines
You will have

Min 3 - 5 years of experience driving implementation of MDM initiatives
Min 8 years of experience in Data Architecture
Significant experience in identifying and implementing contemporary and emerging data management, integration, hosting, data science, data analytics and data visualisation related software/middleware technologies/concepts including Big Data,
            Business Intelligence and Data Lakes/Data Warehouse
Significant experience across large enterprises in driving large-scale Master Data Management, Data Science, Data visualisation and Data Analytics technology initiatives aligned with business capabilities.

Be part of a major transformation program
CBD Location
Make your mark within Victorian public sector
3 year contract role
Please apply today to secure an interview or call Rebecca Vaksman on 9236 7736.

title: Enterprise Data Architect - Big Data | AI |  Analytics - Insurance
description:

        and innovative architecture practice within one of Australia's leading brands. The architecture group plays a key part in creating and delivering the services and architectural presence that enable the businesses broader customer strategy.Data
        Architect - You will have a strong architecture presence, work across multiple stakeholder teams at varying levels, operate independently where required, provide thought leadership around Data Architecture, recognise where services play off one

Big Data

title: Technical Solution Architect - Data-Driven Solutions
description:
This is an opportunity to join an organisation which is expanding rapidly and enjoying great success and an enviable reputation. This role has come about due to growth and increasing demand from a diverse customer base.
The Technical Solution Architect takes responsibility for the architecture and design of technology components that form the desired solutions. These solutions typically involve a combination of data engineering, analytics, automated decisioning,
          integration and digital channel technology components. You will have the responsibility from solution conception through to successful implementation. You will be comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders from both Business and Technology,
          guiding junior consultants on engagements, scoping and pricing an engagement, designing a practical team structure and structuring and writing a deliverable.
You will work proactively to:

Coherently communicate the business value of the company's capabilities.
Deliver new and complex solutions to clients in response to varying business requirements or desired business outcomes
Understand and interpret business objectives and requirements to design and develop the architecture and component designs and perform software vendor assessments.
Define technology roadmaps for proposed solutions and align these with the client’s operating constraints and prioritized objectives.
Make sound design decisions to deliver functional and non-functional solutions around performance, availability, scalability, security and integrity.
Develop level of effort estimates and resource skill requirements for solution development, testing and deployment.
Lead technical solution delivery to ensure that the development, testing and deployment align with architectural intent.
Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise on leading vendors in areas of data engineering, analytics, data storage, integration, operational decisioning and process automation.
Lead and manage a co-sourced team of specialists.

You bring to the role

A solid understanding of digital technologies and analytics, automation, information management and business process based solutions.
Clear evidence of the ability to architecturally design and deliver ‘leading edge’ data-driven solutions to significant business problems is essential.
Demonstrated knowledge of analytical concepts, including complex data structures, data-warehouse / mart design approaches, information architecture and data mining.
Demonstrated experience in designing and delivering solutions containing elements of real-time architectures and decisioning, business process design and orchestration and business rules engines.
Possess high levels of IT technical expertise, combined with significant business depth and vision to enable effective production of well-targeted technical solutions.
Demonstrated experience with operationalising analytics design, business rules engines and, real time architectures and decisioning is required.
Demonstrated experience in delivering working systems that are maintainable and extensible.
Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following areas: analytical models, data mining and complex queries, predictive analytics, mathematical models, optimisation techniques, statistical analysis, customer analytics, real-time decisioning,
            event based communications and marketing and business optimisation.
Experience with a range of vendors and tools, namely: IBM Campaign and Interact, Adobe Campaign and Experience Manager, Teradata, Oracle Exadata, Hadoop, IBM InfoSphere Information Server, Revolution R, SAS, Mulesoft, AngularJS, IBM ODM
A disciplined approach to problem solving and an ability to critically assess a range of information to differentiate true business needs as opposed to user requests.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with extensive experience explaining complex technical concepts to business focussed senior stakeholders.
Proven ability to develop and manage enduring client relationships, engendering a sense of trust and respect.
Present in a professional manner and have a positive personal presence with a high degree of personal awareness and desire to be a part of a high performing team.

To find out more or to have a confidential discussion please call John O'Connor on 03 8330 5017 or apply below
IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.

title: Data Governance /Architect
description:
This role is within the Big Data Hub team. This is a new team that is currently being built. It is also a very greenfield project.
The hiring manager is looking for a Data Architect who is very strong in the Data Governance side but will also need experience on at least 2 fully productionised systems.
 
Our major Financial services client is going from strength to strength and as a result of exciting new projects needs what I am calling a Data Governance Guru/Architect.
In short the role requires you to step in and be the primary contact for leading the data design and implementation of Data Hub Analytics environment and maintaining the data and analytics environment deliverables.
This is a Permanent position based in the heart of the Sydney CBD.
As you would expect in such a role you will interact with a mix of internal/external customers and gain exposure to a wide variety of business functions.
In this role you will be able to enhance your skills in BI, Data and Analytics through leading tools on the market by working on a Greenfields project where you can use the experience you gained prior to make this one even better!
To be successful in securing the role if it delivers what you seek we expect your CV should clearly indicate the below or close to it.
 

Solid experience in leading data governance forums, supporting data owners and stewards on operational areas and experience in implementing one or more data governance & data management tools
Strong experience in data warehouse and data hub with hands-on experience in Modelling and design guidelines.
At least 1 end to end Data Governance implementation experience designing and implementing data governance framework that includes organisation, process and tools
Experience in Data Hub models including hub and spoke data vault modelling
At least 2 Big Data project design and implementation involving considerable data size, coupled with many years of experience in design and development using various database technologies with recent experience in the data design
            role
Strong Data analysis and data management experience.
Extensive experience in documenting information catalogue that includes data definitions, data models, business glossary and metadata
Extensive experience in defining information architecture

 
You will be the SME for this area! Any experience in following activities is highly desirable but it wont be a deal breaker for you getting the role!

Translate Business strategic priorities into Data strategy and data requirements, Design Data roadmap aligning to current and future business requirement
Design Data solution specification, Design Data Models and contribute to Enterprise information architecture
Create BRD, FRD and Source To Target (STT) mapping documents based on the data model
Design Data Management solution and monitor implementation
Design development standards and audit technical implementation
Guide development team with Technical designs and inputs
Provide inputs to test strategy and UAT

So if you are skilled Data Governance Guru seeking a permanent role where you can make a huge impact and work with passionate and positive people then we look forward to your application today
 Please call Rebecca on 02 9249 8041.Please be aware I work flexibly but will get back in contact with you. So feel free to apply for the role with your resume and any questions there as well.

          Engineering and Workplace Health, Safety and Environment. When you apply for this opportunity you will be directed to the parent website www.experis.com.au to lodge your application. Experis is part of the ManpowerGroup,
          a global leader in offering end to end workforce solutions.  If you're curious and willing to have a conversation about this role, please pick up the phone and speak with our recruitment specialist below. Even if this doesn't sound like
          the right role for you, we encourage you to join our talent community so your skill set can be the first considered when another opportunity arises. Click register on our website www.experis.com.au.

title: Data Architect
description:
On the lookout for a Data Architect who will conduct a detailed analysis of the information management requirements across all systems, platforms and applications. The ideal incumbent will be instrumental in translating business needs into data
