title: Data & Analytics Principal Solutions Architect
description:
My client an leading Australian consultancy who operate nationally are looking for a Principal Data and Analytics Architect to join their business in Melbourne 
Day-to-day You WillKey Role Responsibilities: 

Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
Analyze current business practice, processes, and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Develop overall solution plans and strategic vision for data and analytics solutions, providing a comprehensive roadmap for clients’ needs.
Provide high-level architectural expertise to sales, project and other analytics teams.
Perform key management and thought leadership role in the areas of advanced data techniques, including data modeling, data access, data integration, data visualization, text mining, data discovery, statistical methods, database design and
                implementation.
Define and achieve a strategic roadmap for the enterprise; including data modeling, implementation and data management for our enterprise data warehouse and advanced data analytics systems.
Identify risks, assumptions, and develop estimates end-to-end based on Solution Plans.
Build relationships with Solution Architects and collaborate on promoting solution architectural best practices across the company.
Provide solution oversight to delivery architects and teams 
QualificationsKey Role Skill & Capability Requirements: 

Proven client experience selecting architecture that services clients’ needs with the balance of costs, capability, and risk to meet clients’ business objectives.
Demonstrated experience of turning business use case and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Strong understanding of the value proposition(s) associated with AI, Data, PaaS (Azure PaaS is a plus!), and DevOps.
Experience constructing program journeys.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
Experience successfully solutioning digital analytics programs and system integration projects across multiple work streams and geographically dispersed teams.
People management responsibilities both directly and indirectly with globally dispersed teams.
Passion for AI.
Ability to establish relationships with peers virtually.
Able to explain complex analytical methodologies and concepts in non-technical language.
Experience design and solutioning Modern Data Platforms and solutions incorporating AI and Advanced Analytics.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Experience partnering on analytics-related sales pursuits.
Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes.
Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
Knowledge of DevOps processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
Experience of leading greater than 3Mn Aus$ deal solutions 
Preferred CertificationsMCSA,MCSEPreferred Education BackgroundYou likely possess a Bachelor’s and/or Masters in a field such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Statistics,
            or Mathematics. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.Preferred Years Of Work ExperienceYou likely have about 8-10+ years of applied experience solutioning programs and system
            integration projects that include Modern Data Platform and Advanced Analytics, preferably in a business consulting (technology focus) environment or a combination of experience and relevant education.Preferred Years Of Management Experience5-
            8 years - good to haveScope Of WorkNature of Work: Directs collective work efforts to accomplish strategic goals for given portfolio of projects, programs, and/or clients.Scope of Work: Translates high-level
            strategy into more localized strategy and operational objectives.Complexity: Highly complex problems, often requiring analysis of near-intangible factors, creative solutioning and significant networking to succeed.Discretion:
            Authority to establish standards and shift the overall direction of projects and programs in response to the functional strategy.Organizational Impact: Work efforts are typically strategic in nature, and may have a lasting, long-term
            impact on Avanade and/or client operations and strategic direction. If client-facing, the focus would be on driving client-relationship and sales outcomes.Supervision Received: Operates with extreme latitude in determining focus and
            approach to work objectives.Supervision Provided: Mentors and manages work efforts of more junior colleagues and team members as required by various workstreams; may formally supervise work of project teams. If managing team(s) of
            more junior employees full-time, then refer to the People & Business Leadership leveling criteria. Often serves as Career Advisor.Knowledge Applied: Applies expert knowledge of a learned occupation/discipline and demonstrable,
            broad knowledge of business operations and organizational strategy.Accountabilities & Metrics

Chargeability target
Sales target
Revenue target
Personal goals 

If you do not have full working rights in Australia please do not apply for this role.

 

 
Please apply directly via the Apply for this job button. Only suitable candidates matching client criteria will be contacted.

title: Research and Development Scientist
description:
Aspen Australia is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in Australia. We market a wide range of iconic brands such as Bio Oil, Zantac, Beconase, Stingose, S-26 Gold,  S-26 Toddler and a diverse array of prescription medicines. We're
          a business of 600+ innovative thinkers but 10,000 globally, inspired to make a difference to individual lives by providing quality, affordable medicines and healthcare products.
Aspen Australia is a division of Aspen Pharmacare Holdings Limited. Globally, Aspen manufactures approximately 24 billion tablets annually, has 26 manufacturing facilities at 18 sites on 6 continents and all made possible by our people.
We have an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic Research and Development Scientist to join our R and D team based at Dandenong on a full time basis.  Reporting directly to the R&D Manager, your responsibilities for this role will
          be as follows:

Develops and/or performs all formulation requirements on new formulas which includes creation of theoretical formulation.
Writes and/or reviews procedures, quotes, and specifications needed to support product development activities.
Documents test results, specifications, and final formula procedures in a standard format for inclusion in the Master File. Participates in the technology transfer from pilot scale to commercial manufacturing runs.
Communicates in a timely fashion, all information regarding formulation, project status, raw material research, results, etc. to all appropriate stakeholders.
Conducts intellectual searches for technical information through a variety of resources.
Participates in process improvement and product investigations to assist with the introduction of the new formulated product into commercial production.
Reformulates to improve existing products as needed.
Constructs experimental studies intended to provide supporting data or to resolve technical issues encountered during a development project. 
Proposes and implements recommendations to processes and procedures designed to increase efficiency, safety, or quality.
Develops manufacturing instructions, scale up batches, and transfer processes into manufacturing.

What we are looking for?

Tertiary qualifications in chemistry, pharmacy or engineering.
An excellent understanding of formulation of new products within the pharmaceutical industries in manufacturing liquid and solid dosage forms.
Very sound understanding of quality within a GMP manufacturing environment.
Proficiency in Excel and Microsoft.
Strong customer service skills with the ability to listen and translate user requirements into practical and cost effective solutions.

Does the above sound like you? Then take the next step in your career and apply now. Please specify which position you are applying for in your cover letter.
Please note, we value your application and interest in our company, and appreciate the time it has taken to apply. However, only those successful in gaining an interview will be contacted.

title: Research Assistant - iPSC Facility
description:
About us
The Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute is dedicated to finding cures for cardiovascular disease and is one of the most respected heart research facilities in the world.
In 2016, the Victor Chang Cardiac Research Institute established the Victor Chang Innovation Centre comprised of seven cutting-edge facilities, with a focus on Stem Cells and Regeneration, Cardiogenomics and Gene Editing, Cardiac Imaging,
            Arrhythmias, Transplantation and Devices, and Metabolomics.
The new centre will attract world-class researchers and drive transformative research. It will allow scientists to access cutting-edge technologies and will foster collaborations with clinical researchers and technological experts, all with
            a shared vision – to reduce the incidence, severity and impact of heart disease.
The role
We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Research Assistant to work within the iPSC cell culture facility of the Victor Chang Innovation Centre. In this role you will be involved in generation and maintenance of human induced pluripotent
            stem cell (iPSCs) and their differentiation to heart cells, utilizing our state-of the art robotics platform. Your strong background in mammalian tissue culture and other relevant disciples will enable you to use this expertise to develop
            new methods/applications to suit our workflow requirements. 
Duties and responsibilities include: 

Generation of human iPSC and their maintenance
QC validation of iPSC lines and differentiation into cardiac lineages
Method development for robotic platform
Equipment maintenance, generation of SOPs and SWPs
Interaction with multiple internal and external users

About you
Are you an accomplished researcher with a talent for hands-on experimental work and complex data analysis? Are you looking to advance your career in academic research but prefer the lab bench to the office desk? Do you have a passion for science
            and want to work on the most exciting and cutting-edge cardiovascular research in Australia?
We would like to meet you if you have:

A Bachelor or Master’s degree in Life Sciences
Demonstrated technical training in mammalian cell culture,
Experience in hESC or iPSC would be advantageous
Hands-on experience of hESC/hiPSC differentiation.

What we offer:

Salary packaging
Bonus superannuation
State of the art facilities
Stimulating work setting focussed on cutting edge medical research
Collaborative team environment

We strive to ensure our staff and students enjoy a great working environment. We value and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity and gender equity and promotes flexible working arrangements for staff to balance
            working requirements and personal needs.
To apply please send a cover letter, your CV and details of three referees to recruitment@victorchang.edu.au.
Applications close on 15 April 2019
Come and work with us & help make a difference.

title: Remote Sensing Scientist
description:
Job Title:  Remote Sensing Scientist (12 Roles Available)Job Grade / Classification:  Environment Officer Class 7Employment Type: Temporary up to 24 Months Location: Parramatta, Albury, Newcastle, Armidale, Dubbo, Grafton Agency overviewThe
        Department of Planning & Environment is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.  The Department’s vision – “Planning
        for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment” – provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry
        stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment.  The NSW Office of Environment and Heritage (OEH) is a part of the Planning and Environment Cluster. It aims to enrich life in
        NSW by helping the community to conserve and enjoy our environment and heritage. For more information go to http://www.environment.nsw.gov.au/. This role will work for
        Science Division, which sits within the Office of Environment and Heritage. Science Division provides scientific evidence and knowledge to underpin environmental decision making, regulation and service delivery. About the Role: The position of Remote Sensing Scientist  is  part of a dynamic team that is  spread across  various locations in NSW.  The Remote Sensing Scientist reports to Senior Team members and is  responsible for: 
        
Contributing to large and complex scientific/technical projects 
Providing skilled GIS/remote sensing support 
Providing timely advice and communication as required
Developing and presenting technical scientific reports 
Contributing to the data management of remote sensed data
Delivering high quality science through maintaining high level, up to date knowledge and skills in relevant areas 
 Experience with scripting in python or linux is desirable. Please see the role description for further details about this role. Essential requirements:

Scientific qualifications, knowledge and demonstrated experience of delivering statewide  scientifically rigorous projects using remote sensed imagery interpretation, analysis and assessment.
Extensive experience with remote sensing and GIS software programs and data management.
 Please note: There may be opportunities for ongoing Remote Sensing Scientist roles in the future. Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:

Role Description 
Application Guide 
Applying for a role in the NSW Public Sector 
  Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed
        to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW. We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible. Good to know: A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period.  To Apply: 
        Complete the question in the online application. The question will require you to provide specific examples from your experience (4000-character limit per question). This question is shown below. Do not address these in your cover letter. Give
        an example of an environmentally focused remote sensing or GIS project you have been involved in? Describe your role, what methods or techniques you used and the key challenges and outcomes? The information provided in your application
        needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential
        role requirements.)  Applications Close: 11:59PM on Sunday 24th March Should you require further information about the role please contact; Sue Rea Team Leader, Spatial Imagery Services on 02 66402577.
        If you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Mark Russell, Recruitment Business Partner on (02) 9585 6851. If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.
salary: To $111,512 including salary, super, leave loading

title: Research Scientist, Environmental Sensing and Automation
description:
The role
Deakin University is currently expanding its presence in regional Australia and has an exciting opportunity for an Electronic / Automation Engineer / Software Engineer specialising in Agricultural technologies with particular focus in wireless
          sensing and automation in Agricultural systems to join the team. The group designs and delivers world-class research and design solutions to help farmers and land managers sustainably improve their water management both in Australia and overseas.
The position will work within the Centre for Regional and Rural Futures (CeRRF) irrigation research group located in the heart of Australia’s most intensively irrigated regions, in Griffith NSW.  The position is for an initial 3 year
          fixed-term period. 
As the successful candidate you will work closely with the research staff at our Griffith facility and with staff from the CeRRF at our other Deakin campuses.  Regular liaison and collaboration with external industry partners and companies
          both for the acquisition of equipment and material and in the implementation of externally funded projects such as field monitoring and demonstrations as well as the development of wireless sensing and automation systems which can be commercially
          utilised will also be key elements of the role.
To be successful, you’ll have:

field or laboratory experience in research or industry settings with software development experience and experience maintaining sensing and/or control networks for soils, water or environmental parameters, or similar transferable skills which
            could be applied to agricultural environments
expertise in IoT sensing systems and their deployment and maintenance in a range of environments to collect sensed parameters information for research projects
an ability to program micro-controllers for sensing and control applications in IoT settings
industry or Post-doctoral research experience evidenced by the creation of patents, publications, industry outputs, conference papers, reports, or professional or technical contributions in collaboration with industry
a drivers licence as well as a willingness to live and work in Griffith, NSW.  A PhD is preferred but not essential

Your key responsibilities will be to:

conduct team based research within the field of sensing systems for water, soil and nutrient management
provide expertise, advice and support related to environmental wireless sensing and automation systems used across a range of externally funded projects undertaken by the centre
prepare and develop grant applications and research proposal submissions to external funding bodies
conduct research and engage in scholarly publication, both independently and in research teams and supervision of Masters and PhD level students
maintaining links and partnerships with rural grower groups and the farming community

Culture 
Deakin University is proud to be recognised as an organisation that offers a friendly, supportive and challenging working environment. Our staff are committed to making a genuine difference to people’s lives through excellence in education and
          research.
We acknowledge the importance of providing a dynamic and diverse working environment and offer variety in day-to-day roles as well as professional development opportunities to assist staff to grow and progress their careers.
Deakin University staff have the opportunity to interact with colleagues from a diverse range of cultures and professional backgrounds, all of whom share a common interest in lifelong learning.
Benefits 
We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Some of Deakin’s workplace benefits include:

17% superannuation
flexible work arrangements
discounts with third party suppliers for health insurance, car rentals IT and more

About us 
The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive
          years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.
We have a network of campuses, learning centres and research centres across Victoria and corporate offices in Melbourne, China, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka.  Our online Cloud campus provides more than 13,000 students with access to state-of-the-art
          digital tools and direct access to world-renowned academics.
As a Victorian university with a global impact, Deakin is translating its research into commercial outcomes that will help drive innovation for Australia’s economy.
Applications close on Sunday 24 March 2019. When applying, please include a complete resume and responses to the selection criteria. Research Fellow 492334.pdf Senior Research Fellow 492334.pdf
At Deakin we value diversity, embrace difference and nurture a connected, safe and respectful community.  We recognise that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse with a variety of backgrounds, experiences and responsibilities. In many cases, academic careers can be put on hold through career breaks or part-time work arrangements to take on caring duties, gain experience in other industries, for medical reasons or other personal circumstances.  
Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.

title: Climate Research Scientist
description:
The Bureau undertakes research in fulfilment of its responsibilities as a national research agency, contributing to the development of weather and climate applications for the needs of the Australian community, supporting the Bureau's operational
          services, and advancing meteorological and earth system science in Australia and globally. The Science to Services Program carries out the majority of research and development activities in the Bureau, covering the broad fields of weather, climate,
          oceanography, earth systems modelling, and applications.
The Climate Research Section focuses more specifically on climate projections, climate dynamics and feedbacks, intra-seasonal to decadal predictability, climate model assessment, and prediction products and verification. Much of the research and
          development work is carried out on high performance computing (HPC) platforms at the Bureau and the National Computational Infrastructure (NCI), based at the Australian National University.
We are looking for an outstanding climate scientist to conduct climate research to improve understanding of past and future climate change and climate variability in the Australian region. You will be a member of a small team that contributes
          to research programmes including a three-year climate research programme with the Victorian government. The team conducts research to determine the underlying causes of observed climate change and climate variability and to determine likely
          future changes to climate. 
You will conduct research, both independently and under guidance, into climate change and climate variability, and analyse observational data and extremely large data sets based on output from many climate models using a variety of sophisticated
          statistical techniques. This research will be used to improve understanding of past and future climate change and climate variability in the Australian region, with a particular focus on the state of Victoria.
You will need to have:

a very good understanding of climate variability and climate change in the Australian region and beyond. This includes knowledge of major factors influencing Australian climate, including ENSO, naturally-occurring decadal climate variability,
            and the enhanced greenhouse effect;
flexibility to work effectively and productively as a member of a team under the direction of more senior scientists, and an ability to plan and undertake research and to publish research results, in the international peer-reviewed literature,
            of relevance to the Bureau’s mission, and to contribute to the milestone reports for external stakeholders; and
strong programming skills, including extensive experience with UNIX, and with scientific and visualisation languages such as IDL, NCL, and/or Python. Some knowledge of GIS is desirable.

The applicant will also need to have an excellent knowledge of climate variability and climate change in the Australian region, the ability to devise, test and publish research in the international peer-reviewed literature, the ability to meet
          deadlines, work effectively as part of a small team, and have extensive experience in programming in a UNIX environment and in the use of scientific visualisation tools.
The position will involve close collaboration with other scientific and technical staff in the Bureau and other agencies. Experience liaising effectively with external stakeholders or the potential to do so is an advantage.
Classification of the position upon commencement will be determined by the level of experience and skills of the successful candidate. 
Mandatory requirements:
A degree or diploma from an Australian educational institution or comparable overseas qualification, which is appropriate duties; OR
Other comparable qualifications appropriate to the duties

title: Remote Sensing Scientist
description:
Job Title:  Remote Sensing Scientist (12 Roles Available)Job Grade / Classification:  Environment Officer Class 7Employment Type: Temporary up to 24 Months Location: Parramatta, Albury, Newcastle, Armidale, Dubbo, Grafton Agency overviewThe
        Department of Planning & Environment is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.  The Department’s vision – “Planning
        for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment” – provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry
        stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment.  The NSW Office of Environment and Heritage (OEH) is a part of the Planning and Environment Cluster. It aims to enrich life in
        NSW by helping the community to conserve and enjoy our environment and heritage. For more information go to http://www.environment.nsw.gov.au/. This role will work for
        Science Division, which sits within the Office of Environment and Heritage. Science Division provides scientific evidence and knowledge to underpin environmental decision making, regulation and service delivery. About the Role: The position of Remote Sensing Scientist  is  part of a dynamic team that is  spread across  various locations in NSW.  The Remote Sensing Scientist reports to Senior Team members and is  responsible for: 
        
Contributing to large and complex scientific/technical projects 
Providing skilled GIS/remote sensing support 
Providing timely advice and communication as required
Developing and presenting technical scientific reports 
Contributing to the data management of remote sensed data
Delivering high quality science through maintaining high level, up to date knowledge and skills in relevant areas 
 Experience with scripting in python or linux is desirable. Please see the role description for further details about this role. Essential requirements:

Scientific qualifications, knowledge and demonstrated experience of delivering statewide  scientifically rigorous projects using remote sensed imagery interpretation, analysis and assessment.
Extensive experience with remote sensing and GIS software programs and data management.
 Please note: There may be opportunities for ongoing Remote Sensing Scientist roles in the future. Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:

Role Description 
Application Guide 
Applying for a role in the NSW Public Sector 
  Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed
        to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW. We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible. Good to know: A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period.  To Apply: 
        Complete the question in the online application. The question will require you to provide specific examples from your experience (4000-character limit per question). This question is shown below. Do not address these in your cover letter. Give
        an example of an environmentally focused remote sensing or GIS project you have been involved in? Describe your role, what methods or techniques you used and the key challenges and outcomes? The information provided in your application
        needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential
        role requirements.)  Applications Close: 11:59PM on Sunday 24th March Should you require further information about the role please contact; Sue Rea Team Leader, Spatial Imagery Services on 02 66402577.
        If you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Mark Russell, Recruitment Business Partner on (02) 9585 6851. If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work For NSW website.
salary: To $111,512 including salary, super, leave loading

title: Group Leader (Medical Scientist)
description:
Group Leader (Medical Scientist)
The Victorian Clinical Genetics Services (VCGS), the diagnostic testing arm of the Murdoch Children’s Research Institute located at the Royal Children’s Hospital in Melbourne, is looking for a senior medical scientist (full-time preferred) to
          take on a leadership role (Group Leader) in our Cytogenetics laboratory. VCGS is Australia’s pre-eminent genetics services providing diagnostic, clinical, and scientific leadership in Australasia, and globally. We achieve our excellence through
          a diverse and inclusive, multidisciplinary team of clinical geneticists, genetic counsellors, laboratory scientists, clinical bioinformaticians, laboratory technicians and support staff. Our people are our biggest asset, and we offer a vast
          range of benefits, support, and opportunities for our staff.
Cytogenetics laboratory
The Cytogenetics laboratory is part of the Division of Genetics & Genomics, which offers a comprehensive portfolio of routine and specialised genetic and genomic tests, including pre- and post-natal Cytogenetics, Molecular Genetics, and Clinical
          Genomics. Our unique setting allows for close integration with all our testing units, as well as the clinical service, and a wide range of research groups. This creates a best-in-class diagnostic service, delivering highest quality results backed
          by continuous development of both our staff and our technologies. As a not-for-profit organisation, all proceeds go back into research, which means we can continue to develop innovative solutions to complex problems.
Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities

Oversee and direct daily operations of the unit(s)
Work as part of the senior management team to ensure quality of diagnostic assays and reports are of a high standard
Reporting and interpretation of both normal and complex abnormal cases in your area of expertise
Manage and review reporting policy including standard interpretation and comments
Work as part of the senior management team to generate revenue and meet expenses targets
Provide direction and leadership to ensure effective operations, complete customer satisfaction and long-term sustainable growth
Actively manage staff and workloads to ensure adherence to TAT targets and quality standards
Promote a positive, collaborative, team oriented and efficient work environment
Ensures full compliance with the VCGS quality system, NATA accreditation requirements, the ISO 15189 standard, and all other applicable standards and guidelines
Oversee the training of cytogenetic staff in all relevant assays

Essential Criteria:

Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Applied Science and/or Honours
Relevant Fellowship Qualification (FHGSA, FFSc (RCPA), or equivalent
Strong communication and leadership skills
Must have a full knowledge and practical experience of all day to day procedures carried out in a cytogenetics/molecular diagnostic laboratory
Demonstrable experience in the management of staff and workloads
Demonstrable ability to produce high quality results in a high-pressure environment
Demonstrable ability to initiate and develop new diagnostic or research procedures applicable in their laboratory environment
Working with Children & National Police Clearance (if appointed) in compliance with the Victorian Governments Child Safety Standards.
Your right to reside and work in Australia and you meeting any applicable visa conditions at commencement of employment

Only applicants who address the key selection criteria will be considered. Please place your responses to the key selection criteria at the end of your cover letter. For more information on this position, please contact: Dr Sebastian Lunke:
          sebastian.lunke@vcgs.org.au

Please note, applications will only be considered when submitted via the MCRI website. Please click apply to proceed with your application.
Appointment Duration: 3 years
Salary Range: (Grade 3-4)   $94,307.20 - $127,899.20 per annum plus super
Closing Date: 5pm Friday 5 April 2019
Position Reference: 16124

title: Research Scientist, Environmental Sensing and Automation
description:
The role
Deakin University is currently expanding its presence in regional Australia and has an exciting opportunity for an Electronic / Automation Engineer / Software Engineer specialising in Agricultural technologies with particular focus in wireless
          sensing and automation in Agricultural systems to join the team. The group designs and delivers world-class research and design solutions to help farmers and land managers sustainably improve their water management both in Australia and overseas.
The position will work within the Centre for Regional and Rural Futures (CeRRF) irrigation research group located in the heart of Australia’s most intensively irrigated regions, in Griffith NSW.  The position is for an initial 3 year
          fixed-term period. 
As the successful candidate you will work closely with the research staff at our Griffith facility and with staff from the CeRRF at our other Deakin campuses.  Regular liaison and collaboration with external industry partners and companies
          both for the acquisition of equipment and material and in the implementation of externally funded projects such as field monitoring and demonstrations as well as the development of wireless sensing and automation systems which can be commercially
          utilised will also be key elements of the role.
To be successful, you’ll have:

field or laboratory experience in research or industry settings with software development experience and experience maintaining sensing and/or control networks for soils, water or environmental parameters, or similar transferable skills which
            could be applied to agricultural environments
expertise in IoT sensing systems and their deployment and maintenance in a range of environments to collect sensed parameters information for research projects
an ability to program micro-controllers for sensing and control applications in IoT settings
industry or Post-doctoral research experience evidenced by the creation of patents, publications, industry outputs, conference papers, reports, or professional or technical contributions in collaboration with industry
a drivers licence as well as a willingness to live and work in Griffith, NSW.  A PhD is preferred but not essential

Your key responsibilities will be to:

conduct team based research within the field of sensing systems for water, soil and nutrient management
provide expertise, advice and support related to environmental wireless sensing and automation systems used across a range of externally funded projects undertaken by the centre
prepare and develop grant applications and research proposal submissions to external funding bodies
conduct research and engage in scholarly publication, both independently and in research teams and supervision of Masters and PhD level students
maintaining links and partnerships with rural grower groups and the farming community

Culture 
Deakin University is proud to be recognised as an organisation that offers a friendly, supportive and challenging working environment. Our staff are committed to making a genuine difference to people’s lives through excellence in education and
          research.
We acknowledge the importance of providing a dynamic and diverse working environment and offer variety in day-to-day roles as well as professional development opportunities to assist staff to grow and progress their careers.
Deakin University staff have the opportunity to interact with colleagues from a diverse range of cultures and professional backgrounds, all of whom share a common interest in lifelong learning.
Benefits 
We value our staff and understand that they are more than just their jobs, that's why we offer benefits that enhance work life. Some of Deakin’s workplace benefits include:

17% superannuation
flexible work arrangements
discounts with third party suppliers for health insurance, car rentals IT and more

About us 
The flexible learning options we provide our students and our diverse team of professionals and academic experts has enabled us to achieve a 5-star rating by the prestigious university ranking organisation Quacquarelli Symonds. For eight consecutive
          years, we've achieved the highest level of overall student satisfaction among Victorian universities.
We have a network of campuses, learning centres and research centres across Victoria and corporate offices in Melbourne, China, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka.  Our online Cloud campus provides more than 13,000 students with access to state-of-the-art
          digital tools and direct access to world-renowned academics.
As a Victorian university with a global impact, Deakin is translating its research into commercial outcomes that will help drive innovation for Australia’s economy.
Applications close on Sunday 24 March 2019. When applying, please include a complete resume and responses to the selection criteria. Research Fellow 492334.pdf Senior Research Fellow 492334.pdf
At Deakin we value diversity, embrace difference and nurture a connected, safe and respectful community.  We recognise that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse with a variety of backgrounds, experiences and responsibilities. In many cases, academic careers can be put on hold through career breaks or part-time work arrangements to take on caring duties, gain experience in other industries, for medical reasons or other personal circumstances.  
Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.

title: Post-doctoral Researcher in Radiation Oncology Medical Physics
description:
Employment Type: Temporary Full Time (Up to 2 years)Position Classification: Hospital Scientist (Scientific Officer)Remuneration: $31.62 - $45.81 per hourHours Per Week: 38Requisition ID: REQ97080
        Where you'll be workingWestern Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) is responsible for providing primary and secondary health care for people living in the Auburn, Blacktown, and The
          Hills Shire, Holroyd and Parramatta Local Government Areas (LGAs) and tertiary care to residents of the Greater Western Region. We are committed to our vision of 'better health services for the people of western Sydney and beyond' and to the
          delivery of health care or related services in line with our core values of collaboration, openness, respect and empowerment.
What you'll be doing
The position will have a focus on translational research and development related to applications of deformable image registration with an aim to translate, develop and implement techniques into clinical practice in the radiation therapy workflow.
          
-------------------------------------------------------------

People with disabilities who meet the selection criteria are encouraged to apply; and where required, WSLHD will implement reasonable adjustment consistent with industry standard.
Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health organisations. For more information, please visit: http://www.steppingup.health.nsw.gov.au/ Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander
          people are encouraged to apply.
*Westmead hospital car parking allocation model is changing. There is a waitlist for parking for new staff commencing at Westmead Hospital. This does not apply for staff with disability*
Please note: A person who is not an Australian citizen or a permanent resident is only eligible for temporary employment for a period not longer than the duration of their current visa or a period not shorter than the duration of the advertised
          position.

------------------------------------------------------------- 
 
Essential Criteria:

Vaccination Category: A Checks: National Police Check Qualifications: Science degree or equivalent qualification
-------------------------------------------------------------

Selection Criteria:

PhD in a relevant area from a recognised institution.
Demonstrated experience in the Technical/scientific areas such as medical imaging, computer vision, IT and its application to health.
Demonstrated ability of research experience including but not limited to publications and conference contributions.
Demonstrated skills and knowledge on scientific methods, analysis, writing and communications.
Proven record of strong organisational and project management skills.
 Proven ability to both work in a team in close collaboration, as well as the ability to work independently.


 Need more information?   1) Click here for the Position Description   2)
          Find out more about applying for this position   3) For role related queries or questions contact Jonathan Sykes on 0456 072 175 or Jonathan.Sykes@health.nsw.gov.au 
Applications Close: 21st March 2019     To view the position description or submit your applications please click the 'Apply' button below.  We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity,
        Ethical Practices, and the principles of Cultural Diversity and promote a smoke-free work environment. Appropriate criminal record and child protection checks conducted for all positions.

title: Assistant Scientist - Research & Development
description:
Work for a global company with some of the world’s most trusted and iconic brands. Be part of an exciting business where employees are recognised and career growth is nurtured.  PepsiCo Australia & New Zealand
          is home to some of the world’s most trusted brands such as Smith's Chips, Red Rock Deli, Sakata Rice Crackers, Pepsi Max and Gatorade! We are a progressive and people-focused business, and believe our diverse workforce is the key to our success.
          Because we value our employees and their families, we offer an agile and flexible working environment with an emphasis on work life balance and health, as well as plenty of learning opportunities and room to grow your career.  We currently
          have an opportunity to join our Research and Development Team as an Assistant Scientist on a 12 month contract.  This role is part-time and would suit someone looking to work 3 days or 5 short days with
          flexible hours. The purpose of this role is to support the ANZ Seasoning Team, preparing seasoning specifications and other related documentation to help drive the innovation agenda. You will be a valuable contributor to the team.  You will be responsible for:

Preparation and tracking of new and existing Seasoning specifications into PepsiCo's Specification System
Working with Suppliers for updated specification information
Preparation of Seasoning Ingredient lists and Nutritional information in database
Preparation of other Seasoning related documentation
Other Seasoning team support as required

  To be successful in this role you will have:

University Science or related degree
At least 1+ years’ experience in the food Industry
experience using the AFGC Product Information Form or experience developing raw material specifications
Competency in computer applications - Word, Excel, Power point, Database software
Strong technical, communication and organisational skills
Strong bias towards processes & systems
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent computer skills and the ability to learn new systems quickly
Self-motivated with a strong attention to detail

 
What we can offer you:

Excellent work-life balance with our flexible office environment
A competitive remuneration package
Discounted retail and service benefits through our PepsiCo extras program

 Working at PepsiCo:  Your positive attitude will be rewarded with excellent long term local and global career opportunities, and ongoing professional development along with a fun and rewarding working environment.  You will be a key part of a dynamic team and a valuable contributor to a global company that is one of the FMCG market leaders. At PepsiCo, we recognise our people as a key part of our business and career progression within the business
          is encouraged and supported.  We are committed to recruiting, training and retaining high quality people, and with our new, state-of-the-art office located in a convenient location close to public transport and parking, we believe this
          to be an environment where our people thrive.  Interested? Know someone who might be? This is a great opportunity to join the PepsiCo ANZ team.  PEPSICO’S job application process:

Submit your application via our website, including a cover letter & resume
Interview and skills evaluation
Online Assessment process
Reference and background checks

 Our Commitment is to deliver Sustained Growth through Empowered People acting with Responsibility and Trust.

title: Senior Research Scientist - Veterinary Bacteriology
description:
SENIOR RESEARCH SCIENTIST - VETERINARY BACTERIOLOGY

$96,942 - $117,293 (Plus Superannuation)
Fixed term, 3 years
Usual Work Hours: Full Time (flexibility may be available)
Usual work location: Bundoora (flexibility may be available)

Grasp the challenge of leading a multidisciplinary team and coordinating and undertaking research to implement technical and theoretical developments in molecular biology, biosecurity and diagnostics of animal bacteria and for food safety.  The
          role provides the scope to contribute to the development of research and business opportunities, identify future research needs and contribute to funding submissions for research projects to improve knowledge of infectious disease of animals. 
          You will have the opportunity to interact with external stakeholders, including Australian and international research centres, and major commercial partners.
For appointment to this position, the following skills will be demonstrated -

a degree in Biological / Agricultural Sciences, with experience as a Senior Research Scientist in the field of bacteriology and molecular biology;
experience in leading research projects related to molecular veterinary bacteriology, genomics and diagnostic development;
extensive knowledge of veterinary bacterial diagnostics and experience in working under a compliance system;
well-developed oral and written communication skills with experience in preparation of reports and scientific publications, and ability to provide dynamic presentations tailored to the audience;
skills in team leadership and development, plus the capacity for self-direction and team work; and
excellent stakeholder management skills.

As part of the Machinery of Government changes announced by the Premier of Victoria, from 1 Jan 2019 DEDJTR transitioned into the Department of Transport (DoT) & the Department of Jobs, Precincts & Regions (DJPR).  The position of
          Senior Research Scientist - Veterinary Bacteriology will sit within the Department of Jobs, Precincts and Regions (DJPR) and is part of the Agriculture Victoria Research branch in the Agriculture Victoria Group.  Agriculture Victoria works
          with industry and community stakeholders to support the agriculture, food and fibre sector to become more globally competitive, innovative and resilient.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Police Records Check prior to commencing employment with the Department.
For a confidential discussion, please call Fiona Constable, Research Leader - Microbiology on 03 9032 7283 or 0407 723 086.
For further information on the position, please see the attached position description.  To apply, please click the ‘Apply Now' button below.
Applications close at midnight on 17 March 2019 and must address the Key Selection Criteria outlined in the Position Description.

title: Scientist (Blood Bank) - Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology
description:
About the Organisation
Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology is one of the largest pathology practices in Australia, providing comprehensive services to patients and doctors over a large geographic area throughout Queensland and New South Wales and employing more than
          2000 people.
Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology services the Brisbane metropolitan area and regional areas extending as far north as Cairns and south to Coffs Harbour and offers both routine testing and specialised testing for referral laboratories throughout
          Australia.
About the Opportunity
Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology now has an exciting full-time opportunity for a Scientist to work in the blood bank department of our Bowen Hills laboratory. As this is the blood bank referral site for Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology,
          previous experience in a blood bank laboratory is essential. Applicants must be flexible to work across day and evening shifts in a 7 day roster. Some of the responsibilities of the role include:

Performing a range of routine and advanced blood bank tests;
Liaising with clients to ensure appropriate management of cases;
Upholding quality standards within the laboratory by adhering to departmental quality system procedures;
Complying with the occupational health and safety policy and programs to ensure personal health and safety, and the health andsafety of others in the workplace; and
Satisfying the requirements of customers both internal and external through the provision of reliable and efficient service levels. 

About the Benefits
The high level of service provided by Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology is delivered by a dedicated staff comprising of pathologists, scientists, technicians, laboratory assistants, collection personnel, couriers, computer personnel, pathology
          services assistants and other support staff. 
The organisation offers staff members the opportunity to improve their skills through ongoing training, and provides an avenue for career development and advancement.
Permanent employees enjoy the following benefits: 

Parental and Adoption Leave- SNP staff receive 6 weeks paid maternity and adoption leave as per Collective Workplace Agreement.
Staff Services Committee- provides functions and events for staff, fully funded by the Practice
Employee Assistance Program- a free, confidential and voluntary counselling service provided as a resource to employees of Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology, as well as immediate family, with the aim of assisting with the
            resolution of personal and work related problems which may affect quality of life or work performance
Private Health Insurance- staff have access to discounted private health insurance through MBF, HCF and Medibank Private
Pathology Services- staff and their immediate family (their children, partners and their parents) have access to bulk billed Pathology Services
X-Ray Services- staff and their immediate family (their children, partners and their parents) have access to bulk billed X-Ray and other diagnostic imaging through Queensland X-Ray
Smoke Free Workplace- for those staff wanting to use nicotine replacement therapy in quitting, management provides a level of financial assistance towards the cost of nicotine replacement patches.
For more information and to apply, please click "apply now".

title: Biomedical Scientist
description:
Thinking of Evolving? Good News! You have landed in the right place! Your World can develop and help you grow your Biomedical Scientist career! 
Would you love the opportunity to gain international Healthcare experience? If you're interested in starting a new career overseas, our team in the UK provides an exciting number of Allied Health roles throughout the country
With the option of locum and fixed-term contracts available, we can work with you to find the right role for you!
Your World has been offering high quality, flexible staffing solutions to the health and social care sectors for over 15 years. We work with public and private health clients, local authorities and social care providers throughout the UK.
 
About you: 
To be successful for these positions you will possess the following Essential Criteria:

Degree Qualification in Biomedical Science
Eligible for the Tier 5 Mobility Visa
Proven experience working as a Biomedical Scientist in a laboratory setting

 
From the beginning Your World Healthcare has always been about you.
Our friendly team aim to eliminate the stress of day to day job hunting by offering a consultative approach which enables you to sit back and let us do the hard work for you.
Working across Government, Not for Profit, Private, Community and more - we are extremely well networked and can keep you up to date with all the latest healthcare news across United Kingdom.
 
Why Your World Healthcare?

A fast track direct approach into opportunities outside recruitment pools and lengthy interview processes
Dedicated registration and compliance specialists to offer a seamless and efficient service
Once registered with us you will have your own dedicated, personal consultant to help guide you
All of our consultants have an unparalleled knowledge of the market
If you are looking for adventure further afield, our international service is second to none

 
Benefits 

Gain new qualification and improve professional skills
International work experience and enhance your CV
Learn new working styles and build international networks
Experience the rich British culture
Flexible working arrangements to suit your lifestyle

 
For more information on this role or to apply, get in touch with David Ngo on 02 9411 7440 or email your CV to David.Ngo@ywrec.com

title: Senior Method Development Scientist (Immunoassay)
description:
Agilex Biolabs is a Regulated Bioanalytical laboratory which offers specialised services supporting drug development for the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry. 
The industry has been experiencing significant growth globally, and the business is now on a new phase of growth with new shareholders who are looking to invest for the future.
Opportunity
Due to entering a new phase of growth, this exciting newly created position will be responsible for performing method developments and method transfers for ligand binding assays and providing analytical and scientific support for the Immunoassay
          Laboratory team.
Role
Key Responsibilities include:

Development, transfers and pre-validation of robust bioanalytical methods (mainly for New Biological Entities, Biosimilars, Anti Drug Antibodies, Neutralising Antibodies, and Biomarkers); that will meet the Bioanalytical Method Validation guidelines
            of the regulatory authorities (FDA, EMA) in a timely and cost-effective manner.
Lead troubleshooting and technical investigations for bioanalytical laboratory methods with support from the Research and Development Manager and/or senior staff members. 
Assists Study Director and the bioanalytical laboratory team in method transfers as required.
Write and Review Analytical Laboratory Methods.
Timely and effective communication with clients and internal Bioanalytical Regulatory Group on project status in an environment with rapidly changing priorities.
Support Operational Management to implement training programs for new staff.
Contribute to internal CPR strategic innovation meetings and initiatives.
Escalate troubleshooting and other issues with assays to the Research and Development Manager that lead to additional activity outside of scope of work or significant increase in timelines.
Perform scientific review of CPR SOPs.
Support the Research and Development Manager by following processes for managing R&D projects and escalation of any resourcing concerns as required.
Support the bioanalytical laboratory team and Research and Development Manger by providing scientific input into assay development, troubleshooting and recent regulatory guidance.   
Support review of new projects as required.
Adhere to OECD GLP regulations, guidelines and SOPs, as applicable.

This is a fulltime permanent role with an immediate start for the right applicant, business hours expected 9am-5pm weekdays. Competitive salary, visa sponsorship support and relocation assistance for suitable qualified and experienced candidates.
About You
You will have:

An ordinary degree in the appropriate discipline.
Minimum 4 years experience of working in an analytical laboratory (CRO experience highly desirable).
5 years experience in analytical method development, specifically ligand binding assays.
High level of written and verbal communication skills.
Proven ability to deliver tasks on time and with a high degree of accuracy.
Demonstrated efficient problem solving and scientific data interpretation abilities.
Demonstrated experience in communicating with clients on high level science issues.
Proven ability to maintain strict adherence to client confidentiality issues. 
Ability to multitask in a fast paced environment.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated initiative, trust and reliability and the ability to work largely unsupervised.
Experience gained in a regulated bioanalytical laboratory desired.

To Apply

To apply for this role please click on the 'apply for this job' link and submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your skills and experience, please submit as one Microsoft Word document.
As we receive a high volume of applications for our vacancies, we will only contact you directly, should you be successful through to the next stage of our recruitment process.
For further information about Agilex Biolabs Pty Ltd, please visit our website at www.agilexbiolabs.com

title: Scientist G1/G2
description:
Austin HospitalPermanent Part Time
Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in
          cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation.
An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and highly experienced Scientist Grade 1 or 2 to join our Department of Respiratory and Sleep Medicine.
The Austin Sleep Laboratory is a centre for excellence. As part of a teaching hospital, this is a large clinical laboratory service performing a comprehensive range of diagnostic patient testing; and treatment implementation and optimisation.
          The laboratory plays a cornerstone role in the department and has links to the wider hospital service as well as having links to other clinical services and academic institutions. In particular, it provides services to the state-wide Victorian
          Respiratory Support Service for patients with respiratory failure and has a proud association with the Institute for Breathing and Sleep.
There are several permanent part time Grade 1 / Grade 2 Scientist positions available in the Sleep Laboratory, at the Department of Respiratory and Sleep Medicine.  A mixture of day, evening and night shifts are available.  (125 hours
          per fortnight). The grade will be determined by current EBA requirements and associated processes.
As such, these vacancies represent an exciting opportunity for enthusiastic and suitably qualified scientists.
The successful applicants will enjoy the combination of technical, clinical and physiology skills required for the position and are able to work a shift roster.
Sleep laboratory experience is highly desirable, although full training can be provided.
Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program.
All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check.
Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve.  Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.Enquiries:        Julie TolsonPh: (03) 9496 3058Applications Close: 21/03/2019To view the position description or submit your application please click the 'Apply Now' button below.

title: Scientist
description:
The Opportunity

We are seeking a highly-motivated Scientist or Bioprocess Engineer to join our process development team on a Maternity Leave Fixed Term contract until mid-November 2019. You will play a key role in the development of cell culture media and processes
          for optimising expression and quality of recombinant proteins in mammalian cell culture. This role in the Cell Culture & Purification Development department requires technical expertise in mammalian cell culture process development where
          you will apply your cell culture skills to develop and optimise cell culture media and processes suitable for manufacture of recombinant proteins.
The Role

It will be your responsibility to:

Conduct experiments using shake flasks, WAVE bioreactors and high-throughput small-scale cell culture systems eg. deepwell plates and spin-tubes on the Tecan system and AMBR microbioreactor system
Coordinate activities relating to the planning and careful execution of experimental protocols
Ensure accurate and timely data collection including documentation of experiments
Actively participate in the analysis of data in conjunction with the cell culture team
Author documents including standard operating procedures, experimental protocols and reports
Communicate ideas and results succinctly to the team in reports and Powerpoint presentations
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Ensure high safety standards

To be successful

We’re looking for a dynamic applicant who demonstrates the following qualifications and skills:

Bachelor of Science, Chemical Engineering, Biotechnology, Bioprocess Engineering or related discipline with at least three years experience in a bioprocess development field.  It is an advantage if you have specific experience relating
            to mammalian cell culture and media development. Alternatively skills and experience associated with related process development disciplines including microbial cultures, application of bioreactor analytical techniques or pilot scale operations
            are also valued.
Proven ability to be independent and self-motivated, demonstrating flexibility to flourish in a fast paced environment
Understands new scientific concepts and ideas
Aptitude for statistical analysis and experimental design
Experience in fermentation and/or cell culture process development disciplines
Excellent grasp of sterile techniques

 
The Company:
CSL Limited is a company that fosters a work culture emphasising Superior Performance, Innovation, Integrity, Collaboration and Customer Focus with a commitment to support, train and grow its people. As a genuine leader in the biopharmaceutical
          industry, CSL is a multinational ASX Listed Company that is actively growing its Australian based manufacturing operations to support global growth. CSL develops, manufactures and markets products to treat and prevent serious human medical conditions
          and is globally one of the largest manufacturers of plasma-derived therapies.
How to Apply:
Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV and covering letter.
Applications close Sunday 17th March, 2019
Employment screening, including criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience and stated qualifications, Australian working rights and other relevant checks form part of the candidate suitability
