Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the “apply for this job” button below you will be directed to our Online Centre
          where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Collection statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.
Alternatively, if you would like more information on the role, please contact Helen on 02 6103 1819 or also at helen.shabhatiwi@modis.com
Modis is a national professional services company with global capability. Our committed and talented professionals have delivered world class IT and business consulting services across a wide range of industries. As a member of
          global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.
 Modis is committed to all forms of workforce diversity and we invite and encourage applications from women and indigenous Australians.

title: Microsoft Business Intelligence Developer/ Analyst
description:
Box Hill North location
IT&T group
Permanent opportunity
Excellent salary and culture
 We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Microsoft Business Intelligence Developer/ Analyst to join this leading global group which delivers specialised technology solutions to corporate, industrial and government clients across Australasia. 
        This role has been created due to growth and there are several IT projects in the pipeline to be delivered over the next 3 years.    This company has developed strong IT capability and is using the latest technology to provide
        innovative solutions to the business.  You will be working in a collaborative environment which requires its IT talent to be hyper agile in order to respond to business needs.    Key responsibilities 

Translate business requirements in to efficient technical design.
Maintain and extend the ETL framework, data analysis and database design and data modelling using Kimball dimensional modelling.
Manage current BI solutions, design and create new SSIS packages and SSRS reports.
Design and develop visualisations using PowerBI.
Manage and extend current Web based solutions, WCF/ WebAPI services and business applications.
Problem analysis, process improvements and efficient issues resolutions.
Creating and maintaining detailed documentation to ensure effective handovers and knowledge transfer.
 Your skills and Experience 

Strong software development experience, with the last 5 years being in core MSBI development.
Demonstrated knowledge of DW principles, data analysis, database design and data modelling using Kimball method.
Detailed knowledge of ETL solution design and reporting.
Strong programming skills and technical experience using T-SQL.
Demonstrated experience with database design using MSSQL, implementing data solutions, developing complex Stored Procedures, Functions, User-defined Functions and Views.
Extensive PowerBI experience developing visualisations.
Solid experience with SSIS, SSRS and SSAS.
Strong technical skills using C# and .Net.
Team Foundation Server (or other Source Control).
Exposure to MS Access programming using VBA (advantageous).
Good knowledge of SDLC and familiarity with agile principles
Strong communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively and enjoys taking ownership of a project
Strong problem solving skills
Excellent process compliance and documentation skills
 To apply for this role, click ‘APPLY NOW’, please submit resume in WORD format only. For more information, please call our office on 0499 073 676.

title: Business Intelligence and Database Specialist
description:
Deliverables:

Design, architecture, management and support for database and data analytics products with a focus on integrating data sources into repositories to be queried for reports and interactive dashboards
Design and implement solution architecture for Microsoft Power BI, Power BI Report Server and Power BI Pro within a production environment on both a PROTECTED network and public cloud tenancy
Assist business areas by working with semi-structured data to create and publish interactive Power BI reports to explore, analyse and extract value from the data, for both internal and public use, with a focus on automating manual data processing

title: Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence Developer
description:

Our industry leading client pride themselves on providing a premier service and products to their clients on an international scale. With a distinguished reputation spanning over the last 35 years, our client is seen as a pioneer and innovator
          within their industry.

title: Data Manager
description:
Newly created role to determine and deliver the data management and analytics strategy for this unique business dealing with large & complex data sets.
This is a greenfield role that will play a key role in delivering a criticial strategic objective in allowing the client harness their data and derive insights for the business.
Responsibilities:

Developing database/data warehouse strategies to satisfy likely future business and operations strategies
Managing the strategic direction, development and operational implementation of Data warehousing and Business Intelligence solutions
Analysing and recommending Big Data principles and Cloud technologies as applicable
Ensure external stakeholders data and BI needs are understood and delivered under the direction of the relevant business units
Assist in the development & execution of the Data & Analytics strategy

Required skills & experience:

Extensive experience in data management & business intelligence

Background in leading a data team

Experience in BIG Data technologies and Data Visualisation tools on large Datasets

title: Business Intelligence Consultant - Financial Services
description:
In this particular role you will be working autonomously for a specific financial services company to help them with their Power BI reporting. 
 You will be engaging with client s with the goal to roll out a new reporting and data capability solutions and define "best practice" design capabilities across Power BI. Responsibilities include: 
 ·          Design, develop and build interactive Power BI  dashboard solutions for the business units 
 ·          Data modelling and the building out of key data sets for reporting 
 ·          Work with and advise IT on the implementation of technical specifications 
 ·          Partner with the business to define data requirements and confirm report layouts 
 ·          End to end development of Power BI solutions 
 To be considered for this role you will need: 
 ·          Hands on experience in Power BI development and design, Tableau will be considered 
 ·          Strong working knowledge with SQL, SSIS or Alteryx for processing of  data 
 ·          Excellent communication skills both written and verbal 
 This is a high profile role in a dynamic organisation which recognises that its people are the key to their success. 
 If you would like to hear more about this exciting opportunity, please contact me with your resume at  nicolina.bosnic@tomexecutive.com  for a confidential discussion.

title: Business Development Manager | Business Intelligence
description:
The CompanyWork for a global company who are at the forefront of providing cutting edge business solutions for a multitude of tech, corporate and IT organisations.As a business intelligence provider they are
          focused on improving companies’ strategies by using both data analytics and projecting to allow organisations to make better informed business decisions.With the current global business and financial climate, business analytics and intelligence
          is a rapidly expanding industry that allows for companies to streamline their products and focus their efforts on the best way to maximise their output and minimise costing.The company specialises in consulting within the IT space and
          advises on the buying and selling of a range of IT products to multinationals as well as the small to medium enterprise. They offer a range of products available at various costing despening on need.The Role

As a technologically advanced and forward thinking organisation they pride themselves on building meaningful relationships with multinationals and SME’s to help them make informed business decisions.
You will be required to pitch the product and liaise with C level executives, guiding them in the benefits of using the platform the company produce or the importance of having consultancy work done.
Build relationships with decision makers and internal stakeholders

What’s in it for you?

Fantastic training and mentorship programs which encourage employees to build their career within the organisation.
Work for a company with a global reach and in an industry that is growing rapidly
A lucrative base wage and commission structure that will build rapidly
Provide you with a career where you can grow with the company and professional growth
Great culture and modern office with a great culture

What you need

Possess strong negotiation and closing skills
Experience in a business intelligence or a similar industry
Excellent communication both verbal and written
Confident communicator who has experience liaising with C-Level executives
Desire to exceed targets and achieve the financial success that is attainable
Proven track record of success within B2B sales

If you think you posses the right attributes to be a success within this role, please apply now or email your resume and a brief introduction to david.crawford@randstad.com.au or call 02 8298 3812.
At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

title: Data and Business Intelligence Insights Specialist
description:
Our client is a global leader within the pharmaceutical industry, this company consistently proven that they can provide a working environment with the kind of rewards and incentives you want! We support a flexible workplace and our office
        located in the Sydney CBD provides a great work environment with collaborative open space. This role will play an integral role in the execution of their BI Strategy and support of ongoing BI Reporting requirements. You
        will provide automated reporting solutions and data visualisations across the business, to motivate the organisation with more insightful reporting and analysis, by leveraging the capabilities of BI technologies to drive strategic commercial decisions.Manage
        SQL Server and databases, online analytical processing and ETL to extract, clean, conform and deliver data to the warehouse/SQL ServerReview and recommend requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed
        solution.  

MSBI Suite – SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS
Ability to develop complex BI reports and dashboards
Advanced level in analyzing large, complex, multi-dimensional datasets
Strong experience in ETL, data warehousing, data coding/writing database queries
Ability to work and engage with key stakeholders in the business
 Click APPLY or contact Orna Whyte, Consultant on 02 82431338 for a confidential discussion

title: ETL Analyst
description:
ETL Analyst

Bathurst Location
Fixed Term 12 Month Contract

 
Position Overview 
 
The role is an entry level position located within the Office of Strategic Planning and Information and contributes to the development and maintenance of data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will be responsible for contributing
          to project enhancements, including data migration activities, and provide technical support and troubleshoot existing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions.
 
 
Key Responsibilities

Maintaining and testing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions, including Database objects, ETL (extract, transform, Load) and OLAP (online analytical processing) cubes to required development standards with guidance from the Manager,
            DWBI and other team members.
Contribute to data and code migration activities across environments.
Maintain reference data across multiple subject areas.
Undertake quality assurance activities, including unit testing and peer review, to ensure development standards and support for SIT/UAT (system integration testing and user acceptance testing).
Monitor the company’s data warehouse and business intelligence environment, troubleshooting and resolving issues as required.
Maintain data warehouse and business intelligence architectural and process documentation.
Maintain knowledge of data warehousing and business intelligence techniques and best practices.

 
Selection Criteria 
 
Essential

Exposure to data warehouse concepts and methodologies and ETL (Extract, transform, load) architecture.
Demonstrated self-motivation and a passion for learning new technologies, business processes and approaches.
Experience or working knowledge with SQL (structured query language) programming and Relational Databases.
Good problem solving and verbal and written communication skills.
Exposure to ETL tools.
Knowledge of Azure Cloud computing and related services.

If the above sounds like you and you're on the hunt for a dynamic, innovative, fast-paced environment this is the place for you!
We've already embarked upon our national headhunt campaign for this one so if this is an opportunity you're interested in then get your CV across asap!
To Your Success!

title: Project Manager
description:
Project Manager Data Warehouse – Big Data – IoT

Melbourne Location / 6 Months
Big Data / IoT / Business Intelligence
 Green Lights Melbourne Delivery Team are looking for a Project Manager to manage strategic data projects in Warehouse / Business Intelligence / Data Analytics / Big Data & IoT space in terms of scope, time and resource.   Responsibilities:

Manage & oversee a series of projects on Big Data, Analytics and IoT
High client facing role
Work closely with all key stake holders, business and technical
Coordinate project delivery, ensure quality and configuration management
Proof of concept to prove the value of Big Data, Analytics and IoT
  Requirements:

Proven history of experience in managing IT projects in Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence / Big Data / Analytics / IoT projects
Prior hands-on experience with Analytics, Data Integration (DI), Business Intelligence (BI) and/or “big data” processing technologies
Experience in managing complex IT projects, applying different methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, SCRUM, etc.)
Experience in Enterprise Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence and Big Data - Hadoop (Pentaho, Cloudera or Hortonworks), Netezza;
Critical thinking and change oriented approach
PMP or Agile Certification is a plus.
 Green Light is one of Australia's most successful and fastest growing IT services businesses. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand,
        SE Asia and Europe.

title: BI Developer
description:
Greenstone is a leader in the sales and distribution of insurance products under a portfolio of credible owned and white-labelled brands. Brands include Real Insurance, RSPCA Pet Insurance, Guardian, Medibank, Woolworths and Australian Senior
          Insurance Agency and Choosi. 
The Opportunity
The BI Developer will be responsible for taking the Business Intelligence strategy to the next level through analysis of current business, reporting processes and data structures.
You will support the Business Intelligence team in the delivery of its strategy and work closely with senior stakeholders to understand the business requirements and provide Business Intelligence solutions.
This role is a 8 month fixed term contract (possible extension). 
Required skills & experience

Minimum 2 years’ experience in implementing Business Intelligence and Data warehousing solutions.
Proven experience working with the business to identify and develop reports meeting business needs.
SQL development skills. (2 years)
Recent experience with PowerBI, including DAX queries. (2 years)
Solid analytical and problem solving skills
Proactive, ability to work independently, as well as with large teams.
Bachelor qualifications in a related technical or business field.    

What's in it for you?

Fantastic employee benefits including access to onsite gym facilities, free monthly massages, weekly lunch and fresh fruit, onsite café
Competitive salary 
Great central location of Bella Vista - avoid the hustle and bustle of the city and the stressful commute!  

Who we are
We are an innovative company with diverse brands and operating divisions, who work together as one team. We strive to be the best provider of direct financial products by placing customers at the heart of everything we do. We care about
          what we do and making a positive impact on our community.
We have an inclusive and diverse culture. We work in a positive and energetic environment, where you can expect to find professional colleagues, driven to achieve results.
To be eligible you must be a permanent resident with full working rights in Australia.
Please send your resume to recruitment@greenstone.com.au or Apply Now

description:

My client, a marketing leading SME, is looking for an experienced BI Analyst to join their team due to increased demand from the business for BI reporting and information.

You will form part of the IT & Finance team, taking ownership of the BI capability in the business.

title: APS 5 Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
About the NDIA   The purpose of the National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is to implement the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) which will support a better life for hundreds of thousands
        of Australians with a significant and permanent disability. The NDIA will also provide great benefit to the families and carers of Australians living with a disability. The NDIS is designed to enhance the quality of life and increase economic
        and social participation for people with disability and will mean peace of mind for every Australian, for anyone who has, or might acquire, a disability. About the Position The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
        will execute Business Intelligence functions within the Data and Insurance Branch.The BI Analyst will work collaboratively within a creative, effective, agile and technically skilled team of data analysts to produce consistent and accurate
        reports and insights to improve Scheme performance.  Duties

Work collaboratively within a creative, effective, responsive and technically skilled data analyst team known as the Analytics Pool team.
Deliver Business Intelligence analytics that is coordinated and consistent with other accounts, and is presented in a way best suited to the audience.
Deliver an iterative and collaborative flow of information expertise.
Develop and deliver strong methodology and business resources.
Interpret trends and analysis in the context of the scheme.
Translate key data insights into value adding products.
Strong problem solving and an ability to connect analysis to real world problems and questions.
Complete work efficiently, in an agile environment, on time, with competing priorities and business demands.
Deliver high level of quality, product or service.
Collaborate across the Data and Insurance branch to ensure consistent analytics, actions and messaging.
Undertake activities to develop and maintain currency of knowledge in understanding the Scheme, that is, business context, goals and key performance indicators.
Champion good visual communication and a participant focussed approach across BI Insights more broadly.
Articulate complex information into simple messages that can be consumed by key stakeholders with varied levels of data literacy.
Work within a team and maintain a consistent and systematic approach.
Motivated to continue to develop technical and analytical skills and integrity to deliver quality work.
Participate in professional supervision and other duties as directed.
Meet agreed key performance indicators.
 Technical Competencies and Experience

Tertiary qualifications in mathematics, statistical, computer sciences discipline or relevant work experience.
Competency in technical programming languages, including SAS (Base, EG) or SQL; Python, R or Java (preferred).
Expert competency and experience in MS Excel.
Experience in utilising SAS Visual Analytics or other visualisation tools (preferred).
 About You To join our team you will:

have a positive contemporary attitude to people with disability along with an understanding and knowledge of disability and its impact on individuals
have adaptable communication and interpersonal skills
be able to manage confidential and sensitive information
be flexible and able to adapt to a changing environment
have high levels of integrity and professionalism to support our values and mission.
 For more information on NDIS including our values, capabilities and behaviours along with our application process, please refer to our website. Position Specifics

Further information can be found in the attached position description.
NDIA is committed to becoming a model employer for people with disability who are specifically encouraged to apply
Recruitability applies to this position: The RecruitAbility scheme supports people with disability applying for jobs in the Australian Public Service (APS) by giving you a better opportunity to put forward your skills and experience during the
            selection process.
Successful candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment National Police History check, and provide evidence of Australian Citizenship. Failure to do so may jeopardise your offer of employment.
Dependent on the role the appropriate working with children and/or vulnerable people checks may need to be undertaken as per State Legislation.
  If you have any queries, please contact: Eleni Kanaris0459 890 989 Eleni.Kanaris@ndis.gov.au  NDIA welcomes and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse culture and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability. Except where otherwise provided by law, it is the policy of NDIA to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, colour, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. In addition, NDIA will provide reasonable adjustments for qualified individuals with disabilities.   The NDIA welcomes and encourages interest from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People and people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds.   For further information about joining the NDIA,
        visit www.ndis.gov.au or email ndia@hoban.com.au. Alternatively, please call 1300 286 318.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst/ Developer
description:
Rivet Group is an Australian provider of specialised transport and logistics, equipment hire and maintenance, contract mining and aviation services. With 5 divisions, including Rivet Mining Services, SMS Mining Services, Rivet Energy, Refuel International
        and Rivet Aviation; collectively the Group has a national presence and over 1,300 employees across 15 locations in Australia. To support growth we are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst/ Developer to join our Camberwell
        Office. To be considered for this position, you will have worked in a similar capacity with proven experience. In addition to your experience, you will possess the following:

A tertiary IT qualification or 3+ year’s professional experience in Business Intelligence (reporting), data analysis, and data manipulation.
Strong work experience and hands-on knowledge of:

Business Objects 4.1 (Webl, CMC Administration etc)
MS SQL Server 2012 (Database Engine and SISS)
Strong knowledge and experience writing complicated T-SQL queries
Other Business Intelligence and/or Industry experience a strong plus
Experience with Microsoft Visual Basic. SSAS and Power BI a plus
Financial reporting knowledge (desirable)

Strong ability to utilise mainstream software programs, such as Microsoft Excel, Access and Word
Proven ability to develop and implement policies, processes and procedures
Demonstrate above average numerical and statistical calculation expectations
  The role will involve the following:

Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define reporting requirements, goals and enhancements to existing reports
Meet with senior managers to design useful dashboard reports
Interpret needs and design/enhance reports to meet end user expectations
Produce and interpret initial report output to ensure that the end user requirements have been met
Redesign reports when necessary to ensure the best possible output, prior to releasing to the end user
Create prototype reporting models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to application designers.
Work with suppliers and the Projects Coordinator to modify existing data capture to suit the changing requirements of the business
 All candidates must supply a recent National Police Clearance (less than 6-months old), and have the ability to pass pre-employment medicals and drug/alcohol screening. Rivet Group is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage men and women
        of all ages and Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. To submit your application, please click the apply button below.

title: Senior Data and Intelligence Analyst
description:
About the Role    Due to continued growth we require a Senior Analyst to join our Data & Intelligence team within DXC Eclipse.  This team is tasked with becoming the leading provider of solutions relating
        to data within the Microsoft stack, a goal to which we are well on our way to achieving.     You will be tasked with working directly with our customers to understand detailed business requirements surrounding data and translates
        these into designs and specifications for delivery by our build teams.  You will position yourself as a "data champion" with our customers, working with them to realise the possibilities that leveraging data with cognitive capabilities can
        provide.   This role will involve working with customers to design innovative and cutting edge solutions in areas such as reporting, BI, IOT, machine learning and automation.  Technical knowledge and experience within this domain
        is important, as is the ability to get hands on with delivery as required.  However, this role is primarily focused on designing solutions and requires strong business acumen and ability to engage on conversations around key metrics and KPIs
        across areas such as finance, marketing, inventory, retail and manufacturing.   Required skills:

Strong experience in data analysis and interpretation, capturing user stories and business process specifications
Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and educate key stakeholders
Ability to lead business focused workshops to facilitate strategic planning of Data & Intelligence projects
Strong business and financial modelling skills
Strong business acumen and strategic mindset
Actively participate in the production of a business model and BI reporting
Drive data & intelligence projects across multiple complex areas such as customer profiling, demand forecasting and predictive analytics.
Ability to understand and map complex data from multiple sources
Understanding of how to use data to predict trends & deliver business value
Ability to assist in the design of financial models and forecasts
Seek to continually improve processes and delivery outcomes
Strong project leadership capabilities
Minimum of 5 year’s professional experience in Data or Intelligence related roles
Ability to prioritize and manage a complex and changing set of requirements
Provide pre-sales assistance and assist the sales team to ensure clear client expectations for delivery
Perform product demonstrations to business and technical audiences
   Beneficial Skills

Prior hands-on technical experience in data or intelligence project delivery
Masters/bachelors degree in business focused discipline
Prior experience with Microsoft Dynamics or AX
Microsoft Azure certification

DXC EclipseEclipse, a DXC Technology Company is a leading global Microsoft Gold Partner delivering Microsoft Dynamics 365, ERP, CRM, business process, analytics, and collaboration solutions on premise and in the cloud. With
          a single, global team of Microsoft consultants, DXC Eclipse has helped over 1,700 customers achieve successful digital transformation projects using the full suite of Microsoft technologies and applications. We offer specialist
          industry solutions built on the Microsoft platform for retail, manufacturing, banking, healthcare, and mining for customers in the mid-market through to enterprise.

title: Data Analyst / Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Minor Hotels is one of the world's leading international hotel companies, with a geographical footprint spanning over 24 countries across Asia Pacific, the Middle East, Africa, the Indian Ocean, Europe and South America. Our diverse portfolio
          of properties has been designed to appeal to the travelers of today. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with ample choice, greater space, essential necessities and desired luxuries. With dynamic expansion plans, Minor Hotels pursues
          a vision of a more passionate and interconnected world.
 
What will you be doing?
As the Data Analyst / Business Intelligence Developer you will be liaising with different departments to understand their data needs and translate them to reporting solutions. In this position you will be responsible for understanding different
          disparate data sources and integrating them using reporting platforms to produce meaningful and useful dashboards. In addition, you will assist report users in understanding reports and how to solve data problems through data-driven decisions 
 
In this role you will be based in our Brisbane CBD office, working as part of a specialised and supportive team. You will have the following responsibilities;

Design, development and maintenance of reports using suitable visualizations in the reporting platform
Perform ad hoc analysis of various datasets, and build effective solutions to solve data problems
Ensure integrity of data presented in reports/data solutions, and work with Operations to improve data quality
Ensure availability of reports and participate in their periodic curation
Train staff to drive use and understanding of the reporting platform

 
What are we looking for?
Degree qualified in Computer Science, Information Technology or any other engineering discipline

4-5 years’ experience working in a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence developer role
4-5 years’ experience in T-SQL programming using Microsoft SQL Server and reporting using SSRS / Tableau / Power BI / Cognos Reports
Experience with Performance Tuning and data modeling
An understanding of RDBMS and database concepts
A passion to learn and build a career in data engineering / data science
Programming experience in .NET / Python / R is preferred but not essential

 
Why join the Minor Hotels team?
At Minor Hotels, people are our greatest assets, without them we would not be the successful business we are today. That is why we offer the following incentives:

A competitive salary or competitive remuneration package
Professional induction and ongoing development training.
Career opportunities throughout Australia and New Zealand.
50% discounted rates throughout the Australia and New Zealand portfolio, as well as discounted rates throughout the Minor Hotels Group.
A range of employee benefits including: Birthday Leave, Flexible work options, Employee Assistance Program, Study Reimbursement, Health & Well Being programs, Reward Recognition programs, and more!

 
If this sounds like you, apply now and send us your confidential CV and cover letter.

title: Business Intelligence and Database Specialist
description:
Modis based in Canberra is looking for highly experienced and committed Business Intelligence and Database Specialist to join their team.
In this role, you will be given the opportunity to make a tangible contribution to the continued innovation and success of the company.
Evaluation Criteria

Passion for Data Warehousing/Data Lakes, Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
SSRS/Power BI
SQL Server (multiple versions), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Database design, development and modelling (SQL Server, Oracle, Postgres)
Database migration
Business analysis

Baseline security clearance required. 
Due to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the “apply for this job” button below you will be directed to our Online Centre
          where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Collection statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly.
Alternatively, if you would like more information on the role, please contact Helen on 02 6103 1819 or also at helen.shabhatiwi@modis.com
Modis is a national professional services company with global capability. Our committed and talented professionals have delivered world class IT and business consulting services across a wide range of industries. As a member of
          global professional services group Adecco, we offer world-class employment opportunities.
 Modis is committed to all forms of workforce diversity and we invite and encourage applications from women and indigenous Australians.

title: Microsoft Business Intelligence Developer/ Analyst
description:
Box Hill North location
IT&T group
Permanent opportunity
Excellent salary and culture
 We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Microsoft Business Intelligence Developer/ Analyst to join this leading global group which delivers specialised technology solutions to corporate, industrial and government clients across Australasia. 
        This role has been created due to growth and there are several IT projects in the pipeline to be delivered over the next 3 years.    This company has developed strong IT capability and is using the latest technology to provide
        innovative solutions to the business.  You will be working in a collaborative environment which requires its IT talent to be hyper agile in order to respond to business needs.    Key responsibilities 

Translate business requirements in to efficient technical design.
Maintain and extend the ETL framework, data analysis and database design and data modelling using Kimball dimensional modelling.
Manage current BI solutions, design and create new SSIS packages and SSRS reports.
Design and develop visualisations using PowerBI.
Manage and extend current Web based solutions, WCF/ WebAPI services and business applications.
Problem analysis, process improvements and efficient issues resolutions.
Creating and maintaining detailed documentation to ensure effective handovers and knowledge transfer.
 Your skills and Experience 

Strong software development experience, with the last 5 years being in core MSBI development.
Demonstrated knowledge of DW principles, data analysis, database design and data modelling using Kimball method.
Detailed knowledge of ETL solution design and reporting.
Strong programming skills and technical experience using T-SQL.
Demonstrated experience with database design using MSSQL, implementing data solutions, developing complex Stored Procedures, Functions, User-defined Functions and Views.
Extensive PowerBI experience developing visualisations.
Solid experience with SSIS, SSRS and SSAS.
Strong technical skills using C# and .Net.
Team Foundation Server (or other Source Control).
Exposure to MS Access programming using VBA (advantageous).
Good knowledge of SDLC and familiarity with agile principles
Strong communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively and enjoys taking ownership of a project
Strong problem solving skills
Excellent process compliance and documentation skills
 To apply for this role, click ‘APPLY NOW’, please submit resume in WORD format only. For more information, please call our office on 0499 073 676.

title: Business Intelligence and Database Specialist
description:
Deliverables:

Design, architecture, management and support for database and data analytics products with a focus on integrating data sources into repositories to be queried for reports and interactive dashboards

title: ETL Analyst
description:
ETL Analyst

Bathurst Location
Fixed Term 12 Month Contract

 
Position Overview 
 
The role is an entry level position located within the Office of Strategic Planning and Information and contributes to the development and maintenance of data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will be responsible for contributing
          to project enhancements, including data migration activities, and provide technical support and troubleshoot existing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions.
 
 
Key Responsibilities

Maintaining and testing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions, including Database objects, ETL (extract, transform, Load) and OLAP (online analytical processing) cubes to required development standards with guidance from the Manager,
            DWBI and other team members.
Contribute to data and code migration activities across environments.
Maintain reference data across multiple subject areas.
Undertake quality assurance activities, including unit testing and peer review, to ensure development standards and support for SIT/UAT (system integration testing and user acceptance testing).
Monitor the company’s data warehouse and business intelligence environment, troubleshooting and resolving issues as required.
Maintain data warehouse and business intelligence architectural and process documentation.
Maintain knowledge of data warehousing and business intelligence techniques and best practices.

 
Selection Criteria 
 
Essential

Exposure to data warehouse concepts and methodologies and ETL (Extract, transform, load) architecture.
Demonstrated self-motivation and a passion for learning new technologies, business processes and approaches.
Experience or working knowledge with SQL (structured query language) programming and Relational Databases.
Good problem solving and verbal and written communication skills.
Exposure to ETL tools.
Knowledge of Azure Cloud computing and related services.

If the above sounds like you and you're on the hunt for a dynamic, innovative, fast-paced environment this is the place for you!
We've already embarked upon our national headhunt campaign for this one so if this is an opportunity you're interested in then get your CV across asap!
To Your Success!

title: Data Analyst
description:
Assist in the storage, preparation and maintenance of data sets.
Produce timely analysis and visualisation support for the Financial Markets Group.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with undergraduate qualifications in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science or other similar field to join the Data Analysis Team within our Financial Markets Group.  
Financial Markets Group is responsible for implementing the Reserve Bank’s operations in domestic and foreign exchange markets, monitoring developments in financial markets and coordinating the Reserve Bank’s relationships with international institutions.
This role is suitable for those with experience in data collection and management, programming and business intelligence tools, working with databases, an understanding of data science and an interest in streamlining and automating processes.
In this role you will:

Provide timely data and visualisation support, with respect to preparing and storing data and transforming/manipulating to prepare graphs.
Assist in the analysis, design and develop solutions for automation and/or streamlining of core business process.
Transform data using analytical tools and coding such as Excel, R, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to the Group's data assets.
Work with business stakeholders to identify core requirements and identify areas of risk to business continuity.
Participate in related projects for data collections, reporting and system enhancements including, but not limited to, requirements gathering, data mapping and testing. 

The successful applicant will:

Have a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science (or working towards)
Be comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics software
Be familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R and SQL
Have critical thinking and problem solving skills, and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally both in writing and orally with a detail oriented focus.
 The ability to collaborate effectively within a team who can work independently and well with others.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a  difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.

Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Assist in the storage, preparation and maintenance of data sets.
Produce timely analysis and visualisation support for the Financial Markets Group.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with undergraduate qualifications in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science or other similar field to join the Data Analysis Team within our Financial Markets Group.  
Financial Markets Group is responsible for implementing the Reserve Bank’s operations in domestic and foreign exchange markets, monitoring developments in financial markets and coordinating the Reserve Bank’s relationships with international institutions.
This role is suitable for those with experience in data collection and management, programming and business intelligence tools, working with databases, an understanding of data science and an interest in streamlining and automating processes.
In this role you will:

Provide timely data and visualisation support, with respect to preparing and storing data and transforming/manipulating to prepare graphs.
Assist in the analysis, design and develop solutions for automation and/or streamlining of core business process.
Transform data using analytical tools and coding such as Excel, R, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to the Group's data assets.
Work with business stakeholders to identify core requirements and identify areas of risk to business continuity.
Participate in related projects for data collections, reporting and system enhancements including, but not limited to, requirements gathering, data mapping and testing. 

The successful applicant will:

Have a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science (or working towards)
Be comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics software
Be familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R and SQL
Have critical thinking and problem solving skills, and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally both in writing and orally with a detail oriented focus.
 The ability to collaborate effectively within a team who can work independently and well with others.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a  difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.
 
 
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Business Analyst (Data Analyst), Marketing and Communication
description:
Full time, Ongoing position Werrington North Campus Western Sydney University's Office of Marketing and Communication is seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic Business Analyst (Data Analyst) to
        provide analytics and insight on the market, University and marketing programs. The business analyst will be part of the small but busy Analytics and Insights team responsible for undertaking the analysis of student and market data, and interpreting
        insights in a compelling way to all stakeholders, as well as providing engaging stakeholders in financial planning activities, system analysis and process improvement. Key Responsibilities:• Liaise with senior colleagues of the university
        in relation to developing and providing quality strategic analysis and input. • Lead the provision and maintenance of quality analytical projects arising across all areas of the University, enabling staff to self-serve. • Coordinate
        the development and preparation of business models and business cases for strategic initiatives of the University in conjunction with the Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights. • Promote and maintain high-level collaboration with senior
        colleagues in key operational and reporting linkage areas within the University and relevant external organisations. • Ensure that risk assessment, internal control and reporting processes are managed and documented as they relate to
        project activities. • Analysis of business requirements in consultation with staff at all levels to understand requirements and to identify appropriate data sources and method to deliver the outcome. • Identify and communicate data
        quality issues in source datasets and work with internal and external teams to resolve it. • Contribute to automated data integration, extraction and data refresh process for reports and dashboards. • Design interactive dashboards using
        Tableau, to deliver key performance data to business stakeholders. To be successful in this position, you must have a passion for data analysis and experience with: • Data blending tools and techniques (such as Excel or alteryx)
        • Data Visualisation tools and practice (such as Power BI or Tableau) • SQL writing skills To apply and view the Position Description, please go to: https://uws.nga.net.au/?jati=49B59A02-F60F-136B-D998-AD164095CD90Please note: This is an ongoing, full-time position based at our Penrith (Werrington North) campus, but relocating to Hawkesbury in 2019. Remuneration Package:        HEW Level 7 - $104,004 to $112,222 p.a (comprising Salary $87,885 to $94,829, plus 17% Superannuation and Leave Loading)Position Enquiries: Please contact Ankit Gorakhia on (02) 9678 7199 or via email on 
        a.gorakhia@westernsydney.edu.au Closing Date: 11.30pm Sunday 24 March 2019

title: Data Analyst
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people
          in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking a Data Analyst to augment our Transportation client’s project delivering real time data to C-Level executives. Joining us on an initial 3-month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be building and implementing statistical models as well as using predictive modelling to increase end user satisfaction.            
This will include:

Build / Construct statistical models / databases
Use data modelling practices to analyse your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes;
Collect, analyse and establish trending patterns for train performance data
Analyse performance success of initiatives, identify key learnings and assess impact of changes on performance, reliability and customer experience
Regularly report to the Executive on network performance demonstrating a clear understanding for performance while identifying opportunities for improvement through the use of Microsoft Power BI or other analysis platform

 
To successfully deliver this project you will have experience with: 

5+ years’ experience in a data quality focused role 
Extremely meticulous in approach to work 
Outstanding attention to detail 
Experienced in query optimisation and performance tuning for OLTP and Date Warehouse 
Knowledge of Data Architecture (conceptual, logical, physical, transactional, dimensional, and Star/Snowflake modeling) 
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential 
Ability to write technical documentation materials 
Experience in banking or financial services preferred 
Working Python knowledge is a plus

 This is a consultative role, so clear communication skills as well as previous consulting skills will be highly regarded.      We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want
          team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading
          technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration fees, and have access to discounted training
          and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity
          in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any
          arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381947.

title: Business (Data) Analyst
description:
Are you a Business (Data) Analyst interested in helping Australia’s leading organisations meet their strategic goals, shape their digital solutions and improve the way they work?
 
We are currently seeking Business (Data) Analyst’s with consulting backgrounds who have a track record of delivering outstanding results and meeting critical timeframes. These are mid to senior level roles and thus require extensive data experience
          within a large scaled program of work.
 
Is this you?

We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best and supporting them along the way.
You are excited by the diversity that consulting offers
You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels
You can quickly adapt to new environments and comfortably grasp new tools and concepts
You enjoy the challenge of problem-solving and thrive on innovation and creativity

 
What skills do you need?

Extensive experience with data, can analyse various platforms and systems to extract information to present in a detailed and simple format for key decision makers
Experience analysing various data sets to determine ongoing and upcoming trends, and providing recommendations
Experience in the extraction and transformation of large and complex datasets
Previous experience in data profiling, cleansing, quality, matching and transformation of data across multiple projects
The Ability to use data modelling techniques to communicate business decisions and processes
Skills in business analysis requirements such as gathering and documentation, data specifications and dictionaries
Preferably you will have consulting experience
Ideally you will have worked in the Telecoms, Financial Services, Government or similar sectors
Agile experience would be beneficial as well!

What can Terra Firma offer you?

Our people and our culture make Terra Firma a unique and awesome place to work. Your success is our success. We want you to succeed and we pride ourselves on our supportive and collegial culture to get you there - with a dash of fun added in!
We know you have a life outside work, so we offer flexible, family-friendly options to enable you to manage your work/life balance well.
We recognise and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various social events throughout the year.
We are committed to ongoing professional development. Each member of staff has the opportunity for continuous training - so your career can grow with you. You will have access to global best practice frameworks including IIBA, PMBoK, ProSci
            and TOGAF.
All our consultants have access to Employee Assistance Program for Physical, Psychological, Financial and Nutritional support.
We are a dedicated supporter of our larger community, and partner with charitable organisations to assist financially, and with pro-bono services every year. Our staff are also able to take volunteer days from work to assist with charitable
            works of their choice.
Our active social club holds regular functions, not only to enable us to all get together in a fun environment, but also to raise funds for our chosen charity. Through our alliance with a large corporate travel organisation, we are able to offer
            our consultants access to discounted travel and insurance  

We are ALWAYS on the lookout for people with the skills and personality to join us.  
To begin your new career with us apply to the link below or call our careers team on 03 8611 5099 for a confidential discussion. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Application & Data Analyst
description:
Position No: IMT029ABOUT US
Campbelltown City Council is an ambitious and innovative organisation in a rapidly growing city that is ideally located with easy access to key public transport and road links. Boasting extensive bushland areas along the Georges River, contrasted
            with vibrant city centres, Campbelltown City has been identified as a key strategic centre for the Macarthur region. Providing a range of services and facilities to a diverse community, we have a cohesive and collaborative culture that thrives
            on having a positive impact.
Council's Business Solutions team is responsible for designing solutions to solve business problems.ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an experienced Senior Application Analyst who has a passion for asking questions, articulating problems, engineering solutions, configuring solutions, as well as managing large-scale projects from start to end, and can see the
            big picture and champion change.
In this technical based role you will be responsible for:

Project managing large-scale software projects in a complex environment, ensuring outcomes and outputs are achieved by: planning and estimating; monitoring, evaluating, reviewing and reporting; managing risks, issues and change controls; managing
              schedules, dependencies, budgets and contracts; undertaking quality assurance activities; and managing handovers / transitional arrangements
Analyse the organisations' business problem, processes, data, integration and reports to identify possible solutions and put forward recommendations
Configuring solution and aid in supporting and maintaining existing applications
Helping to shape the enterprise application vision and strategy, validating new application features and design, collecting and prioritising inputs to inform application decisions and direction
Building relationships with various stakeholders, as you will work closely with both technical and non-technical teams across all levels of the organisation
Provide leadership and support to junior team members

WHAT WE ARE SEEKING

A degree in an information technology discipline and/or extensive equivalent industry experience
Formal certification in an accredited project management methodology (PMBOK, Prince2 or Scrum)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Minimum 5+ years practical experience in process mapping, gathering requirements, developing technical solutions, configuring solutions and aiding in ongoing support
Minimum 5+ years of practical experience in change management, project documentation, manage multiple projects and delivery of medium to large-scale projects
Ability to create solution user guides, conduct training to small groups or individuals to enable them to effectively utilise the solution/application
Excellent interpersonal, communication and facilitation skills and proven ability to work effectively with all organisational levels
Current Class C drivers licence
Commitment to role modelling our values of: Respect, Integrity, Optimism, Trust and Teamwork.

To learn more about this opportunity please refer to the Job Description.WHAT WE ARE OFFERING

Permanent full time opportunity
Located in Campbelltown (onsite parking available and close to public transport)
35 hours per week
Salary from $1,450 per week ($75,400 per annum), plus 9.5% superannuation
Flexi time (opportunity to earn accrued time off)
Generous professional development opportunities

HOW TO APPLY
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and provide comprehensive responses to three questions. Applicants who do not respond to the questions will not be considered.a) What are your qualifications?b) How your skills and experience
            suit the rolec) What are your salary expectations?d) What is your most significant and relevant project you delivered?Applications close Friday 29 March 2019.For further information please contact Sharlene
            Van Leerdam, Business Solutions Coordinator on 4645 4184.Please allow 4 weeks from the closing date for the processing of your application.Sound like you? Apply now!Campbelltown City Council is an Equal
            Employment Opportunity employer and values the unique contributions of all people. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

title: Principal Analyst/Data Sceintist
description:
Our client, a large QLD Government organisation, is currently sourcing a Principal Analyst/Data Scientist who will be required to work closely with a small team to set up the Data Sharing and Analytics function for Queensland Government. The position
          will be responsible for providing a high level of data analysis, sharing and analytics services to both the team and the broader Queensland Government.  This Data Sharing and Analytics Office will focus on building capability in internal
          to government information sharing, data science and data analytics.  As a Principal Analyst you will:

Lead the development and implementation of government wide analysis and analytics.
Perform expert analysis and data sharing activities across government departments and with partner agencies using advanced analytics modelling, analysis techniques, tools and standards.
Write comprehensive and professional analytical reports for a range of audiences and design and deliver innovative analytics and data sharing presentations
Work with government and external stakeholders and partners to define their analytical requirements. Provide support to government departments in the development and delivery of their analytics and data sharing products.

Your capabilities 

Be highly experienced in using a range of data/intelligence/information analysis and visualisation software i.e. Qlik tableau, GIS, spot fire, excel, access and others.
Able to identify patents and trends in large/big data sets. Make predictions, make recommendations, analyse statistical information and qualitative information to solve problems and make recommendation
Data mining skills - to analyse and profile multiple big data sets from within and outside of government
Write accurate analytical reports based on data/intelligence/information analysis giving key findings, inferences, predictions and recommendations
Evidence skills and experience in producing a range of complex analytical products to create innovative solutions and meet changing needs.
Demonstrate experience in developing new analytical products and methodology, using new and unique data sets.
Demonstrate experience in using a range of data sharing and analytics software to improve business performance and organisational outcomes.
Provide experience of providing advice in relation to data, analytics and analysis
Show highly advanced written and verbal communication skills to be able to produce a range of types of complex reports to a varied audience, adapting style to suit needs.

Must have 

Experience building Machine learning models
Experience in Goverment Regulatory compliance,

To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below quoting Ref No. 4A/22153. Alternatively please contact Tim Smith for further details on 07 32588453 or email Timothy.smith@hudson.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
Assist in the storage, preparation and maintenance of data sets.
Produce timely analysis and visualisation support for the Financial Markets Group.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with undergraduate qualifications in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science or other similar field to join the Data Analysis Team within our Financial Markets Group.  
Financial Markets Group is responsible for implementing the Reserve Bank’s operations in domestic and foreign exchange markets, monitoring developments in financial markets and coordinating the Reserve Bank’s relationships with international institutions.
This role is suitable for those with experience in data collection and management, programming and business intelligence tools, working with databases, an understanding of data science and an interest in streamlining and automating processes.
In this role you will:

Provide timely data and visualisation support, with respect to preparing and storing data and transforming/manipulating to prepare graphs.
Assist in the analysis, design and develop solutions for automation and/or streamlining of core business process.
Transform data using analytical tools and coding such as Excel, R, SQL etc; analyse queries and reports; and investigate and resolve issues related to the Group's data assets.
Work with business stakeholders to identify core requirements and identify areas of risk to business continuity.
Participate in related projects for data collections, reporting and system enhancements including, but not limited to, requirements gathering, data mapping and testing. 

The successful applicant will:

Have a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, maths, statistics, econometrics, computer science (or working towards)
Be comfortable using and manipulating data, and be able to use a range of tools including spreadsheet, presentation and graphics software
Be familiar with coding and scripting tools such as Mathematica, R and SQL
Have critical thinking and problem solving skills, and be able to think creatively about potential solutions.
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally both in writing and orally with a detail oriented focus.
 The ability to collaborate effectively within a team who can work independently and well with others.

By joining the RBA, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Work for an organisation that truly makes a  difference to the Australian people
Develop your career in a collaborative environment
Access to a wide-range of benefits

About the RBA
The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. It also issues Australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments
          system.
 
 
How to Apply
Your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.  A supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.
The Reserve Bank of Australia is an equal opportunity employer.  We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

title: Business Analyst (Data Analyst), Marketing and Communication
description:
Full time, Ongoing position Werrington North Campus Western Sydney University's Office of Marketing and Communication is seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic Business Analyst (Data Analyst) to
        provide analytics and insight on the market, University and marketing programs. The business analyst will be part of the small but busy Analytics and Insights team responsible for undertaking the analysis of student and market data, and interpreting
        insights in a compelling way to all stakeholders, as well as providing engaging stakeholders in financial planning activities, system analysis and process improvement. Key Responsibilities:• Liaise with senior colleagues of the university
        in relation to developing and providing quality strategic analysis and input. • Lead the provision and maintenance of quality analytical projects arising across all areas of the University, enabling staff to self-serve. • Coordinate
        the development and preparation of business models and business cases for strategic initiatives of the University in conjunction with the Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights. • Promote and maintain high-level collaboration with senior
        colleagues in key operational and reporting linkage areas within the University and relevant external organisations. • Ensure that risk assessment, internal control and reporting processes are managed and documented as they relate to
        project activities. • Analysis of business requirements in consultation with staff at all levels to understand requirements and to identify appropriate data sources and method to deliver the outcome. • Identify and communicate data
        quality issues in source datasets and work with internal and external teams to resolve it. • Contribute to automated data integration, extraction and data refresh process for reports and dashboards. • Design interactive dashboards using
        Tableau, to deliver key performance data to business stakeholders. To be successful in this position, you must have a passion for data analysis and experience with: • Data blending tools and techniques (such as Excel or alteryx)
        • Data Visualisation tools and practice (such as Power BI or Tableau) • SQL writing skills To apply and view the Position Description, please go to: https://uws.nga.net.au/?jati=49B59A02-F60F-136B-D998-AD164095CD90Please note: This is an ongoing, full-time position based at our Penrith (Werrington North) campus, but relocating to Hawkesbury in 2019. Remuneration Package:        HEW Level 7 - $104,004 to $112,222 p.a (comprising Salary $87,885 to $94,829, plus 17% Superannuation and Leave Loading)Position Enquiries: Please contact Ankit Gorakhia on (02) 9678 7199 or via email on 
        a.gorakhia@westernsydney.edu.au Closing Date: 11.30pm Sunday 24 March 2019

title: Data Analyst
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people
          in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking a Data Analyst to augment our Transportation client’s project delivering real time data to C-Level executives. Joining us on an initial 3-month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be building and implementing statistical models as well as using predictive modelling to increase end user satisfaction.            
This will include:

Build / Construct statistical models / databases
Use data modelling practices to analyse your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes;
Collect, analyse and establish trending patterns for train performance data
Analyse performance success of initiatives, identify key learnings and assess impact of changes on performance, reliability and customer experience
Regularly report to the Executive on network performance demonstrating a clear understanding for performance while identifying opportunities for improvement through the use of Microsoft Power BI or other analysis platform

 
To successfully deliver this project you will have experience with: 

5+ years’ experience in a data quality focused role 
Extremely meticulous in approach to work 
Outstanding attention to detail 
Experienced in query optimisation and performance tuning for OLTP and Date Warehouse 
Knowledge of Data Architecture (conceptual, logical, physical, transactional, dimensional, and Star/Snowflake modeling) 
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential 
Ability to write technical documentation materials 
Experience in banking or financial services preferred 
Working Python knowledge is a plus

 This is a consultative role, so clear communication skills as well as previous consulting skills will be highly regarded.      We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want
          team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading
          technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration fees, and have access to discounted training
          and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity
          in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any
          arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381947.

description:
