title: Business (Data) Analyst
description:
Are you a Business (Data) Analyst interested in helping Australia’s leading organisations meet their strategic goals, shape their digital solutions and improve the way they work?
 
We are currently seeking Business (Data) Analyst’s with consulting backgrounds who have a track record of delivering outstanding results and meeting critical timeframes. These are mid to senior level roles and thus require extensive data experience
          within a large scaled program of work.
 
Is this you?

We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best and supporting them along the way.
You are excited by the diversity that consulting offers
You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels
You can quickly adapt to new environments and comfortably grasp new tools and concepts
You enjoy the challenge of problem-solving and thrive on innovation and creativity

 
What skills do you need?

Extensive experience with data, can analyse various platforms and systems to extract information to present in a detailed and simple format for key decision makers
Experience analysing various data sets to determine ongoing and upcoming trends, and providing recommendations
Experience in the extraction and transformation of large and complex datasets
Previous experience in data profiling, cleansing, quality, matching and transformation of data across multiple projects
The Ability to use data modelling techniques to communicate business decisions and processes
Skills in business analysis requirements such as gathering and documentation, data specifications and dictionaries
Preferably you will have consulting experience
Ideally you will have worked in the Telecoms, Financial Services, Government or similar sectors
Agile experience would be beneficial as well!

What can Terra Firma offer you?

Our people and our culture make Terra Firma a unique and awesome place to work. Your success is our success. We want you to succeed and we pride ourselves on our supportive and collegial culture to get you there - with a dash of fun added in!
We know you have a life outside work, so we offer flexible, family-friendly options to enable you to manage your work/life balance well.
We recognise and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various social events throughout the year.
We are committed to ongoing professional development. Each member of staff has the opportunity for continuous training - so your career can grow with you. You will have access to global best practice frameworks including IIBA, PMBoK, ProSci
            and TOGAF.
All our consultants have access to Employee Assistance Program for Physical, Psychological, Financial and Nutritional support.
We are a dedicated supporter of our larger community, and partner with charitable organisations to assist financially, and with pro-bono services every year. Our staff are also able to take volunteer days from work to assist with charitable
            works of their choice.
Our active social club holds regular functions, not only to enable us to all get together in a fun environment, but also to raise funds for our chosen charity. Through our alliance with a large corporate travel organisation, we are able to offer
            our consultants access to discounted travel and insurance  

We are ALWAYS on the lookout for people with the skills and personality to join us.  
To begin your new career with us apply to the link below or call our careers team on 03 8611 5099 for a confidential discussion. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Application & Data Analyst
description:
Position No: IMT029ABOUT US
Campbelltown City Council is an ambitious and innovative organisation in a rapidly growing city that is ideally located with easy access to key public transport and road links. Boasting extensive bushland areas along the Georges River, contrasted
            with vibrant city centres, Campbelltown City has been identified as a key strategic centre for the Macarthur region. Providing a range of services and facilities to a diverse community, we have a cohesive and collaborative culture that thrives
            on having a positive impact.
Council's Business Solutions team is responsible for designing solutions to solve business problems.ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an experienced Senior Application Analyst who has a passion for asking questions, articulating problems, engineering solutions, configuring solutions, as well as managing large-scale projects from start to end, and can see the
            big picture and champion change.
In this technical based role you will be responsible for:

Project managing large-scale software projects in a complex environment, ensuring outcomes and outputs are achieved by: planning and estimating; monitoring, evaluating, reviewing and reporting; managing risks, issues and change controls; managing
              schedules, dependencies, budgets and contracts; undertaking quality assurance activities; and managing handovers / transitional arrangements
Analyse the organisations' business problem, processes, data, integration and reports to identify possible solutions and put forward recommendations
Configuring solution and aid in supporting and maintaining existing applications
Helping to shape the enterprise application vision and strategy, validating new application features and design, collecting and prioritising inputs to inform application decisions and direction
Building relationships with various stakeholders, as you will work closely with both technical and non-technical teams across all levels of the organisation
Provide leadership and support to junior team members

WHAT WE ARE SEEKING

A degree in an information technology discipline and/or extensive equivalent industry experience
Formal certification in an accredited project management methodology (PMBOK, Prince2 or Scrum)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Minimum 5+ years practical experience in process mapping, gathering requirements, developing technical solutions, configuring solutions and aiding in ongoing support
Minimum 5+ years of practical experience in change management, project documentation, manage multiple projects and delivery of medium to large-scale projects
Ability to create solution user guides, conduct training to small groups or individuals to enable them to effectively utilise the solution/application
Excellent interpersonal, communication and facilitation skills and proven ability to work effectively with all organisational levels
Current Class C drivers licence
Commitment to role modelling our values of: Respect, Integrity, Optimism, Trust and Teamwork.

To learn more about this opportunity please refer to the Job Description.WHAT WE ARE OFFERING

Permanent full time opportunity
Located in Campbelltown (onsite parking available and close to public transport)
35 hours per week
Salary from $1,450 per week ($75,400 per annum), plus 9.5% superannuation
Flexi time (opportunity to earn accrued time off)
Generous professional development opportunities

HOW TO APPLY
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and provide comprehensive responses to three questions. Applicants who do not respond to the questions will not be considered.a) What are your qualifications?b) How your skills and experience
            suit the rolec) What are your salary expectations?d) What is your most significant and relevant project you delivered?Applications close Friday 29 March 2019.For further information please contact Sharlene
            Van Leerdam, Business Solutions Coordinator on 4645 4184.Please allow 4 weeks from the closing date for the processing of your application.Sound like you? Apply now!Campbelltown City Council is an Equal
            Employment Opportunity employer and values the unique contributions of all people. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Our client and role: Our client, an industry leading WA based organisation are seeking the skills and services of an experienced customer facing Business Analyst with a proven background in understanding information
        needs and translating them into requirements for design, development and implementation of information analytics and data management solutions that are simple and intuitive to use to generate obvious and actionable insights.Key requirements of the role: 

Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their business / process goals and objectives, and fully clarify their information needs. 
Working alongside data custodians, partners and other members of the Insights product team to identify the appropriate internal, partner and open datasets, and assess the quality of these datasets.
Reviewing and analysing data to identify patterns and identify trends and risks, and propose effective strategies and solutions.
Developing effective stakeholder relationships through the management of expectations and agreed objectives, helping secure the ongoing adoption and use of the system and obtaining support for system improvements.
Essential experience required:

Solid experience as a Business Analyst working highly skilled at eliciting requirements in the context of developing reporting and analytics solutions
Broad knowledge and experience of reporting tools such as Excel, PowerBI, MS SQL.
Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst in a corporate, government or academic environment
A background in Agile methodologies with experience in Scrum and ability to specify requirements in the user story format with acceptance criteria suitable for data and analytics solutions.
High level of written and verbal communication skills, along with well-developed negotiation and interpersonal skills, to explain data concepts to both database developers and architects, non-technical end users
Demonstrated high level customer service skills and the ability to develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Tertiary qualification in Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics or equivalent
What's in it for you? 

Parking onsite
A diverse, forward thinking employer of choice
Be part of one of Perth's largest digital transformation projects.
An employer who supports genuine well-being, they care about their people.
Excellent salary package.

title: Insights Manager & Trends Analyst
description:
Client Overview:Our client is the world's largest search engine and mapping service provider. Through their continual technological advances to assist the general population and businesses alike, our client is expanding
            in a number of areas. This particular contract role is available for a period of 12 month's with the possible opportunity to extend.
 
About the job
As a Trends Storyteller, you'll have the opportunity to shape and improve the understanding of one of the web's richest creative ecosystems. For a one year fellowship, you'll work with the Culture and Trends team, which uses video sharing
          and channel data, and trends from their Global online video platform to connect content to millions of people per year via community focused initiatives or other special projects.
You'll spend your days managing a diverse set of projects and becoming an expert on web video phenomena, sharing stories through partnerships with the press and directly through the platforms own communications. You will become an expert at
          using SQL to extract data from large data sets and turning that data into compelling stories that help understand what’s trending on the platform.
Responsibilities

Data analysis: Write SQL queries to extract, analyse and interpret data aroundtrending content.
Insights: Identify and communicate insights to tell compelling content stories. Presentfindings that explain and contextualize online video trends with minimal direction.
Data visualization: Explore data visually at multiple levels to find insights and create acompelling visual story.
Ideation: Support the regional team on idea exploration, including brainstorming,research and data analysis.
 
Required Qualifications

BA/BS degree in media, marketing, economics, statistics or a related quantitative field
4+ years of experience in online media, digital marketing or data journalism
3+ years of experience with SQL and relational databases
2+ years of experience in data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Python)
Passion for the online video ecosystem, web content and digital culture
Fluent English speaker and strong communicator
 
Preferred Qualifications

MA/MS degree in media, marketing, economics, statistics or a related quantitative field
3+ years of experience telling data-driven stories related to web content, pop culture,technology or news, preferably as a data journalist for a large editorial organisation
Strong experience with project management and working cross-functionally withmarketing, communications and engineering
Excellent communication, writing, presentation, data analysis and statistical skills
Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

Apply today if this opportunity matches your aspirations and career path. One of our dedicated account recruiters will be in touch to go over the next steps.

title: Business Analyst / Data Migration Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Business Analyst/Benefits Realisation Analyst to join a large government enterprise an extensive project.Overview of ProjectThe prime purpose of this project is delivering both
        Payroll and Human Capital Management Solutions to meet requirements.Data Migration Experience:

Writing detailed data migration plans with reference to solution design and source/target system requirements/ ETL 
Partnering with customers to understand their data requirements through management of business process through to reporting 
Monitoring design changes which could impact data migration design 
All aspects of data migration delivery including assisting with testing of data, feedback to customer on data issues, preparing data for testing, reconciliation of data and delivery of data to production including leading knowledge transfer
Undertake business process improvement analysis on new and existing business opportunities through the utilisation of process modelling tools, to determine process improvements that deliver benefits for clients and which align to whole of government
            benefits management strategy.
Facilitate communication between the relevant business units, technology teams and support teams to ensure that business solutions are aligned with business objectives.
Identify business opportunities through strategic and financial analysis to provide options for business improvement and develop business cases to support business objectives.
Research, analyse and review complex issues, proposals and submissions to ensure that service delivery and financial issues and other related issues impacting on agency operations are identified and considered
The below experience will also be highly regarded:

Success in complex and multiple stakeholder ICT enabled business transformation programs or disciplines in areas such as HCM, payroll, time & attendance, benefits management, integration, identity management and authentication.
Experience in platforms such as SAP SuccessFactors, Aurion Payroll system, contemporary integration, identity and authentication solutions.
This is am initial engagement until December 2019 with the possibility of extension.If you think you could be a good fit for this role click the 'Apply' button now. For further information please contact Danielle Wren.danielle.wren@talentinternational.comhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/daniellewren/

title: Data Analyst/Data Modeller
description:
Data Analyst/Data ModellerCBD12 Months Contract Talent International is working in partnership with a large government organisation to assist in sourcing a 'Data Analyst'.Key Responsibilities:·        Design
        and implementation of dataflows and data automation processes to support development of a single source of truth datawarehouse.o   This includes the building, updating and amending of tables, views and datamarts, taking into
        account both back-end organisation and front-end accessibility for end users (technical and non-technical).·        Automation and scheduling of data management and data quality processes, ensuring appropriate
        data dictionaries and documentation to transition to other staff members into business as usual. This includes development of data standards, procedures and definitions.·        Change management and
        impact assessment of data quality and provision from upstream systems changes and other projects initiated from within the team.o   Actively identify and implement improvements to the sourcing and accuracy of data.o   Identify
        sourcing and integration new potential external data sources.·        Delivery of business analytics, business intelligence and ad-hoc analysis as required.·        Dependent
        on the candidate's capabilities, potential involvement in data analytical modelling, data visualisation and complex data product provision projects.Key Criteria:·        Degree qualified in a computing or quantitative discipline.·        Business analysis, facilitation and sound project management skills. ·        Applied programing skills in SQL and SAS, including the automation of data management and data quality processes.·        Experience of working in an organisation with a mature data management and reporting environment and processes, allowing insight into what works and doesn't work. ·        Experience of working in an organisation with data and analytics teams split into structured with     functional responsibilities. ·        Exposure to R, AWS, Oracle and Tableau will be looked favorably upon.If you would be interested in this role please submit your cover letter & CV in Word format only        by clicking the "APPLY NOW" button below or anna.au@talentinternational.com

title: Data Analyst/Data Modeller
description:
Data Analyst/Data ModellerCBD12 Months Contract Talent International is working in partnership with a large government organisation to assist in sourcing a 'Data Analyst'.Key Responsibilities:·        Design
        and implementation of dataflows and data automation processes to support development of a single source of truth datawarehouse.o   This includes the building, updating and amending of tables, views and datamarts, taking into
        account both back-end organisation and front-end accessibility for end users (technical and non-technical).·        Automation and scheduling of data management and data quality processes, ensuring appropriate
        data dictionaries and documentation to transition to other staff members into business as usual. This includes development of data standards, procedures and definitions.·        Change management and
        impact assessment of data quality and provision from upstream systems changes and other projects initiated from within the team.o   Actively identify and implement improvements to the sourcing and accuracy of data.o   Identify
        sourcing and integration new potential external data sources.·        Delivery of business analytics, business intelligence and ad-hoc analysis as required.·        Dependent
        on the candidate's capabilities, potential involvement in data analytical modelling, data visualisation and complex data product provision projects.Key Criteria:·        Degree qualified in a computing or quantitative discipline.·        Business analysis, facilitation and sound project management skills. ·        Applied programing skills in SQL and SAS, including the automation of data management and data quality processes.·        Experience of working in an organisation with a mature data management and reporting environment and processes, allowing insight into what works and doesn't work. ·        Experience of working in an organisation with data and analytics teams split into structured with     functional responsibilities. ·        Exposure to R, AWS, Oracle and Tableau will be looked favorably upon.If you would be interested in this role please submit your cover letter & CV in Word format only        by clicking the "APPLY NOW" button below or anna.au@talentinternational.com

title: SQL Data Engineer -some Hadoop
description:
Initial 12 week SQL Data Engineer role with rolling month to month extensions up to around 6 months .We mainly seek SQL but any exposure/experience to hadoop would be great. 
ASAP start available.
Exciting and complex project with multiple challenges to keep you entertained -7 disparate data sources....
Engage the Business directly and work within the Analytics area.
If you are on WHV this is no issues - feel free to apply.
 
We enjoy recruiting for this large and complex client who support many Australians every single day as they offer a positive culture which is supported by our candidates who join them.
They are based in the CBD and are progressive by embracing people and technology and see how this approach can support their business which makes it a great place to work.
 
As they continue down this path they now require a Data Engineer with Hadoop and SQL who has worked on projects from scratch. Initially is 12 weeks and the expectation is there will be a few rolling month to month extensions up to around 6 months
          depending on the work.
Specifically it will encompass :

Developing, constructing, testing and maintaining databases including extracting data from multiple sources and data cleansing.
 Data optimisation and preparing data-marts to develop dashboards/reports in Tableau.
Ensuring the path and end result aligns to the overall architecture and "fits"with business requirements.
Identify ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality moving forward.

It is a new project for them and due to it's complex nature will offer its own challenges and would not suit a one path only approach.
Technically speaking it will require the below to complement the project but your communication skills and willingness to engage directly with the business including non technical counterparts will be just as important for you.

Advanced SQL skills using MS SQL on a Hadoop platform so some Hadoop skills/exposure or understanding required.
ETL Architecture, ETL Design and End to End ETL Development
DB Programming, Excellent database querying and query tuning skills


5+ years of data engineer experience (MS SQL)

So it can offer you a good contract to have fun in a team where you are supported and offers a good daily rate of up to $800 per day plus super.
If you are keen please call Rebecca on 02 9249 8041 or apply for the role today.

They have a reputation for being a great place to work and even contractors benefit from career growth opportunities and internal promotion. With

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

title: Data Scientist - Unstructured data modelling
description:
Talent International is working in partnership with a major federal government organisation to assist in sourcing a Data Scientist on contract based in Sydney CBD.Working within a team of other data scientists the successful applicant will
        develop analytical solutions to deliver transformative technical projects which provide significant business.The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk themes and topics from vast document collections, text mining, image
        classification and automation. Key duties of the role will include
        
Work with a cross functional team of analysts, report developers and engineers to move Proof-of-Concept models/products to production for clients 
Utilise complex analytic techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, using computational methods to discover data patterns and to develop classification, prediction and optimisation
            models 
Manipulate and analyse big data from disparate systems 
Apply in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods 
Develop, enhance and maintain a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour 
 In order to be considered we are seeking talented data scientists who meet the following criteria:
        
A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages.
An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Australian Citizenship is MANDATORY in order to be considered. For immediate consideration please forward a copy of your current resume via the APPLY NOW button or email Patrick at Talent International on patricko@talentinternational.com.auFor
        further queries please call (02) 9223 9855.

Crunch data, uncover insights and create knowledge. Join InfoReady, part of Arq Group, where you can design and implement solutions that enable organisations to harness data for competitive advantage
What you get to do.
Working with many of Australia’s leading companies, you will deliver advanced and predictive analytics, segmentation and classification help converting business problems into solutions. What you do will directly impact client’s growth, customer
          churn, increase efficiencies and predict customer demand.
About you.
We seek candidates with minimum of 5 years experience working on relevant real-world applications, with a minimum Masters degree in Analytics/Machine Learning or other related computer science program from a top program. 
You will be leading teams that build solutions using tools such as Python, R, and Machine Learning frameworks that help converting business problems into solutions that may help clients maximise growth, reduce customer churn, increase efficiencies

Fluency in Python, R, or SQL
Experience dealing with large unstructured data sets with multiple sources –

          leading digital partner.
#LifeatArq
Our people are our greatest asset. Curiosity is in our DNA. Courage is in our hearts. And collaboration is at our core. “Our Ways” set us apart from others in how we deliver to our customers and work together. From wellness programs, learning
          and development, social calendars to coffee machines, and more. We've got something for everyone to be themselves. Did we also mention how much fun it is to work with other Arqadians?  And yes, it is true; we love what we do. Join Arq Group
          and find your space to (change).
At Arq Group, we unleash the possibilities between business and people.

title: Research Fellow
description:
Job No.: 588550
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 2 year fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $68,040 - $92,343 pa Level A (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Drive your own learning at one of the world’s top 80 universities
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions

Everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. At Monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. You’ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities,
          opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you’ll need to publish your work. We’re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what’s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other
          inspiring, empowering thinkers.
The Opportunity
The Faculty of Information Technology aims to lead global IT research and education. The Data Science and AI group is seeking a go-getter Research Fellow to work at the interface of computer science, machine learning and medical research. You
          will be involved in potentially ground-breaking research developing and implementing algorithms and software to predict the risk of a woman developing breast cancer using digital, pre-diagnosis mammographic images.
As the successful candidate you will combine an enthusiasm for data science research with a doctoral qualification in Computer Science, Statistics or a closely related field. Experience with image processing and/or deep learning
          is desirable, but not necessary.
This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Dr Daniel Schmidt, Senior Lecturer, Data Science, +61 3 9905 9985
Position Description
Research Fellow
Closing Date
Thursday 4 April 2019, 11.55pm AEDT

title: Data Scientist - Big Data
description:
Senior Data Scientist
Melbourne CBD
Initial 3+ Month Contract
Excellent Daily Contract Rate

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will harness the power of Big Data through predictive analytics and innovative machine learning models. We are seeking a Data Scientist to support systems and business optimisation through detailed analysis of data.
          The Data Scientist team drives strategic business initiatives by researching, analyzing and interpreting data; developing algorithms to evaluate customer behaviour and identify areas of opportunity; presenting analysis and recommendations; and
          participating with business units and IT to deliver innovative, actionable business models. The Data Scientist will be responsible for assisting in the definition of data mining and machine learning strategies and the execution of corresponding
          procedures.
Required Skills and Experience

A minimum of 3 years of experience in data mining, machine learning and distributed computing is required
Bachelors degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or Mathematics preferred
Familiarity with Hadoop, Pig, Hive and MapReduce is required
Knowledge with Python, Perl or other scripting language is a must
Demonstrated proficiency with statistical computing languages such as R, MATLAB, etc.
Experience with integrating large-scale heterogeneous datasets is require
Knowledge with statistical research techniques, including modeling, data mining, clustering and segmentation
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with third parties and internal staff at all levels of the organization
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent organization and time management skills

Please submit your resume in Word Format using the link provided. No calls please.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About us:
Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online wagering company. We're part of a global company, a big player with a start-up soul. The pace of change is exhilarating, we’re constantly innovating to bring excitement to life for our customers and our
          people.
Perks: 

Free brekky, discounted Myki & gym memberships, loads of event & conference tickets
Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers
5 weeks’ annual leave
Company bonus

Your Mission…
In the Data Science team we believe in using Advanced Analytics & Machine Learning to provide better experiences for our customers. We work with business stakeholders & engineers to innovate and develop algorithms & systems that improve
          business processes, help us better understand customers and create exciting, personalised experiences for them.
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to bring our Machine Learning capability to the next level.
Examples of problems you will solve include real-time recommender system, predictive models that work for individual customers, large-scale decision supporting systems, and any other cool & valuable ideas you can propose!
Technical skills & personal attributes: 

Strong knowledge of Machine Learning, algorithms, statistics, optimisations
Previous commercial or excellent research experience in Machine Learning/Data Science
Formal education/training or work experience with advanced AI/Machine Learning techniques, such as Deep Learning
Proficient in Python or similar programming languages
Competencies with one or more AWS cloud technologies highly preferred
Skills in Data engineering and/or Software engineering are a definite plus
Passion for problem solving & research
Be agile and not afraid thrive in a dynamic & challenging environment  

If this sounds like you, hit Apply now to be considered for this role!
At Sportsbet, we take Responsible Gambling very seriously. Check out the tools & information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site here

java development, experience with building APIs (kong) and micro services.
Exposure to distributed big data stacks e.g. Spark, PySpark, Kafka, Hive, Flume, Hue & Sqoop.

An open mindset and proven ability to innovate and influence.

Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

title: Data Scientist - Unstructured data modelling
description:
Talent International is working in partnership with a major federal government organisation to assist in sourcing a Data Scientist on contract based in Sydney CBD.Working within a team of other data scientists the successful applicant will
        develop analytical solutions to deliver transformative technical projects which provide significant business.The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk themes and topics from vast document collections, text mining, image
        classification and automation. Key duties of the role will include
        
Work with a cross functional team of analysts, report developers and engineers to move Proof-of-Concept models/products to production for clients 
Utilise complex analytic techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, using computational methods to discover data patterns and to develop classification, prediction and optimisation
            models 
Manipulate and analyse big data from disparate systems 
Apply in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods 
Develop, enhance and maintain a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour 
 In order to be considered we are seeking talented data scientists who meet the following criteria:
        
A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages.
An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Australian Citizenship is MANDATORY in order to be considered. For immediate consideration please forward a copy of your current resume via the APPLY NOW button or email Patrick at Talent International on patricko@talentinternational.com.auFor
        further queries please call (02) 9223 9855.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:

        and Theano.This role will give you the opportunity to enhance the Machine learning capability internally and work alongside a team of talented developers.  - Have proven experience delivering new ML projects across different
                  platforms within small environments.   - Excellent programming language Solid programming skills with at least one       language: Python, Java, Scala, R or other -
        Background in Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Statistics   - MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Computational Mathematics, or     a related field 
Please apply for immediate consideration and a confidential discussion around the role and company.

title: Machine Learning Engineer l Perm/Contract l Python l CBD
Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Our client, a global consultancy is seeking to engage an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, to play a pivotal role in a large IT Service Intelligence project, on-site with a Top 4 Bank.
 
Essential Skills:
The Machine Learning programmer must have the following skills and experience

A background and understanding of machine learning and in particular neural networks
Advanced coding in Java/J2EE, Python, XML and Javascript
Experience of using code management platforms (Github preferred)
Advanced Excel programming skills
Knowledge and experience of the Weka Machine Learning Workbench

 
Desirable Skills:
 It is highly desirable that the Machine Learning programmer also has coverage of the following areas

A good understanding of various machine learning models and algorithms, eg, Bayesian classifiers, binary classifiers, unsupervised and supervised learning, K-means clustering, self-organizing maps and Q-Learning (having knowledge/experience
            of any two will add value to an application for this role)
Knowledge of statistical regression and correlation.
Knowledge/experience of other Machine learning development platforms such as TensorFlow and Theano.
A background in statistics including an understanding of the principles of statistical experimental design.
Experience of having worked within an Agile delivery framework

 
For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Nick Barwick quoting reference: 192666.
Please click the apply button.

title: Lead Data Scientist - Brisbane
description:
Crunch data, uncover insights and create knowledge. Join InfoReady, part of Arq Group, where you can design and implement solutions that enable organisations to harness data for competitive advantage
What you get to do.
Working with many of Australia’s leading companies, you will deliver advanced and predictive analytics, segmentation and classification help converting business problems into solutions. What you do will directly impact client’s growth, customer
          churn, increase efficiencies and predict customer demand.
About you.
We seek candidates with minimum of 5 years experience working on relevant real-world applications, with a minimum Masters degree in Analytics/Machine Learning or other related computer science program from a top program. 
You will be leading teams that build solutions using tools such as Python, R, and Machine Learning frameworks that help converting business problems into solutions that may help clients maximise growth, reduce customer churn, increase efficiencies
          and predict customer demand.
Essential Skills

Fluency in Python, R, or SQL
Experience dealing with large unstructured data sets with multiple sources –
Hands on Machine Learning within a Business Context
Data Vizualisation experience. Using Tableau , Qlik or similar.
Strong Business Analysis experience
Big Data/Cloud technologies
Ability to present finding to C-level stakeholders

We are smart thinkers. We solve complex challenges and provide complete solutions for businesses, big and small. From design thinking, leading mobile apps, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design. Arq Group is Australia’s
          leading digital partner.
#LifeatArq
Our people are our greatest asset. Curiosity is in our DNA. Courage is in our hearts. And collaboration is at our core. “Our Ways” set us apart from others in how we deliver to our customers and work together. From wellness programs, learning
          and development, social calendars to coffee machines, and more. We've got something for everyone to be themselves. Did we also mention how much fun it is to work with other Arqadians?  And yes, it is true; we love what we do. Join Arq Group
          and find your space to (change).
At Arq Group, we unleash the possibilities between business and people.
#Infoready

title: Research Fellow
description:
Job No.: 588550
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 2 year fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $68,040 - $92,343 pa Level A (plus 9.5% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Drive your own learning at one of the world’s top 80 universities
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions

Everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. At Monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. You’ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities,
          opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you’ll need to publish your work. We’re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what’s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other
          inspiring, empowering thinkers.
The Opportunity
The Faculty of Information Technology aims to lead global IT research and education. The Data Science and AI group is seeking a go-getter Research Fellow to work at the interface of computer science, machine learning and medical research. You
          will be involved in potentially ground-breaking research developing and implementing algorithms and software to predict the risk of a woman developing breast cancer using digital, pre-diagnosis mammographic images.
As the successful candidate you will combine an enthusiasm for data science research with a doctoral qualification in Computer Science, Statistics or a closely related field. Experience with image processing and/or deep learning
          is desirable, but not necessary.
This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Dr Daniel Schmidt, Senior Lecturer, Data Science, +61 3 9905 9985
Position Description
Research Fellow
Closing Date
Thursday 4 April 2019, 11.55pm AEDT

title: Data Scientist - Big Data
description:
Senior Data Scientist
Melbourne CBD
Initial 3+ Month Contract
Excellent Daily Contract Rate

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will harness the power of Big Data through predictive analytics and innovative machine learning models. We are seeking a Data Scientist to support systems and business optimisation through detailed analysis of data.
          The Data Scientist team drives strategic business initiatives by researching, analyzing and interpreting data; developing algorithms to evaluate customer behaviour and identify areas of opportunity; presenting analysis and recommendations; and
          participating with business units and IT to deliver innovative, actionable business models. The Data Scientist will be responsible for assisting in the definition of data mining and machine learning strategies and the execution of corresponding
          procedures.
Required Skills and Experience

A minimum of 3 years of experience in data mining, machine learning and distributed computing is required
Bachelors degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or Mathematics preferred
Familiarity with Hadoop, Pig, Hive and MapReduce is required
Knowledge with Python, Perl or other scripting language is a must
Demonstrated proficiency with statistical computing languages such as R, MATLAB, etc.
Experience with integrating large-scale heterogeneous datasets is require
Knowledge with statistical research techniques, including modeling, data mining, clustering and segmentation
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with third parties and internal staff at all levels of the organization
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent organization and time management skills

Please submit your resume in Word Format using the link provided. No calls please.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
About us:
Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online wagering company. We're part of a global company, a big player with a start-up soul. The pace of change is exhilarating, we’re constantly innovating to bring excitement to life for our customers and our
          people.
Perks: 

Free brekky, discounted Myki & gym memberships, loads of event & conference tickets
Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers
5 weeks’ annual leave
Company bonus

Your Mission…
In the Data Science team we believe in using Advanced Analytics & Machine Learning to provide better experiences for our customers. We work with business stakeholders & engineers to innovate and develop algorithms & systems that improve
          business processes, help us better understand customers and create exciting, personalised experiences for them.
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to bring our Machine Learning capability to the next level.
Examples of problems you will solve include real-time recommender system, predictive models that work for individual customers, large-scale decision supporting systems, and any other cool & valuable ideas you can propose!
Technical skills & personal attributes: 

Strong knowledge of Machine Learning, algorithms, statistics, optimisations
Previous commercial or excellent research experience in Machine Learning/Data Science
Formal education/training or work experience with advanced AI/Machine Learning techniques, such as Deep Learning
Proficient in Python or similar programming languages
Competencies with one or more AWS cloud technologies highly preferred
Skills in Data engineering and/or Software engineering are a definite plus
Passion for problem solving & research
Be agile and not afraid thrive in a dynamic & challenging environment  

If this sounds like you, hit Apply now to be considered for this role!
At Sportsbet, we take Responsible Gambling very seriously. Check out the tools & information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site here

title: Senior Java software engineer - Machine Learning
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a  Senior Java engineer to work for a Tier one bank in Melbourne on a fraud detection project.The team is building a new system based on machine learning which will be ingesting and analyzing large sets
        of data in real-time. The platform is also to be hosted in AWS and you will be supported in gaining your certifications within the role if you don't already have them.  We’re looking for someone with:

java development, experience with building APIs (kong) and micro services.
Exposure to distributed big data stacks e.g. Spark, PySpark, Kafka, Hive, Flume, Hue & Sqoop.
An understanding and/or experience developing data analytics platforms like SAS, SPSS, Tableau, etc.
Able to work with different data types e.g. streaming, real-time, file based, RDMS, unstructured data, etc.
Experience working in cloud deployment and management (especially AWS).
A strong understanding of CI/CD practices.
An open mindset and proven ability to innovate and influence.
A passion for learning (tell us about the self-learning courses and certifications you have done - Coursera, Udacity, AWS, etc.)
 If interested please APPLY NOW are call Will McGreal for more info on 03 8637 7304.

title: Senior Python Developer / Engineer
description:
Huge opportunity for and experienced Python Developer / Engineer to join an agile and dynamic team who have proven success in building large-scale enterprise applications, including lead generation applications, natural language
          processing systems and large-scale data processing systems though AI & Machine learning
You will be working in a very talented team who were originally a Sydney start-up and have now teamed up with a global education organisation to deliver their technology that helps to improve education, financial risks and compliance by using
          AI and machine learning.

Sydney CBD
Financial backing of $2 billion annual revenue
Rolling out their tech solutions to more than 1 million students in 30 countries 
Rapidly evolving product

Python
Amazon Web Services, (AWS), EC2, RDS, S3
Django OR Flask
MySQL, PostgreSQL, OR MongoDB.
Queuing systems such as RabbitMQ in a microservices architecture.
Memcached OR Redis.
Git. Vagrant, Docker

 
If you are a Senior Python developer with experience building out highly scalable asynchronous applications and have a keen interest in AI / Machine learning then this would be the perfect match.
 
Apply here & feel free to contact Adam Armstrong with any questions: 02 9270 5232 | aarmstrong@siriustechnology.com.au

title: Computer Vision | Deep Learning | Machine Learning
Python Engineer - AWS / AI / ML - Sydney - Up to $150+ Super
description:
Python Engineer - AWS/AI/Machine Learning - Sydney - Up to $150k + Super
 
About/Purpose
An agile and highly iterative team dedicated to delivering technology solutions that deliver maximum value to clients and help them grow their business. They have a track record of building large-scale enterprise applications, including lead generation
          applications, natural language processing systems and large-scale data processing systems. They are looking for people who are comfortable adapting quickly as the product evolves, tackling new problems andinnovating solutions. Creative,
          motivated, able to take responsibility and support the data-driven solutions you create.
 
If you are a Python Developer who has a strong interest OR want to learn AI/Machine Learning this is the role for you.
 
Tech Stack (Experience in all not essential):

Python - Essential
Amazon Web Services, in particular EC2, RDS, S3
Experience working with frameworks like Django/Flask, asyncio, requests, pytest, mock
Database technologies like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB. 
working with queue systems such as RabbitMQ in a microservicesarchitecture.
Experience with building out highly scalable asynchronous applications.
Caching solutions such as Memcached and Redis.
Git.
Vagrant, Docker

title: Data Scientist - Big Data
description:
Senior Data Scientist
Melbourne CBD
Initial 3+ Month Contract
Excellent Daily Contract Rate

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will harness the power of Big Data through predictive analytics and innovative machine learning models. We are seeking a Data Scientist to support systems and business optimisation through detailed analysis of data.
          The Data Scientist team drives strategic business initiatives by researching, analyzing and interpreting data; developing algorithms to evaluate customer behaviour and identify areas of opportunity; presenting analysis and recommendations; and
          participating with business units and IT to deliver innovative, actionable business models. The Data Scientist will be responsible for assisting in the definition of data mining and machine learning strategies and the execution of corresponding
          procedures.
Required Skills and Experience

A minimum of 3 years of experience in data mining, machine learning and distributed computing is required
Bachelors degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or Mathematics preferred
Familiarity with Hadoop, Pig, Hive and MapReduce is required
Knowledge with Python, Perl or other scripting language is a must
Demonstrated proficiency with statistical computing languages such as R, MATLAB, etc.
Experience with integrating large-scale heterogeneous datasets is require
Knowledge with statistical research techniques, including modeling, data mining, clustering and segmentation
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with third parties and internal staff at all levels of the organization
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent organization and time management skills

Please submit your resume in Word Format using the link provided. No calls please.

description:
A leading global brand is currently seeking an experienced Senior Data Scientist to explore data science solutions and tools to integrate and put into production.
With strong focus on building integration solutions, you will get an opportunity to work and code using cutting edge technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, AWS, R, Python and more.
This will be a great chance for a Senior Data Scientist to be the key driver in encouraging the application of data science to generate commercial value.

Guide and mentor existing data science teams to implement data science models
Provide insights and recommendations to key stakeholders
Provide organization and manage data science deliverables
Provide subject matter expertise with Big Data technologies to constantly challenge and improve the Big Data solutions by adding new capabilities, enhancing performance or improving robustness and solution availability.

Proven experience using Big Data tools (e.g. Apache Spark, etc.)
Experience working in a collaborative development environment and its tools (e.g. Git or similar)
Ability to present and communicate complex technical issues to a variety of audiences including senior management.
Proven experience using analytics and machine learning tools (e.g. R, Python, Spark, etc.)

 
This is an excellent opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist who enjoys being hands on the tools to become an essential part of design, development and delivery of exciting data science methods across the organization.

title: Rule Automation Consultant - RegTech, (Sydney or Melbourne) 12 month contract
description:
About Allens 
Allens is a leading international law firm with offices throughout Australia and Asia.
We have recently been named an elite "band one" firm in 20 practice areas and jurisdictions by Chambers Asia Pacific 2019. This achievement caps off a year of working with clients on some of Australia's largest and most complex deals.
The opportunity
At Allens, we are renown in the Australian Legal market as an innovator in law. We are looking for a driven Rule Automation Consultant - RegTech to join our growing team on a 12 month contract, with the potential for extension. This role will
          be focused on building RegTech AI and machine learning solutions for our clients.
The role of Rule Automation Consultant – RegTech is new within Allens. You will work closely with internal teams, technology providers and our clients to deliver projects building automated compliance review tools that will deliver benefits to
          our clients.
As a Rule Automation Consultant – RegTech, you will be comfortable operating across practice groups and locations and delivering services to our clients in innovative ways through technology and automating manual systems and processes. At the
          forefront of RegTech, you will be working at the intersection of technology and regulatory compliance, helping our national team build a new service offering in a fast moving environment.
You may be a Business Analyst looking for the next step up in their career, a Software/Test Automation developer looking for a business-facing role, or a lawyer with a keen interest in technology.
You are a critical thinker who is focused on finding and delivering the optimal solution to our clients. You are ambitious and have a keen sense of ownership, exceptional time management skills. An ability to deliver high quality work under pressure
          will be paramount.
Core responsibilities include:

Working with technology vendors in the area of AI and machine learning
Scoping client needs, then working with internal teams, clients and vendors to prepare work plans and deliver optimal work products
Analysing existing client compliance and legal review processes and rules and working with current and new tools to automate review processes by building automated rules within available technology solutions
Managing other rule builders including a full time Rules Analyst
Liaising with clients and Allens teams to resolve issues to deliver services on time, within scope and budget
Working with partners to provide a regulatory rule maintenance and governance service to clients.

What you'll bring
To be successful in this role, you will need:

The ability to assess existing business rules and convert them into codified logic (Rule Building, NLP, Information Retrieval or an AI background would be advantageous)
Project management experience, ideally working in an Agile environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills
Proven ability to work with multiple stakeholders at all levels of seniority
To be a self-starter who is keen to develop and learn; and keep on top of current trends in the LegTech/RegTech market.

What we'll offer

The opportunity to work on cutting-edge work with emerging technology in the LegTech/RegTech field.  
Our people are technical experts, but they’re also trusted business advisers who think bigger, more broadly and more strategically. Together, we solve complex legal challenges, and collaborate across practice areas and disciplines to guide our
            clients.
Working at Allens entitles employees to a wide range of benefits including a gym membership, discounted product and services, charity matched funding programs, health and wellbeing initiatives and fantastic professional development opportunities.
Our strategic alliance with Linklaters opens up worlds of opportunity for our business and our people through international secondments. Our global teams act as one, sharing knowledge and best practice approaches to help solves our clients'
            most complex problems.
We recognise that our people are talented professionals who lead full and rewarding lives, and we want to create an environment that inspires them to give their very best. Flexibility is standard, underpinned by mutual trust and responsibility. 
Our teams are open, inclusive and encouraging, giving you the chance to learn and grow, but your development will be down to you. You’ll have the flexibility to drive your career, and we’ll recognise your achievements and hard work as you progress
            through the firm.

Are you ready to begin?
Please submit your resume via our on-line careers site addressed to Christa Howat, Resourcing Consultant.

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

title: Full Stack Developer - Python - Perm Role - Sydney
Data Scientist - Unstructured data modelling
description:
Talent International is working in partnership with a major federal government organisation to assist in sourcing a Data Scientist on contract based in Sydney CBD.Working within a team of other data scientists the successful applicant will
        develop analytical solutions to deliver transformative technical projects which provide significant business.The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk themes and topics from vast document collections, text mining, image
        classification and automation. Key duties of the role will include
        
Work with a cross functional team of analysts, report developers and engineers to move Proof-of-Concept models/products to production for clients 
Utilise complex analytic techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, using computational methods to discover data patterns and to develop classification, prediction and optimisation
            models 
Manipulate and analyse big data from disparate systems 
Apply in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods 
Develop, enhance and maintain a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour 
 In order to be considered we are seeking talented data scientists who meet the following criteria:
        
A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages.
An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Australian Citizenship is MANDATORY in order to be considered. For immediate consideration please forward a copy of your current resume via the APPLY NOW button or email Patrick at Talent International on patricko@talentinternational.com.auFor
        further queries please call (02) 9223 9855.

title: Lead Data Scientist - Brisbane
description:
Crunch data, uncover insights and create knowledge. Join InfoReady, part of Arq Group, where you can design and implement solutions that enable organisations to harness data for competitive advantage
What you get to do.
Working with many of Australia’s leading companies, you will deliver advanced and predictive analytics, segmentation and classification help converting business problems into solutions. What you do will directly impact client’s growth, customer
          churn, increase efficiencies and predict customer demand.
About you.
We seek candidates with minimum of 5 years experience working on relevant real-world applications, with a minimum Masters degree in Analytics/Machine Learning or other related computer science program from a top program. 
You will be leading teams that build solutions using tools such as Python, R, and Machine Learning frameworks that help converting business problems into solutions that may help clients maximise growth, reduce customer churn, increase efficiencies
          and predict customer demand.
Essential Skills

Fluency in Python, R, or SQL
Experience dealing with large unstructured data sets with multiple sources –
Hands on Machine Learning within a Business Context
Data Vizualisation experience. Using Tableau , Qlik or similar.
Strong Business Analysis experience
Big Data/Cloud technologies
Ability to present finding to C-level stakeholders

We are smart thinkers. We solve complex challenges and provide complete solutions for businesses, big and small. From design thinking, leading mobile apps, cloud and analytical insights, digital marketing, to web design. Arq Group is Australia’s
          leading digital partner.
#LifeatArq
Our people are our greatest asset. Curiosity is in our DNA. Courage is in our hearts. And collaboration is at our core. “Our Ways” set us apart from others in how we deliver to our customers and work together. From wellness programs, learning
          and development, social calendars to coffee machines, and more. We've got something for everyone to be themselves. Did we also mention how much fun it is to work with other Arqadians?  And yes, it is true; we love what we do. Join Arq Group
          and find your space to (change).
At Arq Group, we unleash the possibilities between business and people.
#Infoready

Our strategic alliance with Linklaters opens up worlds of opportunity for our business and our people through international secondments. Our global teams act as one, sharing knowledge and best practice approaches to help solves our clients'
            most complex problems.
We recognise that our people are talented professionals who lead full and rewarding lives, and we want to create an environment that inspires them to give their very best. Flexibility is standard, underpinned by mutual trust and responsibility. 
Our teams are open, inclusive and encouraging, giving you the chance to learn and grow, but your development will be down to you. You’ll have the flexibility to drive your career, and we’ll recognise your achievements and hard work as you progress
            through the firm.

Are you ready to begin?
Please submit your resume via our on-line careers site addressed to Christa Howat, Resourcing Consultant.
