title: AWS Big Data Engineer
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to
          lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with
          talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking an AWS Big Data Engineer to augment our Transportation client’s
          project delivering a fully automated AWS based data lake. Joining us on an initial 3 month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be an important piece of the team designing, consulting and implementing AWS Big
          Data Services.    This will include:

Provide high level technical subject matter expertise in the deployment of large scale data solutions, both on premise and cloud-based 
Create detailed target state architecture and blueprints for modern data technologies and cloud data services
Provide technical leadership and consulting for this large project
Build, test, and deploy solutions via AWS cloud data services

 We are looking for someone with:

Requirements of the Senior AWS Big Data Engineer:

AWS/Hadoop certifications preferred
3-4 years of experience applying ETL data warehousing best practices
At least 3 years of hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing in an AWS environment
1-2 years of experience building and executing large scale enterprise data solutions, data lakes, and applications with at least one AWS data and analytics services and third parties

EC2, EMR, S3, Kinesis, Dynamo DB, RedShift,  RDS, Lambda, Glue, Spark, Snowflake etc.
3rd party KMS, HSM with AWS data services for building secure data solutions
Hadoop stack (HDFS, PIG, Hive, Spark, Ambari, SQOOP, Map reduce, Tez, Ranger etc..)
Experience in Data Lake management tools Like Podium Data, Diyotta, Informatica BDE etc. is a plus

1-2 years of hands-on experience analyzing and re-architecting and moving on-premise data lake to data platforms on AWS cloud using AWS/third parties 
1-2 years of experience designing and building production data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a hybrid big data architecture using Java, Python, C++, etc.
1-2 years of experience architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on AWS cloud 
Exposure to Logi, SAS, Tableau, R, or equivalent dashboard reporting tool a plus
Motivated self-starter with the ability to complete tasks under minimal supervision/assistance 


 We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment
          to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration
          fees, and have access to discounted training and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381948.

title: Senior Big Data Engineer
description:
We are seeking Big Data consultants who have a passion for technology and are prepared to question and challenge the norm in order to drive change.    A focus on automation to drive efficiency and quality (code and solutions) and
        a passion for incremental improvement are key for this role.    The Opportunities and Responsibilities of the role:

Design, build and test new Big Data platform design patterns, disseminate successful patterns to the wider engineering community
Determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations
Build libraries, user defined functions, and frameworks around Hadoop
Research, evaluate and utilize new technologies/tools/frameworks around Hadoop eco system
Develop user defined functions to provide custom Kafka and SPARK capabilities
Define and build data acquisitions and consumption strategies
Contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation
Contribute and be part of a Community of Practices
Uplift and contribute to new/current platform design patterns
  Knowledge and Experience:

Tertiary qualifications in IT, engineering or equivalent experience of 8+ years’ in Enterprise level IT organisation
Highly developed conceptual, analytical, problem solving skills and systems and process thinking
Experience with big data infrastructure projects
Understanding of relevant development life cycles and technologies
Experience working in Agile (SAFe) frameworks
A mix of the following skills, experience and knowledge is required:
Excellent coding skills in python and java
Terraform, Groovy DSL, Jenkins
AWS Services (Ec2, ECS, s3, lambda, stepfunction, SNS, redshift, IAM, route53, EMR, elasticsearch, sqs, Glue, Athena, KMS)
Docker, ansible, packer, goss
Kafka, spark, Cassandra, GG (optional)
    At CSKnexus we focus on the smallest of details for both clients and our employees and we help people get where they want to go. We believe that there are some definable attributes to become part of the Nexus Network that
        go above and beyond just technical skills. That's what we are looking for - the attributes of a CSKnexus consultant.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
About the Team
Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very
          good reason - our exceptional people.
About the role
The Big Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Your responsibilities include:

Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into AWS based data lake platform
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Build DevOps pipeline
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

About you
You will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture
          is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Essential skills and experience

Strong experience on Big data / Hadoop Technology stack in Hadoop, Hive, Scala, MongoDB, HBase, Cassandra, Python
3+ Years experience with Big data stream processing frameworks such as Kafka Streaming, KSQL, Spark streaming, Storm, Flume etc.
Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages J2EE, Scala or Python
4+ Years Experience with the following technologies: Java, Spring Framework, JMS, REST APIs, Kafka, Spring Boot, NoSQL, AWS.
Experience building JAVA RESTful API's.
Familiarity with modern design patterns/microservices.
Strong proficiency with DBMS (Oracle/MS SQL).
Experience working with AWS services such as SNS, SQS, API Gateway, Lambda, S3.
Create/configure jobs for Control M or similar enterprise scheduling tools.
Some experience with ETL tools such as Informatica/Talend advantageous.

What we can offer you?
Capgemini is a world leader in technology enabled change. We can offer our consultants;

Formal training with industry recognized certifications
The ability to interact with peers in a sharing and inclusive community
Exciting and challenging projects
A well-structured and tailored career framework
A culture of collaboration and recognition
Excellent remuneration

About Capgemini
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 180,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform in
          order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the Word. Our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log ontowww.capgemini.com.au
Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

title: Big Data AWS Engineer (URGENT)
description:
With the increase of investment in data science and analytics and the underlying infrastructure, we are noticing significant demand for engineers with expertise in big data technologies. 
   
 As such we have partnered with a domestic but global organisation who set up an analytics centre of excellence which is now comprised of data scientists, data engineers and analytics strategists. They only take on projects that are complex in
          nature (no reporting here), and that will ultimately add value to the business. To date they have successfully delivered high profile projects demonstrating a positive ROI that has been well received by the group. 
   
 They are now seeking a big data engineer to assist them on a new programme of work to create a state of the art data lake based on AWS Cloud, which will involve very large amounts of data (up to 15TB) catered for by their big data platform. The
          key expertise they are looking for are: Spark, Python, Scala, and Java and any experience with AWS cloud or distributed platforms is highly desired. 
   
 This is an exciting and genuine opportunity to embed yourself in a team of true big data engineers. 
   
 Please feel free to contact me at eli.gunduz@tomexecutive.com with your resume for a confidential discussion.

title: Lead Big Data Architect
description:
About our team:
 Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner
          with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people!
 About our role:
 You will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, build, optimise, and maintain conceptual and logical database models as well as optimise the data flow and collection for cross functional teams.

You will design and implement big data platform on AWS cloud to support variety of use cases including data science, machine learning, BI and reporting
You will define strategy and architecture to migrate data from legacy systems to new big data solutions, data pipelines for data collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
You will assess and propose the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Big data ETL, Database Replication, Application Integration, SQL and NoSQL technologies.
You will provide technical leadership to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent and resolve technical issues.
You will work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
You will define security and backup procedures

Most importantly about you:

You will have demonstrable experience of working on Big Data Technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, HBase, Avro/Parquet, Sqoop.
You have extensive experience supporting large production Hadoop platforms.
You are experienced in SQL-based, NoSQL-based and MPP datastores.
You are able to architect and design both streaming and batch use cases in a big data platform.
You are an expert in in building Big Data/Data Lake solutions using AWS services - S3, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, Athena, Redshift, AWS CLI etc.
You develop a vision for information delivery and management and driving execution of the roadmap, including enterprise data architecture, big data, analytics and data management.
You can mentor and support other team members to achieve team outcomes and facilitate a motivated and hard-working environment.
You are great at building relationships with internal and/or external clients.
You have previously written and produced technical documentation and knowledgebase articles.
You think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
You have demonstrable experience designing highly available, highly scalable production systems.
You are familiar with the Elastic stack, including Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana beneficial.
You are familiar with ETL tools such as Informatica (PowerCenter, BDM) or Talend.
If you have knowledge in Architecture frameworks like TOGAF this will be highly regarded

What we're offering:  
 Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary
          continuance insurance, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.
 Capgemini:
 Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 200,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform
          in order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.

description:

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
Are you a Data Engineer looking for an exciting role with an Australian owned company, focusing on collaboration, innovation and building a culture          you can stand behind?...Then keep reading because this is just the role for you!!WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:

Offer methods of Data pre-processing, cleansing and perform BAU tasks including, but not limited to, Extract Transform Load (ETL).
Optimising queries and structures for execution of distributed systems
Implement best practices within the Data Engineering team 
Researching methods which will translate into prototypes and proof of concepts.
End to end data solution integrity systems which involve the designing, building, testing and deployment of said solutions. 
Redefine and structure all data sources internally and translate how the company can, if not already, effectively utilise and collect that data using secure data stores. 
Maintaining common data architecture implementations.
Providing analytical interpretations to stakeholders and senior management level.

REQUIREMENTS TO BE SUCCESSFUL:

Strong exposure of at least one cloud-based technology- Azure (preferred), AWS, GCP, etc.
Knowledge and hands-on exposure working in Big Data. 
Experience working in Hadoop environments (PySpark, SparkSQL, Hive, etc.)
Proven experience in optimising and writing queries using NoSQL and SQL
Demonstrated knowledge and skill in implementing data ETL and data processing concepts.
Experience with at least one coding language such as Python,.Net, C#, Java, etc. 
Commercial experience of working in a similar data environment where you are able to recognize issues and find the best path forward using the best practice solution. 


WHAT YOU CAN GAIN FROM THIS ROLE:

Generous salary + Superannuation.
Professional and established data team.
Opportunity to gain mentorship from skilled professionals internally.
Ability to grow and progress your career with the company.
Upskilling opportunities which translate into educational incentives.
Casual working culture, which supports work-life balance. 

If you're interested in having a chat with us about this opportunity, apply today or reach out and let's grab a coffee and see what we can do to help you take the leap!  
billy@talentpoolgroup.com - 0423 392 027

title: AWS Big Data Engineer
description:
Do you believe you can do anything? Then we’re here to help you do it.   If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.   We’re positioned to
          lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 31,000 great people in more than 57 countries, you’ll be working with
          talented teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.     We are seeking an AWS Big Data Engineer to augment our Transportation client’s
          project delivering a fully automated AWS based data lake. Joining us on an initial 3 month contract and based in Melbourne, CBD you’ll be an important piece of the team designing, consulting and implementing AWS Big
          Data Services.    This will include:

Provide high level technical subject matter expertise in the deployment of large scale data solutions, both on premise and cloud-based 
Create detailed target state architecture and blueprints for modern data technologies and cloud data services
Provide technical leadership and consulting for this large project
Build, test, and deploy solutions via AWS cloud data services

 We are looking for someone with:

Requirements of the Senior AWS Big Data Engineer:

AWS/Hadoop certifications preferred
3-4 years of experience applying ETL data warehousing best practices
At least 3 years of hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing in an AWS environment
1-2 years of experience building and executing large scale enterprise data solutions, data lakes, and applications with at least one AWS data and analytics services and third parties

EC2, EMR, S3, Kinesis, Dynamo DB, RedShift,  RDS, Lambda, Glue, Spark, Snowflake etc.
3rd party KMS, HSM with AWS data services for building secure data solutions
Hadoop stack (HDFS, PIG, Hive, Spark, Ambari, SQOOP, Map reduce, Tez, Ranger etc..)
Experience in Data Lake management tools Like Podium Data, Diyotta, Informatica BDE etc. is a plus

1-2 years of hands-on experience analyzing and re-architecting and moving on-premise data lake to data platforms on AWS cloud using AWS/third parties 
1-2 years of experience designing and building production data pipelines from ingestion to consumption within a hybrid big data architecture using Java, Python, C++, etc.
1-2 years of experience architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on AWS cloud 
Exposure to Logi, SAS, Tableau, R, or equivalent dashboard reporting tool a plus
Motivated self-starter with the ability to complete tasks under minimal supervision/assistance 


 We look for people with a client centric, consultative approach. We want team players. We care about our clients, our colleagues, and the environment and we want you to do the same.    In return for your skills and your commitment
          to our values, you will be exposed to industry leading technology, projects and expertise. You’ll have the support of specialist colleagues across Australia and the globe. And unique in the contracting market, you’ll be charged no payroll administration
          fees, and have access to discounted training and certifications via Dimension Data Learning Solutions.    Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today!    Diversity in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.
 To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Fabian Virgies on 1800 456 122. Please quote our job reference number: 381948.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:

Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very
          good reason - our exceptional people.
About the role
The Big Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Your responsibilities include:

Build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into AWS based data lake platform
Design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Build DevOps pipeline
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

About you
You will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture
          is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Essential skills and experience

Strong experience on Big data / Hadoop Technology stack in Hadoop, Hive, Scala, MongoDB, HBase, Cassandra, Python
3+ Years experience with Big data stream processing frameworks such as Kafka Streaming, KSQL, Spark streaming, Storm, Flume etc.
Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages J2EE, Scala or Python
4+ Years Experience with the following technologies: Java, Spring Framework, JMS, REST APIs, Kafka, Spring Boot, NoSQL, AWS.
Experience building JAVA RESTful API's.
Familiarity with modern design patterns/microservices.
Strong proficiency with DBMS (Oracle/MS SQL).
Experience working with AWS services such as SNS, SQS, API Gateway, Lambda, S3.
Create/configure jobs for Control M or similar enterprise scheduling tools.

Formal training with industry recognized certifications

Strong exposure of at least one cloud-based technology- Azure (preferred), AWS, GCP, etc.
Knowledge and hands-on exposure working in Big Data. 
Experience working in Hadoop environments (PySpark, SparkSQL, Hive, etc.)
Proven experience in optimising and writing queries using NoSQL and SQL
Demonstrated knowledge and skill in implementing data ETL and data processing concepts.
Experience with at least one coding language such as Python,.Net, C#, Java, etc. 
Commercial experience of working in a similar data environment where you are able to recognize issues and find the best path forward using the best practice solution. 


WHAT YOU CAN GAIN FROM THIS ROLE:

Generous salary + Superannuation.
Professional and established data team.
Opportunity to gain mentorship from skilled professionals internally.
Ability to grow and progress your career with the company.
Upskilling opportunities which translate into educational incentives.
Casual working culture, which supports work-life balance. 

If you're interested in having a chat with us about this opportunity, apply today or reach out and let's grab a coffee and see what we can do to help you take the leap!  
billy@talentpoolgroup.com - 0423 392 027 
**Valid unrestricted working rights, Permanent residency or Australian Citizenship required for this permanent full-time opportunity.

title: Lead Big Data Architect
description:
About our team: 
 Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner
          with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people!
 About our role:
 You will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, build, optimise, and maintain conceptual and logical database models as well as optimise the data flow and collection for cross functional teams.

You will design and implement big data platform on AWS cloud to support variety of use cases including data science, machine learning, BI and reporting
You will define strategy and architecture to migrate data from legacy systems to new big data solutions, data pipelines for data collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
You will assess and propose the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Big data ETL, Database Replication, Application Integration, SQL and NoSQL technologies.
You will provide technical leadership to project team to perform design to deployment related activities, provide guidance, perform reviews, prevent and resolve technical issues.
You will work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
You will assess and propose methods to improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
You will define security and backup procedures

Most importantly about you:

You will have demonstrable experience of working on Big Data Technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, HBase, Avro/Parquet, Sqoop.
You have extensive experience supporting large production Hadoop platforms.
You are experienced in SQL-based, NoSQL-based and MPP datastores.
You are able to architect and design both streaming and batch use cases in a big data platform.
You are an expert in in building Big Data/Data Lake solutions using AWS services - S3, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, Glue, Athena, Redshift, AWS CLI etc.
You develop a vision for information delivery and management and driving execution of the roadmap, including enterprise data architecture, big data, analytics and data management.
You can mentor and support other team members to achieve team outcomes and facilitate a motivated and hard-working environment.
You are great at building relationships with internal and/or external clients.
You have previously written and produced technical documentation and knowledgebase articles.
You think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
You have demonstrable experience designing highly available, highly scalable production systems.
You are familiar with the Elastic stack, including Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana beneficial.
You are familiar with ETL tools such as Informatica (PowerCenter, BDM) or Talend.
If you have knowledge in Architecture frameworks like TOGAF this will be highly regarded

What we're offering:  
 Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. Not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you will also have access to great benefits including, salary
          continuance insurance, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.
 Capgemini:
 Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology, outsourcing services and local professional services. Present in over 40 countries with more than 200,000 people, the Capgemini Group helps its clients transform
          in order to improve their performance and competitive positioning.
 Ranked among Ethisphere's 2018 Most Ethical Companies in the World, our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty.
 If you believe you have "La Niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply by submitting your resume and cover letter.
Want to know more? To learn more about Capgemini and find out about what makes our people unique, log onto www.capgemini.com.au
 Proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior or at offer time. Successful applicants will be required to complete a Criminal Record and Reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

ting engagements

Work with a cross functional team of analysts, report developers and engineers to move Proof-of-Concept models/products to production for clients

            models

          to the department. The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk themes and topics from vast document collections, text mining, image classification and automation. The successful candidate require an in-depth understanding
          of data-science concepts and issues with a working knowledge and experience with unstructured data (images and text). They will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems and issues, and guide and mentor others with these requirements.

Applies technical knowledge and experience in various data science areas such as data mining, text mining, image processing, data visualisation, artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistical modelling and behavioural analytics.

description:
As a Data Scientist you will have in-depth understanding of data-science concepts and issues with a working knowledge and experience with unstructured data (images and text). You will take the
        lead in solving complex data-science problems and issues, and guide and mentor others with these requirements. You will have demonstrable practical experience in using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques and
        the delivery of analytical solutions to business clients. You will also have demonstrated experience in:

            code quality. 
Data; An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Tools; Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset.

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

title: Data Scientist
description:
Our client, a Federal Government Department are seeking a Data Scientist to develop analytical solutions to deliver transformative technical projects. The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk themes and topics from vast document
          collections, text mining, image classification and automation.
You will require an in-depth understanding of data-science concepts and issues with a working knowledge and experience with unstructured data (images and text). You will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems.
The skills:

Language; A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages. Additionally, Java skills will be highly advantageous.
Professional commitment and skills of maintaining code quality.
Data; An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts.
Tools; Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 

Responsibilities:
 

Utilise data mining techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, such as translating text/image into meaningful information that can be linked to structured data and visually
            presenting in a dashboard to our customers/stakeholder and support overall business outcome.
Communicate across all levels of the agency confidently, persuasively and sensitively and articulate relevant matters
Review research and discussion papers to develop skills and to share learnings and information with team
Work with a cross functional team of analysts, report developers and engineers to move Proof-of-Concept models/products to production for clients
Manipulate and analyse big data from disparate systems
Apply in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods
Provide technical knowledge and expertise in reducing vast and disparate data sets into categorised and useful summaries and reports to improve user experiences and support overall business outcomes
Present data and complex numerical information in a clear and concise manner and clearly communicate statistical concepts to senior and non-technical audiences
Encourage the use of new technologies and techniques to solve data problems and publish regular reporting and dashboards based on stakeholder requirements

title: Data Scientist
description:
I am working with a large Federal Government department to find a Data Scientist. This role can be located in either Canberra/Box Hill/Sydney or Brisbane.This role will be for an initial 6 months with 3 x 6 month extensions.You
        will require an in-depth understanding of data-science concepts and issues with a working knowledge and experience with unstructured data (images and text). You will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems        and issues, and guide and mentor others with these requirements. You will have demonstrable practical experience in using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques and the delivery of
        analytical solutions to business clients. You will also have demonstrated experience in:

Language; A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages. Additionally, Java skills will be highly advantageous. Professional commitment and skills of maintaining code
            quality. 
Data; An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Tools; Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Presentation; An ability to produce business-ready output with key action items, An awareness of deployment using Git and a CI pipeline, An understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) processes
Your duties will include:

Utilising data mining techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, such as translating text/image into meaningful information that can be
            linked to structured data and visually presenting in a dashboard to our customers/stakeholder and support overall business outcome. 
Manipulating and analysing big data from disparate systems 
Applying in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods 
Developing, enhancing and maintaining a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour  
Providing technical knowledge and expertise in reducing vast and disparate data sets into categorised and useful summaries and reports to improve user experiences and support overall business outcomes 
Presenting data and complex numerical information in a clear and concise manner and clearly communicating statistical concepts to senior and non-technical audiences.
To have your application considered, you will:

Be an Australian citizen
Have the ability to obtain a security clearance
Not have worked outside of Australia in the last 5 years
If this role sounds of interest to you, please APPLY NOW. For more information, please contact Aimee Goff on 02 6113 7520 or via email aimee.goff @igniteco .com

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Our client, a global consultancy is seeking to engage an experienced Machine Learning Engineer, to play a pivotal role in a large IT Service Intelligence project, on-site with a Top 4 Bank.
 
Essential Skills:
The Machine Learning programmer must have the following skills and experience

A background and understanding of machine learning and in particular neural networks
Advanced coding in Java/J2EE, Python, XML and Javascript
Experience of using code management platforms (Github preferred)
Advanced Excel programming skills
Knowledge and experience of the Weka Machine Learning Workbench

 
Desirable Skills:
 It is highly desirable that the Machine Learning programmer also has coverage of the following areas

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

You will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems        and issues, and guide and mentor others with these requirements. You will have demonstrable practical experience in using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques and the delivery of
        analytical solutions to business clients. You will also have demonstrated experience in:

Language; A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages. Additionally, Java skills will be highly advantageous. Professional commitment and skills of maintaining code
            quality. 
Data; An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. 
Tools; Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr, Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Presentation; An ability to produce business-ready output with key action items, An awareness of deployment using Git and a CI pipeline, An understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) processes
Your duties will include:

Utilising data mining techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes, such as translating text/image into meaningful information that can be
            linked to structured data and visually presenting in a dashboard to our customers/stakeholder and support overall business outcome. 
Manipulating and analysing big data from disparate systems 
Applying in depth knowledge in forecasting, statistics, econometric modelling, linear programming and other optimisation algorithms and quantitative techniques, strong data cleansing skills and experience in devising testing methods 
Developing, enhancing and maintaining a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour  
Providing technical knowledge and expertise in reducing vast and disparate data sets into categorised and useful summaries and reports to improve user experiences and support overall business outcomes 
Presenting data and complex numerical information in a clear and concise manner and clearly communicating statistical concepts to senior and non-technical audiences.
To have your application considered, you will:

Be an Australian citizen
Have the ability to obtain a security clearance
Not have worked outside of Australia in the last 5 years
If this role sounds of interest to you, please APPLY NOW. For more information, please contact Aimee Goff on 02 6113 7520 or via email aimee.goff @igniteco .com

title: IT Data Scientist
description:
MTP Services Pty Ltd provides IT Contracting and Professional Services to the Canberra Market. Join a talented team and work in a culture that fosters an inclusive and flexible work environment, offering opportunities to grow and contribute to the
        company.Our client is searching for multiple Data Scientist to join their teams across Australia. The successful candidate(s) will develop analytical solutions to deliver transformative technical projects which provide significant
        business value to the Client. They will be developing advanced analytical solutions to deliver insights to business for risk identification/assessment, profiling and decision making. The work involves unstructured data modelling to identify risk
        themes and topics from vast document collections, text mining, image classification and automation.  The successful candidate(s) require an in-depth understanding of data-science concepts and issues with a working knowledge and experience
        with unstructured data (images and text). They will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems and issues, and guide and mentor others with these requirements. Responsibilities 

Applies knowledge in unstructured data processing such as Parsing, OCR, Indexing, NER etc. by making use of Apache Lucene tools and packages. And knowledge in linking unstructured data with structured data (from xml, tables etc.). 
Applies knowledge in UI design and development, such as R Shiny, Superset, and CSS. 
Applies computer programming skills with a diverse range of languages such as R, Python, Scala, Java, et cetera. 
Applies technical knowledge and experience in various data science areas such as data mining, text mining, image processing, data visualisation, artificial intelligence, machine learning, statistical modelling and behavioural analytics. 
Applies experience in data and system engineering, including data pipeline and end-to-end system engineering, to train and productionise analytical models. 
Applies experience in working in Linux environment, Hadoop platform/Clusters. 
Applies technical expertise to support our Big Data Analytics capability, such as the Hadoop Ecosystem. 
    Critically the Job Seeker will have: 

Practical Experience –demonstrable practical experience using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques, and delivery of analytical solutions to business clients. 
    Demonstrated experience 

Language; A proficient and well-defined knowledge of SQL and, either R, or, Python statistical programming languages. Additionally, Java skills will be highly advantageous. Professional commitment and skills of maintaining code quality.
Data; An ability to work with datasets of all types and formats specifically images and unstructured text. An understanding of data scales and sizes and related techniques, risks and impacts. Tools; Experience with Hadoop/Spark, Solr,
            Tika, Tesseract, Hive, Impala, TensorFlow, D3JS, R Shiny, Superset. 
Presentation; 
            
o An ability to produce business-ready output with key action items 
o An awareness of deployment using Git and a CI pipeline 
o An understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) processes


 If you have any questions please contact Sally Dixon from MTP Services on 6154 5424, or via email sally.dixon@mtpservices.com.auApply now for more info!

title: DevOps Software Engineer
description:
Mid-Level DevOps Software Engineer Passionate about DevOps and want to work on an ethical product? Leading ML consultancyCBD location$80K - $100K + Super  CompanyThis
          team are changing the way technology interactives with humans. A leader in the Machine Learning and AI space who have a successful image recognitionproduct that is actively catching poachers. Their work is changing the world and having been
          around for over 10 years this is a stable top tech company. You will work a lot with data scientists, mathematicians and with deep learning.  RoleThis is an exciting opportunity for a passionate DevOps/Software
          engineer. You will be expected to collaborate with the machine learning / software team to help build systems based on the developers’ needs. Part of the responsibility is designing, maintaining and deploying software into AWS. You will also
          have the opportunity to work on the most modern DevOps methodologies, with the ability to contribute to the overall development of operations. Part of the role is contributing to complex web apps currently written in Python, Ruby on Rails and
          a few in GoLang.  YouDevOps is a passion (2 years minimum experience)Experience in design, deploy and support software into AWS (Manage Ec2 before)DockerHave experience with Implementing and managing
          orchestration toolsSoftware Engineering experience (Python, ROR or GoLang experience preferential)GitComfortable with UnixSolid communication skills (it’s a collaborative environment!)  BonusInterest
          in Machine LearningTensorflowTerraformAnsible This company speaks for itself. You will be ethically changing the world and working with leaders in ML/AI. Send us your CV / folio / GitHub and we’ll get in
          touch for a chat.If you’d like more information about this opportunity, give Steve a call on 0490241106  APPLY NOW! (Valid PR or Australian citizenship required) Know someone who would
          be great for this job? Refer them and help a friend :)

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
Join one of Australia's leading technology professional services firm. We are looking for outstanding Data Scientists to join our team.   
The opportunity  
This is a great opportunity for a Data Science Consultant to join a consulting firm that offers a variety of projects and a structured learning and development path. You will work alongside a talented team of consultants who all share your passion
          in building great solutions and learning new skills.
About you
Skills in Data Science and Machine Learning: as a data science consultant you will have proficiency in one or more of Python, R, Scala, Matlab/Octave, Java, C/C++, Go, Javascript, Clojure etc. You will also have either hands
          on experience or good knowledge of the one of the following concepts such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, deep learning, feature engineering, natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing
          etc. Other skills and experience that will be highly regarded are the likes of big data ecosystem technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka), deep learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras), application and system engineering technologies (Kubernetes,
          Docker etc). Any experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform or Azure is highly desirable but not mandatory
A desire to learn emerging technologies in Data and Analytics: you have a desire to learn and acquire new skills including deep learning, big data technologies, high performance computing infrastructure etc.
Team player: you like being part of high performing teams and like sharing your knowledge with your peers 
About Servian
We are a professional services firm that puts our people at the heart of our strategy. We help customers challenge status quo by working with them on implementing new and emerging technologies whilst enabling our consultants to continue to learn
          and acquire new skills.
Our business is structured across 5 key practices:

Data & Analytics - BI/DW, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning
Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), Managed Services

What you can expect:

Learning & Development: As a naturally curious individual, you will have many opportunities to develop your technical and consulting skills. We run internal training on a weekly basis (knowledge sharing sessions, focus groups
            and our own Toastmasters Club!) as well as encourage and sponsor certifications.
Variety of projects: As a consultant, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple projects across our client base significantly increasing your skills and exposure in the industry.
Career progression: As a consulting firm, our leadership team is continually looking for technologists who want to develop their careers as people leaders and as senior advisors. You will have an opportunity to build your consulting
            skills as part of our team.

 
If this is you, please send us your CV and a cover letter outlining how you meet our selection criteria for your application to be considered.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Excited to use massive amounts of data to develop ML and DL applications? Would you like to help top enterprises tackle their Cyber Security issues through AI? Would you like to work with a fun out-going team? Are you an experienced Data Scientist
          with at least 5 years of commercial experience?
If you have answered yes to all of the questions above - look no longer, we have the perfect role for you!
The Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for researching, developing, deploying, delivering and supporting Cyber Advanced Analytics products and solutions for both internal business units and clients. They will have in-depth knowledge and
          excellent expertise across a wide variety of data science and analytics techniques to provide influence and leadership in adapting these skills in the realm of advanced security services including but not limited to the domain of cyber security.As
          a Senior Data Scientist, you will be wearing multiple hats as an Engineer, consultant, thought leader and researcher.
Engineering:

Provide innovative and cutting-edge ideas including architectural design input into further developing advanced Cyber platforms 
Design, build, validate, deliver, integrate and present the advanced analytical capabilities using statistical, ML and DL on large volumes of data for internal and external customers. 
Contribute to conceptual, algorithmic and architectural design, documentation, experiment, prototype, development, testing and deployment of ML/DL solutions on big data platform.
Translate and interpret customer requirements to analytics opportunity to build analytics product and, articulate and present back the proposed solutions to client in simplified format.

Consultation

Participate in consultation activities with customers around the world by running knowledge transfer sessions, requirement engineering workshops, POC and RFI as required.
Participate in sales and pre-sales activities globally including sales meetings, POC, HLD, LLD and RFI to support account managers in the field of security analytics.
Manage and lead security analytics projects including requirement engineering, solution design, Data analysis, POC and prototype for customers and internal business units.

Thought Leadership 

Participate in continuously evolving the top end thinking and operational capability at the intersection of Big Data Analytics, Advanced Analytics and Cyber Security.
Participate in roadmap and strategy around data and analytics through market research, customers interaction, competitor evaluation and vendor assessment.
Participate in design, practice and review of the best practice operation framework 

Research and Development

Maintain knowledge of current trends and latest applications in the fields of Advanced Data Analytics, ML, DL, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data Analytics, Cyber Security and Intelligence platforms.
Design and practice Innovation methods such as design thinking to explore new opportunities and build innovative and differentiative analytic capabilities. 
Partner and engage with research arms like the internal R&D centre, universities and research organizations and communities around the world to understand new trends in Data, Analytics and AI through attending and presenting in summits,
            conferences and workshops. 
Participate in research and development strategy and roadmap 

 
We would love to hear from you if you are meeting mos criterias below:

A PhD or Master Degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent industry experience. 
Extensive knowledge and industry experience (5+ years) of Machine Learning techniques and the ability to implement them in Big Data Platforms.
Extensive knowledge and industry experience with ML development using: Scala, Python and R and libraries like Scikit-learn, SparkML, Caret and MLR.
Adequate knowledge and industry experience with DL development using Tensorflow, Keras, MXNet, Theano, CNTK and Caffe 2 and potentially GPUs.
Adequate knowledge and industry experience with working on Big Data platforms (i.e Hadoop, HDFS, Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, AWS and Google Cloud stacks)
Experience of working in a complex technical development and integration environment to build software that will be deployed into production environments with high-quality documentation.
Experience of Linux system administration and Linux system troubleshooting is desirable.
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment.
Combination of deep technical skills and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within our customer’s organization
Track record of scientific and business publications and presentation is preferred. 


To apply please click apply or call Camille Vachon on +61 2 82893158 for a confidential discussion.

title: Python Engineer
description:
Would it be nice to contribute to something inherently good, such as medical research? Sounds lovely doesn't it? Read on: A Python Engineer is sought for this Medical Imagery Lab. Here you'll be responsible for several key, yet very
        achievable projects: 

Solving a complex data processing pipeline challenge
A core code rebuild/rewrite
Improving the end user experience 
Building a software toolkit 
 Experience required: 

2+ years’ Software Engineering with Python
Knowledge of Linux environment (Ubuntu)
Experience with MATLAB and bash scripting
Expertise in documentation processes and version control (Git)
Machine Learning; Numpy, Pandas, VMTK
Any experience in the medical / medical imagery field highly regarded                                           
 Get in touch with tasha@theonset.com.au to learn more about this or other Python Engineer opportunities.

title: C# Developer
description:

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The Portland House Group is one of Australia’s largest Private Funds Management Groups, which operates on a collegial culture with an open flow of ideas.
We are looking for a Senior level Big Data engineer, who is keen to work in the financial space. This is an opportunity to work with data in billions of records. You will work with highly skilled researchers and provide scalable solutions for
          different and unique problem domains.
Responsibilities

Developing Spark Application for Big Data processing.
Manage data-processing applications and formalise processes.
Update all the stakeholders with the status of the ongoing tasks.
Provide valuable inputs and recommended solutions based on research data.
Setup and management of our distributed infrastructure.

Key requirements:

Minimum of 4 years commercial experience in DevOps/Software Engineer
Minimum 2 years’ experience in Apache Spark/PySpark, and/or Hadoop, Map Reduce Framework
Experience working in research environment and a good understanding of statistics and Machine Learning.
Sound knowledge of Memory and I/O for performance optimisation.
Strong experience in Python programming.(Pandas/NumPy)
Experience with a Version control system like Git
Jenkins or similar CI/CD

Good to have:

Parquet/YARN/Scala
Core Java, Gradle and JPPF
Shell Scripting
Knowledge on Docker (and/or) other VM frameworks
Machine Learning knowledge

Our team is built from people with extensive experience in top tier international firms and our problems often reach computational limits. This role is suitable for the person seeking to work at the highest level.
Salary is highly competitive and commensurate with experience.
To ensure your application is considered please include a cover letter, resume and academic transcript and email to Judy Young at jobs@phg.com.au.  All candidate applications will be acknowledged electronically and treated in strictest confidence.

title: ETL Developer
description:
We're looking for an individual who has high attention to detail and wants to challenge the status quo, going beyond "this is my job". You'll be experienced with SQL, ETL, Unix and database systems and managing multiple stakeholders. In this
          role, you will be supporting the internal teams in implementing our marketing automation solutions and contribute from the data engineering side to the delivery of high-quality API-first data solutions.
Responsibilities:


Build excellent relationship and interact with clients and subject matter experts to prioritise, negotiate and resolve conflict.


Execute unit tests, support system integration tests, deployment and post verification tests.


Support ongoing database management, providing insights into database optimisation, including data cleanliness and data segmentation.


Operate in a consultative approach to assist in developing technical specifications and support manuals for data acquisition, transformation and load/transfer processes from a variety of data sources.


Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand and execute change requests.


Develop SQL database solutions that meet requirement specifications and manage the end to end project lifecycle.


Design, develop and maintain data models and ETL solutions that meet requirement specifications.


Skills and Qualifications:


Relevant degree in Computer Science or ICT


Minimum 1-2 years of experience working as a Database Developer


Demonstrated knowledge & understanding of SQL, ETL, Unix, Programming languages (eg: Perl/Shell/Java/PHP), enterprise job scheduling tool and database systems


Knowledge & understanding of cloud services, Hadoop, and API building will be highly advantageous


Experience with Marketing Automation Tools such as Salesforce, Adobe, IBM Watson and etc will be highly desirable


Ability to learn new technologies and tools for various projects


Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)


Alchemist Benefits:


Competitive Rates


Office located in the heart of the city, just opposite the QVB in Townhall


Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices


Snacks, fruit and stocked pantry


Full access to our games room - pool table, foosball and table tennis table


Frequent team activities


Company sponsored annual trips


Regular team lunches


Casual attire

title: Senior Business Analyst | Integration | SQL| ETL| Trading| Software| Agile
description:
Senior Business Analyst | Integration | SQL| ETL| Trading| Software| Agile About the Company  This Australian household name and leading financial services business are embarking on a world first
        programme of work being monitored and watch by all people involved in the financial markets globally.   About You  Your background will demonstrate working with vendors to deliver complex enterprise software
        project, and specifically the integration of complex systems taking in to account upstream and downstream feeds and many external business linking in to the platform.    This role will deal with a wide range of both internal
        and external stakeholders, SME's and technical teams so you must have a strong understanding of the financial markets and trading and settlement process to be successful in this position.  Required Skills/Experience  

5+ Years BA experience deliver complex software projects
Extensive vendor management experience
Strong knowledge of the financial markets
Experience working directly with technical teams Integrate complex enterprise systems
Strong communication skills and ability to deal with a wide cross section of internal and external stakeholders
Experience at working in both a waterfall and Agile environments
  About the Benefits World first programme of work CBD Office Location 12mth Day Rate Contract  ***please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted***

description:
Our client, a global IT services provider, is seeking an experienced ETL Developer to assist one of their end clients.
 Responsibilities:

Requirement analysis, design and development
Build, deploy and test
Code review and maintain code quality
Assist other team members/developers

Continuous integration

ETL Developer with experience and hands-on development expertise

To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Ferid Klancevic on 03 8680 4206. Please quote our job reference number: 200185997.

title: Contract ETL Developer
description:
Immediate start (please only apply if you can start working immediately)  8 week assignment 3 days a week    The Company My client is one of the largest
          cloud managed service providers, focused on mission-critical applications and managed services in a hybrid cloud world. They provide a range of services from front-end strategy and design to implementation and migration to on-going upgrades
          and support.   The Role; Joining an already high performing team, your background will demonstrate a high level of competency to hit the ground running in this short term yet business critical assignment. You
          will assist with the development and implementation of SQL database and ETL technology. Working with the customer’s internal team to help deliver and implement ETL on SQL server in an efficient and professional manner, dealing with very
          large and complex data sets. Don't miss this opportunity – APPLY NOW! All applications will b e reviewed upon submission as this role has an urgent start. Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.  Applicants
          must be legally entitled to work in Australia.  If you are not a NZ Citizen, you must have the right of permanent residence or a work permit.

title: ETL Developer (SSIS) - 6 Month Contract - Melbourne
description:
Landmark project in Melbourne requires an experienced SSIS Developer for 6 months.  SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to help design, develop, test and deploy a new data repository for this well-known large government organisation
        based in the CBD.  The main day to day responsibilities for the role will include:

Development of reporting solutions including ETL, data analysis, deployment activities.
Working as a part of the project / BAU teams to develop, test and implement SSIS ETL solution.
Assisting with deployment activities and supporting DEV, SIT, UAT and PROD phases of BAU releases/projects.
Provide level 2/3 production support and system maintenance, including analysis and resolution of system problems. 
Support with the transition of project deliverables into BAU.
 The below skills and experience are mandatory: 

3+ years of experience as a SQL and ETL developer using Integration Services MS SSIS (Must Have)
Data warehouse architecture knowledge including star schema, ODS and extract methodologies
Strong English Communication Skills

For more info please send your CV to paul@totalresource.com.au or hit the APPLY button

title: ETL Developer
description:
At CSKnexus we focus on the smallest of details for both clients and our employees and we help people get where they want to go. We believe that there are some definable attributes to become part of the Nexus Network that go above and
          beyond just technical skills.  That's what we are looking for - the attributes of a CSKnexus consultant. 
Responsible for the design, implementation and documentation of data load / integration interfaces, you will be required to translate high level technical designs into ETL processes using DataStage, provide effort estimates, status updates, testing
          and deployment orchestration 
Major Responsibilities:

Design, develop and document ETL processes using IBM DataStage.  Implement fixes and enhancements to existing solutions
Determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations
Write reusable unit and functional test scripts using SQL queries and data dictionary objects
Contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation

Practical and Technical Skills:

Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Highly developed conceptual, analytical, problem solving skills
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to work on current initiatives and prioritise and balance work accordingly
Minimum 6 years' hands on experience
Minimum 4 years' experience working in Netezza, Teradata or Exadata
Excellent working knowledge of database data dictionary objects (any DB)
Experience loading data from web / cloud services
Experience using Unix/Linux commands and shell scripting
Knowledge of DataStage 11.x for running and monitoring the projects
Ability to create DataStage sequences to run the batch jobs
Familiarity with BI/DW industry best practices
Familiarity with automated deployment methods and tools

Knowledge and Experience:

Tertiary qualification in engineering, IT or equivalent experience
8+ years' experience in Enterprise level IT organisation
Understanding of relevant developmental life cycles and technologies
Demonstrated experience in translating high level requirements into ETL deliverables
Demonstrated experience in hands on ETL Development and troubleshooting
Demonstrated experience in a large scale, complex system integration projects in a cross domain, cross-partner, multi-application, multi-sourced technology environment
Experience working across multiple SDLC's and within Agile, Iterative and Waterfall frameworks
 Only applicants with relevant experience will be contacted.

title: ETL Developer - Informatica
description:
6 months contract with a view to extend | Based in Macquarie park
ETL Developer with strong Informatica experience
Informatica BDE / BDM experience preferred 


Our client is looking for a ETL Developer with strong Informatica experience who will be responsible for the design, develop, test and implement Informatica ETL mappings to extract and load data from the source system into the Enterprise Data
          Warehouse and BI layer. 6 month contract starting ASAP. Ideally you will have:

Experience in documenting functional and design specifications for ETL development .

title: ETL Analyst
description:
ETL Analyst

Bathurst Location
Fixed Term 12 Month Contract

 
Position Overview 
 
The role is an entry level position located within the Office of Strategic Planning and Information and contributes to the development and maintenance of data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will be responsible for contributing
          to project enhancements, including data migration activities, and provide technical support and troubleshoot existing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions.
 
 
Key Responsibilities

Maintaining and testing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions, including Database objects, ETL (extract, transform, Load) and OLAP (online analytical processing) cubes to required development standards with guidance from the Manager,
            DWBI and other team members.
Contribute to data and code migration activities across environments.
Maintain reference data across multiple subject areas.
Undertake quality assurance activities, including unit testing and peer review, to ensure development standards and support for SIT/UAT (system integration testing and user acceptance testing).
Monitor the company’s data warehouse and business intelligence environment, troubleshooting and resolving issues as required.
Maintain data warehouse and business intelligence architectural and process documentation.
Maintain knowledge of data warehousing and business intelligence techniques and best practices.

 
Selection Criteria 
 
Essential

Exposure to data warehouse concepts and methodologies and ETL (Extract, transform, load) architecture.
Demonstrated self-motivation and a passion for learning new technologies, business processes and approaches.
Experience or working knowledge with SQL (structured query language) programming and Relational Databases.
Good problem solving and verbal and written communication skills.
Exposure to ETL tools.
Knowledge of Azure Cloud computing and related services.

If the above sounds like you and you're on the hunt for a dynamic, innovative, fast-paced environment this is the place for you!
We've already embarked upon our national headhunt campaign for this one so if this is an opportunity you're interested in then get your CV across asap!
To Your Success!
