title: C# ETL Developer
description:
The Market Data team is tasked with maintaining the integrity of all static data related to securities in support of our trading activities, including, but not limited to, instrument identifiers, end of day prices and corporate actions.
With growing business data requirements the team has recently embarked on the challenge to redesign our existing legacy system responsible for managing this critical information. True to the culture, they are looking to add a candidate to
          the team who can bring creative solutions to complex problems and thrives in an environment that encourages collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the lead developer on the following:

Analyse requirements & develop ETL modules
Develop user interface modules
Develop application components within existing framework
Configure CI/CD pipelines (dev ops)
Participate in discussions regarding system design concepts
Evaluate existing system performance and identify solutions for improvement

What we’re looking for:

Experience with large data sets and data management systems
Strong database and SQL knowledge and understanding of Database Design Principles (preferably Oracle PL/SQL)
Degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience
Good programming skills in C#, Python.
Good interpersonal and communication skills for interacting with traders, quantitative analysts and other software developers
Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure in a fast paced, team based environment

While a resume is preferable we also welcome tentative inquiries from well-qualified persons. Utmost confidentiality and discretion are assured. If interested, please email jared.stone@gqrgm.com

title: Project Manager - ETL Tool
description:
Our client are a leader within their industry, they operate nationally and are continuing to grow rapidly. Due to a large technology uplift program we seek an IT project manager to deliver an ETL tool implementation project.
The project is around moving from Infomatica ETL tool to Talend ETL tool. The responsibilities will involve:

Reviewing and solidifying project plan
Project status reporting
Managing vendors and data migration specialists
GM stakeholder management
Managing matrix team including stakeholders and resources overseas and interstate.

 
The larger themes of this project will be to deliver in a complex and transforming environment, you will ideally have knowledge of Infomatica or Talend ETL tools and have experience in implementation of an ETL tool.
The team environment is great, very supportive and productive. Furthermore the program has a 2 year lifespan thus a good pipeline of work.
This is a 12-month contract with immediate start (but will wait notice period if needed).
If you are interested please hit the apply button.
If you have any questions, don't hesitate to give Evan Xeres a call on 03 8080 7282.

title: ETL Data Engineer
description:
Our client, a leading national telecommunications solution provider is looking for ETL Data Engineer for their Analytics and Information Management team. You will be working in a small team of engineers developing traditional data warehouse. You
        will be working and taking directions from the Lead Delivery Engineer within the team to help develop world class engineering practices and solutions. Our client is looking for someone who is a fast learner and a confident self-starter, naturally
        curious and passionate about technology, but with varied interests; and an excellent communicator who yearns to develop AIM’s software engineering practice to help other engineers within AIM.    To be successful in the above roles, you must have experience in:

Analyzing, designing, developing and testing, a bit of everything.
Design, develop and document ETL processes using IBM DataStage over MPP warehouse (e.g. Netezza, Teradata)
Design and develop ETL using Spark will be advantageous, but not mandatory
Determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations.
Write reusable unit and functional test scripts using SQL queries and data dictionary objects
Experienced in data driven testing (i.e. golden sets) in functional testing
Contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation
Active participation to AIM development Community of Practice (CoP)
An eye for detail, and always look for continuous improvements
 Mandatory Requirements:

Strong SQL skills - ability to understand varying implemented patterns and complicated logic blocks and then write queries to enhance/modify or analyse further.
A person should be proactive and will challenge/enhance a solution for an epic. And can cut through the noise of the delivery process to understand the expectations the rest of the team will place on them.
A person should be able to explain a problem in a non-technical manner i.e. they can illustrate a problem to someone else either verbally, or diagrammatically, without fall back to technical/data detail. This ability also translates to detailing
            in writing.
Someone who is co-operative, focussed and can manage their work load
Strong stakeholder management skills
A clear communicator
 If you are currently eligible to work in Australia, possess the above skills and experience we would welcome your application.  For further information about this opportunity please view the vacancy posting in the Job Centre section of our
        website or feel free to call us on (03) 9347 3055, quoting reference number 832267-ST12832-1 ETL Data Engineer

title: ETL Developer
description:
We're looking for an individual who has high attention to detail and wants to challenge the status quo, going beyond "this is my job". You'll be experienced with SQL, ETL, Unix and database systems and managing multiple stakeholders. In this
          role, you will be supporting the internal teams in implementing our marketing automation solutions and contribute from the data engineering side to the delivery of high-quality API-first data solutions.
Responsibilities:


Build excellent relationship and interact with clients and subject matter experts to prioritise, negotiate and resolve conflict.


Execute unit tests, support system integration tests, deployment and post verification tests.


Support ongoing database management, providing insights into database optimisation, including data cleanliness and data segmentation.


Operate in a consultative approach to assist in developing technical specifications and support manuals for data acquisition, transformation and load/transfer processes from a variety of data sources.


Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand and execute change requests.


Develop SQL database solutions that meet requirement specifications and manage the end to end project lifecycle.


Design, develop and maintain data models and ETL solutions that meet requirement specifications.


Skills and Qualifications:


Relevant degree in Computer Science or ICT


Minimum 1-2 years of experience working as a Database Developer


Demonstrated knowledge & understanding of SQL, ETL, Unix, Programming languages (eg: Perl/Shell/Java/PHP), enterprise job scheduling tool and database systems


Knowledge & understanding of cloud services, Hadoop, and API building will be highly advantageous


Experience with Marketing Automation Tools such as Salesforce, Adobe, IBM Watson and etc will be highly desirable


Ability to learn new technologies and tools for various projects


Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)


Alchemist Benefits:


Competitive Rates


Office located in the heart of the city, just opposite the QVB in Townhall


Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices


Snacks, fruit and stocked pantry


Full access to our games room - pool table, foosball and table tennis table


Frequent team activities


Company sponsored annual trips


Regular team lunches


Casual attire

title: ETL Developer
description:
At CSKnexus we focus on the smallest of details for both clients and our employees and we help people get where they want to go. We believe that there are some definable attributes to become part of the Nexus Network that go above and
          beyond just technical skills.  That's what we are looking for - the attributes of a CSKnexus consultant. 
Responsible for the design, implementation and documentation of data load / integration interfaces, you will be required to translate high level technical designs into ETL processes using DataStage, provide effort estimates, status updates, testing
          and deployment orchestration 
Major Responsibilities:

Design, develop and document ETL processes using IBM DataStage.  Implement fixes and enhancements to existing solutions
Determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations
Write reusable unit and functional test scripts using SQL queries and data dictionary objects
Contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation

Practical and Technical Skills:

Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Highly developed conceptual, analytical, problem solving skills
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to work on current initiatives and prioritise and balance work accordingly
Minimum 6 years' hands on experience
Minimum 4 years' experience working in Netezza, Teradata or Exadata
Excellent working knowledge of database data dictionary objects (any DB)
Experience loading data from web / cloud services
Experience using Unix/Linux commands and shell scripting
Knowledge of DataStage 11.x for running and monitoring the projects
Ability to create DataStage sequences to run the batch jobs
Familiarity with BI/DW industry best practices
Familiarity with automated deployment methods and tools

Knowledge and Experience:

Tertiary qualification in engineering, IT or equivalent experience
8+ years' experience in Enterprise level IT organisation
Understanding of relevant developmental life cycles and technologies
Demonstrated experience in translating high level requirements into ETL deliverables
Demonstrated experience in hands on ETL Development and troubleshooting
Demonstrated experience in a large scale, complex system integration projects in a cross domain, cross-partner, multi-application, multi-sourced technology environment
Experience working across multiple SDLC's and within Agile, Iterative and Waterfall frameworks
 Only applicants with relevant experience will be contacted.

Java / J2EE development within Agile and Scrum environments.
Oracle or SQL experience
Experience of Informatica ETL processes
Competent with Continuous Integration
UNIX / Linux environments
Competent across the full SDLC
In depth understanding of multi-project and medium / large scale development projects.

Personal characteristics:

Data-driven individual
Able to lead teams whilst remaining hands on
Excellent communicator with ability to create immediate rapport
Professional and honest with a high level of integrity
You will ideally have both technical and functional experience; and
Be comfortable taking clients through the full project lifecycle, from pre-sales through to delivery completion.

Key Requirements

Strong technical background
Comfortable dealing with senior stakeholders (CFO's), gathering requirements and scoping solutions

Essential Work Permissions

Full working rights in Australia

title: ETL Developer
description:

title: Project Manager - ETL Tool
description:
Our client are a leader within their industry, they operate nationally and are continuing to grow rapidly. Due to a large technology uplift program we seek an IT project manager to deliver an ETL tool implementation project.
The project is around moving from Infomatica ETL tool to Talend ETL tool. The responsibilities will involve:

Reviewing and solidifying project plan
Project status reporting
Managing vendors and data migration specialists
GM stakeholder management
Managing matrix team including stakeholders and resources overseas and interstate.

 
The larger themes of this project will be to deliver in a complex and transforming environment, you will ideally have knowledge of Infomatica or Talend ETL tools and have experience in implementation of an ETL tool.
The team environment is great, very supportive and productive. Furthermore the program has a 2 year lifespan thus a good pipeline of work.
This is a 12-month contract with immediate start (but will wait notice period if needed).
If you are interested please hit the apply button.
If you have any questions, don't hesitate to give Evan Xeres a call on 03 8080 7282.

title: ETL Data Engineer
description:
Our client, a leading national telecommunications solution provider is looking for ETL Data Engineer for their Analytics and Information Management team. You will be working in a small team of engineers developing traditional data warehouse. You
        will be working and taking directions from the Lead Delivery Engineer within the team to help develop world class engineering practices and solutions. Our client is looking for someone who is a fast learner and a confident self-starter, naturally
        curious and passionate about technology, but with varied interests; and an excellent communicator who yearns to develop AIM’s software engineering practice to help other engineers within AIM.    To be successful in the above roles, you must have experience in:

Analyzing, designing, developing and testing, a bit of everything.
Design, develop and document ETL processes using IBM DataStage over MPP warehouse (e.g. Netezza, Teradata)
Design and develop ETL using Spark will be advantageous, but not mandatory
Determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations.
Write reusable unit and functional test scripts using SQL queries and data dictionary objects
Experienced in data driven testing (i.e. golden sets) in functional testing
Contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation
Active participation to AIM development Community of Practice (CoP)
An eye for detail, and always look for continuous improvements
 Mandatory Requirements:

Strong SQL skills - ability to understand varying implemented patterns and complicated logic blocks and then write queries to enhance/modify or analyse further.
A person should be proactive and will challenge/enhance a solution for an epic. And can cut through the noise of the delivery process to understand the expectations the rest of the team will place on them.
A person should be able to explain a problem in a non-technical manner i.e. they can illustrate a problem to someone else either verbally, or diagrammatically, without fall back to technical/data detail. This ability also translates to detailing
            in writing.
Someone who is co-operative, focussed and can manage their work load
Strong stakeholder management skills
A clear communicator
 If you are currently eligible to work in Australia, possess the above skills and experience we would welcome your application.  For further information about this opportunity please view the vacancy posting in the Job Centre section of our
        website or feel free to call us on (03) 9347 3055, quoting reference number 832267-ST12832-1 ETL Data Engineer
